loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es: El Joven Pablo Roberto tiene 35 años, tiene 6 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad es una pulpería, por lo que hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio que Inicio por la necesidad de tener un empleo y proveerle a su familia un medio de ingreso que le fuera de ayuda pues inicio con pocos productos, pero eran los más necesarios y los que sus clientes solicitaban, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido muy necesarios para el avance de su actividad. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, pan, gaseosas, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Pablo Roberto is 35 years old and has six children under his care. He has a general store. He has had this business for more than 8 years. He started it because he needed a job to provide income to support his family. He started with few products, only staples requested by his customers. This is not the first time he requests a loan as they are a necessary tool to advance his business. This loan will be used to purchase inventory such as snacks, juices, bread, sodas, detergent and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bella Leticia

texts.es:
Bella de 35 años, vive con sus hijos de 14 y 9 años en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas), tiene una pequeña carnicería. 

Su esposo comenzó con el negocio para poder mantener a su familia, ella al verlo trabajar también quiso ayudar con los gastos familiares y tener su propia carnicería. Cuando se separo de su esposo ella por su cuenta invirtió sus ahorros en carnes para tener su propia carnicería. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Las carnes le traen cada dos días los proveedores.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes de todo tipo para que sus clientes tengan diversidad al comprar. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio mas grande para que le ayuden sus hijas cuando ya crezcan.
texts.en:
Bella, 35, lives with her children, ages 14 and 19, in Paraíso de Guayaquil (city outskirts with dirt roads and houses in the mountains). She has a small butcher shop. 

Her husband began the business in order to take care of their family. Watching her husband work made Bella want to help with household expenses as well and have her own butchershop. When she separated from her husband, she invested her savings in meats for her own butcher shop. Since then, the has worked every day from 7AM until 11PM. Suppliers bring her meat every two days. 

With the loan, Bella wants to buy all kinds of meat so that she can offer her customers variety. In the future she wants to have a bigger business so that her children can help her when they grow up.

loans.use: Meat for Butcher Shop

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gregoria del Carmen H. M., tiene la edad de 51 años, habitante del barrio Laureles Norte, es casada y su esposo labora como vendedor ambulante, ellos tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad que viven en Costa Rica, la mayor es casada y le ayudan a sus padres en los gastos en que se incurre, ellos tienen un negocio de comida típica nicaragüense,  desde hace mas de 12 años, el cual ha sido el sustento económico de su familia, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes, y utensilios de comida que le permitan aumentar su producción para elevar sus ventas y la posibilidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, sobre todo que desea que cuando sus hijos vengan de visita con su familias, tener las condiciones adecuadas para ellos, eso sería para ella de gran satisfacción a su vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria del Carmen H. M. is 51 years old and lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood.  She is married and her husband works as an itinerant salesman.  They have 4 grown-up children who live in Costa Rica and their eldest daughter is married.  Gregoria's children help their parents to cover their expenses.

Gregoria has had a business selling traditional Nicaraguan food for more than 12 years.  It has helped her to support her family and she are requesting a loan for her business so that she can buy groceries and cooking utensils which will enable her to increase production and also sales.  This will allow her to improve her living conditions.

Gregoria would like to be able to adequately accommodate her children when they come to visit with their families.  This would give her great satisfaction in life.

loans.use: To buy groceries and cooking utensils for her business

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi a 34 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle fait la vente de produits d’alimentation. Elle compte dans cette activité près de 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et expose ses produits à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Akouvi is 34 years old and the mother of two children. To improve her children’s living conditions, she sells food products. She has almost ten years experience in this activity. She buys her stocks at the big market of Lomé and displays her merchandise in front of her house. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to meet a steadily increasing demand.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 34-year-old single mother of 2 who lives with her children in Puntarenas, Corredores, in the southern region of Costa Rica. Throughout her time as a client of Fundación Mujer (since 1997), María has displayed her ability to be a responsible client and make punctual repayments.  Maria has spent the last 8 years dedicated to her productive activity:  the sale of catalogue items such as sports clothing and cosmetics. 

Maria is divorced and struggles every month to make ends meet.  Currently, she is living on a property owned by her sister.  Maria hopes to use this loan to invest in various catalogue items which she intends to sell.  She says that in order to improve the efficiency of her business, she needs to wake up earlier and be more organized. Her goals are to sell more products and to fully satisfy the needs of her clients. 
 
Maria says her main obstacle is the high level of competition in her area. Many catalogue vendors are competing for the same clients.  She has also had trouble with collecting payments for sales she makes on credit.

loans.use: To purchase sports clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
Sonia vive en Puente Piedra un lugar D. lima con gente muy trabajadora y emprendedora como ella, casada y con 3 hijos que aun son pequeños siempre busco la manera D. apoyar a su esposo, por  un tiempo vendió jugos en el centro D. la ciudad pero a pesar que el negocio era bueno  la distancia fue un impedimento por que sus  hijos se quedaban solos por  mucho tiempo, fue por esto que junto a su esposo decidieron poner una bodega en su misma casa, su negocio recién esta surgiendo lo que mas venD. son frutas D. la estación y dulces como galletas,biscochos,chocolates y gaseosas, la venta es muy buena sobretodo en temporada escolar debido a que su bodega esta junto a un colegio D. niños,  con su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su hija para que pueda seguir estudios superiores D. computación e informática, por otro lado ya le falta poco para terminar algunos acabados D. lo que será un local mas granD. para su negocio, su préstamo actual lo usara para la compra D. gaseosas y muchas golosinas ella es la secretaria del grupo “MADRES LADEREÑAS” . 

  * Sonia es la tercera D. las sentadas.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in Puente Piedra, an area of Lima with hard-working and enterprising people like her. She is married with 3 young children. She is always looking for a way to support her husband. For some time, she sold juice in the center of the city, but because this business was far, her children stayed by themselves a lot. As a result, she and her husband decided to start a general store in their house. Recently, her business was growing, and she mostly sold seasonal fruit and sweets, including cookies, sponge cakes, chocolates, and sodas. Her business does best during the school year because her store is near a high school. With her business, she has been able to help her daughter so that she can continue studying computers and informatics. On the other hand, she still lacks a little bit to complete a larger location for her business. Her current loan will be usd to buy sodas and more sweets. She is the secretary of the “MADRES LADEREÑAS” group.

*Sonia is the third of the seating women

loans.use: To buy sodas, cookies, and sweets for her store

loans.name: Swafiya Ahmed

texts.en:
Swafiya Ahmed H. is a 48 years old lady. She is married to Joseph and they have eight children. Swafiya is a fish monger and she also sells fish. She has been in this business for the last three years.

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase more fishing equipments. From the anticipated profits she plans to open a food Kiosk. Her hopes and dreams are to succeed through fishing and become a supplier.

loans.use: purchase more fishing equipments

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma T. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 55 years old. Emma is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copra in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Emma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy G. is 39 years old and married with 3 school-aged children who all attend school.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 15 years in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. Her main products are milk, maize and potatoes, which are all sold locally. She also earns income from her cereals business in the same region. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The extra income from the sale of eggs will enable her pay school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to own a big wholesale store for her cereals.

loans.use: To begin poultry farming

loans.name: Estrelita's Group

texts.en: Estrelita P. is from the village of Maligaya Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 60 years old. Estrelita is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Estrelita is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Estrelita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Estrelita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Estrelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lonkisa

texts.en:
Lonkisa O. K. is 36 years old. He is married with one child. For the past five years, Lonkisa has been farming in Narok town and earns a good income.
  
He learned about KADET LTD from the KADET staff. He is applying for his second loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standard of his family.

Lonkisa's dream is to thrive in farming. 
He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Marilyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like duck boiled eggs or balut and also pork and chicken barbecue in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and increase working capital. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like duck eggs, chicken and pork. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like duck eggs, chicken and pork

loans.name: Neb

texts.en:
Neb L. earns a living by selling a few fresh fish in the local market in Siem Reap province. She is a 41-year-old widow woman who currently lives with two single children who are still attending the local school. 

Neb L. will use her loan in order to buy additional fresh fish for resale. Neb L. believes she can increase her daily income by using this Kiva loan as an advance.

loans.use: To buy additional fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is the wife of Muhammad who appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman and a mother of five daughters and one son. Randa's husband is a taxi driver.

Randa's husband wants to fix the car he drives in order to have a better income as the car would be working for longer hours with better performance.

loans.use: to repair the taxi Randa's husband drives.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris tiene 50 años de edad y es soltera.  Vive en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en la parte rural del distrito de Mochumi en el departamento de Lambayeque. 

Iris se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, zapatillas, zapatos y otros. Para poder desarrollar su actividad, Iris ha instalado su negocio en su casa. Ella cuenta con una muy buena ubicación estratégica para la venta.

Iris tiene muchos  clientes en su zona y cuenta con la fidelidad de muchos de ellos. Su negocio es muy conocido  pues esta actividad  la realiza hace 4 años.  
Iris esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de  S/. 1,500 nuevos soles  para la compra de mercadería e innovar su negocio con ropa y calzado de temporada. 

Iris quiere brindar mejores productos a sus clientes y ampliar su negocio, para que ella pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que Iris cuenta con clientela ya establecida.

Iris es un cliente antiguo  para Edpyme Alternativa, y solo trabaja con esta institución. Iris, en todo momento, ha demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Iris is 50 years old and single.  She lives in her own house, which is located in the rural part of the Mochumi district in the Lambayeque department.

Iris sells clothing, slippers, shoes, and other items.  In order to develop her business, Iris has set it up in her house.  She has a very good strategic sales location.  She has a lot of customers in her zone, and she has the loyalty of many of them.  Her business is very well-known because she has been doing this for four years.

Iris is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise and to set her business up with clothes and seasonal footwear.

Iris wants to offer her customers better products.  She wants to expand her business in order to be able to improve the quality of her life.  Because Iris has established customers in her zone, there is not a lot of competition in her line of work.

Iris is a longtime client of Edpyme Alternative, and she only works with this institution.  Iris has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality at all times.

loans.use: to set her business up with clothes and seasonal footwear.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old.  She is married and has three children. 

Erlinda is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a dry goods business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  Erlinda has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy stocks for her dry goods business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy stocks for her dry goods business

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, está casado, vive con su esposa y tienen 4 hijos, Rafael desde muy temprano inicia sus labores con el ganado, empieza con el ordeño de las vacas a las 4:00am, es un trabajo que requiere tiempo, él aprendió por herencia de sus padres.
Actualmente quiere comprar unas vacas y comprarles alimentos, vacunas y vitaminas, con esta compra le ayudara a tener en mejores condiciones el ganado, dándole lugar a comercializarlo mejor.
El sueño de Rafael es aumentar el número de reces, garantizar una mejor solvencia económica a su familia, ya que es un poco grande y requiere de mucho esfuerzo para tener una vida confortable.
texts.en:
Rafael is married. He lives with his wife and their four children. Very early in the morning, Rafael starts his work of taking care of his cattle. He milks the cows starting at 4am. This job requires a great amount of time. He learned this trade from his parents.

At the moment, Rafael wants to buy a few cows as well as feed, vaccines, and vitamins. This purchase will help improve the condition of his cattle, which will give them a better chance of being sold at market.

Rafael’s dream is to increase the number in his herd so that his family will be in better financial standing. He has a large family, so it requires much effort to provide them with a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase cows, feed, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Basha

texts.en: Basha is married and has two children. She sells provisions at Abura, which she has done for five years. Her husband is a cashier. Basha's income is used to assist her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She wants to further grow her business, so the new profit will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris de 44 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rómulo de 55 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Doris es la compra y venta de pescado, su constante animo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocida, ya que ella vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es una vendedora muy alegre que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que sale de los pescados, ya que este se le pega en la ropa. Espera tener en el futuro un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender pescado sin temor a que se malogren con el calor del sol. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, por la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar su congeladora, ya que con el paso de los años se ha deteriorado, con el dinero que le quede comprará más pescado para tener más mercadería para vender.
texts.en:
Doris, 44, is a simple, hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband Rómulo, 55, and their four dear children, for whom they want to provide the best lifestyle possible.  Doris buys and sells fish for a living.  Her constant desire to get ahead is what encouraged her to get involved in this business, and little by little she has become well known.  She sells the freshest and tastiest fish at the market and is a cheerful saleslady who always receives her customers with a smile.  What she enjoys most about her work is talking to the customers.  She has been in business for 13 years and believes the hardest part is having to put up with the strong fish smell that gets into her clothing.  

In the future she hopes to have a small refrigerator so she can sell the fish without the fear of it going bad because of the heat.  This is her seventh loan through MFP and she is happy to have obtained it and committed to paying it back on time.  In her communal bank she is a much-loved member because of the joy she brings into the group.  With the 1,500 PEN she has requested she plans to fix her freezer which has deterioriated over the years.  With the rest of the money she will buy more fish to have more volume to sell.

loans.use: To fix her freezer and buy more fish.

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001.Il est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou Ousmane qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique villageois où elle vend divers produits tels: du riz, du sucre, du thé, des biscuits etc. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront  de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille (nourriture, santé, etc.…)
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on February 12, 2001. It is composed of eleven women who all live in the same district. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Fatou Ousmane, who is on the right of the picture raising her hand, is the group's leader. She is 35 years old. She is married and a mother of four. She also takes care of five other children entrusted to her by their parents.

She is the owner of a local shop, where she sells various products such as rice, sugar, tea, cookies and such. She is quite experienced in this business, since she has been at it for several years.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and to better develop her activities. The profit will make it possible for her to participate in the improvement of the family's living conditions (food, healthcare, etc.)

loans.use: buy products for her local food store.

loans.name: Khaliss

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de trois garçons et trois filles. Sa principale activité est le mareyage ; elle achète du poisson en gros aux piroguiers qui viennent de débarquer  pour le revendre en détails  sur le quai de pèche aux consommateurs. Elle a hérité cette activité de son père  qu’elle accompagnait toute jeune au port. Après 15 ans, elle a pu acquérir en épargnant sur ses modestes bénéfices, une pirogue de pêche qui lui rapportait d’importants revenus. Cette dernière a malheureusement été détruite par une tempête en pleine mer ; ce qui fait que la femme ne compte plus que sur la vente de poisson pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Elle a obtenu deux financements de l’IMCEC de 200 000F chacun, remboursés entièrement sans retards. Elle sollicite actuellement un troisième crédit de 500 000FCFA pour augmenter son fonds de roulement. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 03 caisses de « thiof », 02 caisses de mérou et 01 caisse de « ras cass ». Son ambition est d’acheter une nouvelle pirogue dans un futur proche et de construire plus tard une maison pour loger la famille.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman who is the mother of three boys and three girls. Her main work involves fish trading; she buys fish in bulk from boatmen who have just landed, and then she sells the fish retail to consumers on the docks. This business was handed down to her from her father whom she accompanied at a very young age at the port. After fifteen years, she was able to acquire a fishing canoe by saving her modest profits. The canoe was bringing in substantial income. Unfortunately, it was destroyed by a storm at sea; and so, this woman can now count on only selling fish to support herself and her family members. She obtained two IMCEC loans of 200,000 francs CFA each, and she has repaid them completely and on time. She is now requesting a third loan of 500,000 francs to increase her working capital. With this loan, she intends to buy 3 cases of thiof (a species of grouper), 2 cases of mérou (another type of grouper), and a case of ras cass. Her ambition is to buy a new fishing canoe in the near future and to build a house later on in order to house her family.

loans.use: to buy cases of different types of fish

loans.name: Parsaon

texts.en:
Parsaon has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 33 years old and married. His wife is a housewife and they are blessed with four children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staffs in his area of abode. Since this is his third loan, he plans to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Myriam tiene 46 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de su padre y son su razón de vivir. Su emprendimiento de hace 17 años se ha mantenido hasta hoy, en su casa ha instalado su fuente de soda porque se ubica al frente de un parque muy transitada, cual es una ventaja para su negocio. Es así que todos los días se dedica a su negocio, y en la cocina ha contratado a un chef que prepara comidas al paso, del mismo modo vender también toda clase de bebidas gasificadas de acuerdo al pedido y demanda de su clientela. Hace 3 años tomó una decisión importante para su negocio, pues la remodeló por lo que tuvo un costo muy alto que la beneficio, porque poco a poco más clientela acude a su establecimiento  sobre todo los fines  de semana, convirtiéndose en una buena opción de esparcimiento y entretenimiento, tiene proyectos de seguir mejorando e implementando su negocio por lo que continuará esforzándose. Desde que accedió a los créditos de MFP de manera grupal de las cuales ha demostrado su responsabilidad  y liderazgo en su grupo como buen ejemplo de inversión en 8  veces que solicita el crédito. Y en esta oportunidad invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de una cocina industrial que le es muy necesario en su negocio.
texts.en:
Myriam, age 46, lives with her two children in her father’s house.  They are her reason for living.  Her business, which she has had for 17 years so far, is a soda fountain that she has installed at her house.  It is located in front of a heavily traveled park, which is an advantage for her business.

She devotes herself to her business every day.  She has hired a chef to work in the kitchen and prepare fast food.  She also sells all types of carbonated drinks according to customer requests and demand.

Three years ago she made an important decision about her business.  She remodeled it, and the cost was very high.  It was beneficial because little by little more customers come to her establishment, especially on the week-ends.  It has become a good option for leisure time and entertainment.

She has projects to continue improving and implementing in her business.  Therefore, she will continue her efforts.  Since she has had the group loans from MFP she has demonstrated her responsibility and leadership in her group.  She has served as a good investment example in the eight times she has requested a loan.

This time she will use the money from the loan to buy an industrial stove, which she really needs in her business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a businesswoman aged 38; she is married and blessed with four children. For the last three years, she has been managing a retail shop to make a living. She also does horticultural farming for more income. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, salt and rice. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save the income she earns from her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme de 30 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent commercial. Elle a 01 enfant.
Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques depuis 2009. Elle fait ce commerce à la devanture de sa maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Akouavi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akouavi voudrait diversifier ses offres de médicament. Elle veut assurer la scolarité de son enfant jusqu’à sa maturité.
texts.en: Akouavi is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to a salesman. She has one child. Akouavi has been selling pharmaceutical products since 2009. She does this in the storefront of her house. She buys the products in Lomé. Akouavi applied for her first loan at WAGES in order to buy pharmaceutical products. In the coming years, Akouavi would like to diversify her medicinal offerings. She wants to ensure her child’s education until adulthood.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a hardworking businesswoman who is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last seven years, she has been managing a beauty shop to earn a living. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business premise. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy lotions and hair weaves.

loans.use: To buy lotion and hair weaves

loans.name: Ivania

texts.es: La señora Ivania es pastelera y trabaja con su familia en su confitería. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un horno industrial, pues con esta actividad (elaboración de pasteles y tortas) cubre los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de sopocachi en la Ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene un hijo. Ivania se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, pues ayudaron a implementar su confitería. Ahora, con la compra del horno industrial podrá aumentar el volumen de su producción, reducir costos de electricidad y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ivania is a pastry chef, and she works with her family in their pastry shop.

She needs the loan to buy an industrial oven.  This business activity (making pies and cakes) covers the family’s expenses.  

She lives in her own house in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single and has one child.

Ivania is very pleased with the previous loans she received.  They helped her establish her pastry shop.

Now, with the purchase of the industrial oven, she will be able to increase the volume of her production, reduce electricity expenses, and get improved income.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to facilitate cake production in her business.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a widow with four children and all of them currently enrolled in school. Mwanamkuu operates a grocer business and sells her goods from home and door-to-door. She's worked in this business for four years and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Mwanamkuu's other source of income includes family contributions. She describes her greatest business challenge to be reaching customers during the rainy season and her highest monthly expense is food.

Mwanamkuu will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more onions, potatoes and tomatoes. Mwanamkuu aspires to open her own grocery store in the future. She joined Yehu because they provide small loans that suit her needs.

loans.use: To buy more onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 48 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

Ailyn has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Ailyn has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Ailyn hopes to have a fishing boat.

Ailyn is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from the village of San Manuel. She is 44 years old. Delia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Delia operates her husband's furniture manufacturing business. They sell general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Delia is requesting a new loan of P 13,000, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand their product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials need in her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 54 years old and married to Mohammed. They have two children who are grown and in college. For the past 3 years she has been running a catering service.  She also owns rental houses, which she runs as a secondary business. Her income is KES 20,000 per month.

Halima was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to buy bales of wheat flour, cooking fat, maize flour, and repair one of her rental houses.  The anticipated profits will help her provide for her family. She hopes to expand her business and invest more in real estate in the future.

loans.use: to buy bales of wheat flour, cooking fat, maize flour, and repair one of her rental houses.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace, 47, a resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mariano, a local official, and mother to their two children. She and her husband and children manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Grace operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Grace hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she hopes to send all of her children to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a 22-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 1 child who is 5 years old and goes to school. 

Bibiana runs a small hotel business, and she has been in business for 1 year. She has 2 employees. Bibiana heard about Finance Sudan through the fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loans officers. She is taking a loan of 500 to purchase more food items to be cooked. Other than this business, Bibiana has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Bibiana would like to hope for a good house.

Her major challenges include home expenses although her husband helps with support in the form of cash.

Bibiana says that she is happy for finance Sudan’s support.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to be cooked

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 30-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s single, living with her only parent and three working siblings. Her brother contributes to all of the family expenses. As for her, she started to work as a hairdresser from her home in 2010. She knows chic and stylish haircuts which help attract more customers. Today, she’s looking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new hairdressing supplies. She notes that this will increase her job productivity by 10%. In the future, she plans to open her own salon and hire people to work with her.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing supplies.

loans.name: Ana Aida

texts.es:
Ana, solicita de nuevo un nuevo préstamo con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio de tamales y comprar los ingredientes que necesita como: pollo, maíz, hojas de huerta, consomés, cominos, de esa forma podrá lo que necesita para atender mejor a sus clientes.
La intension de Ana es tener un negocio estable por eso se apoya de los prestamos que le ayudan a seguir con su negocio, ya que por falta de recursos ya no podía continuar y ahora han mejorado sus circunstancias de su familia y las ganancias han aumentado.
texts.en: Ana is requesting another loan with the objective of investing in her tamale business and buying ingredients that she needs like chicken, maize, orchard leaves, bouillon, cumin. In this way, she will have what she needs to serve her customers better. Ana's intention is to have a stable business so she relies on the loans that help her to continue with her business since, due to a lack of resources, she couldn't continue and now her family's circumstances have improved and her earnings have increased.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, maize, orchard leaves, bouillon, cumin.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Bougoura, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec ASSAN, 2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 205.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with an average age of 48, on average 6 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Bougoura, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Assan, sitting second from the left in the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 205 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Mrs Altantuya, age 39, lives with her husband and two children in a rental home in Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is driver and her older daughter is college student, her younger daughter is secondary school student. Altantuya started her second hand clothes retailing business in 2011. Currently, her daily sales incom is 15.000-20.000 MNT. She has many regular suppliers and buyers. She is requesting a 700.000MNT to increase her working capital, because during the new session, her business demand increases. Thus, He wants to buy more products she sells in order to increase my business income as well as profit. Her husband helps with her business. She is a friendly and brave woman who says, "When my business expands in the next few years, I will build a own apartment for my family."

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to increase her working capital

loans.name: Fara

texts.fr:
Fara est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 49 ans. Elle est mariée mais son mari n'a pas d'activité source de revenu à cause de son infirmité due à un accident donc il ne peut plus travailler. Le couple a 3 enfants, tous déjà grand. 
Elle est dans la vente de friperie depuis 1991 et elle en est à son 3eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Elle a commencé ce travail depuis l’accident de son mari. Depuis cette période, elle était la seule à subvenir aux besoins du ménage ainsi qu’à l’éducation de ses enfants. 
Elle a pour objectif de devenir grossiste en friperie et ainsi avoir plusieurs points de vente.

loans.use: acheter des balles de sous-vêtements et de lingerie : Soutien-gorge, slip.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. is 56 years old, married with 5 children. Three of her children are independent while the others are in a technical college.

Jane has been running her shop for more than 18 years, realizing a net income of approximately $180 per month. She also has a small farm from which she gets additional income and food for her family.

As a member of a dairy farming group, she will greatly increase her income given that she has all other necessary resources.

loans.use: She intends to purchase a hybrid dairy cow, which can produce a lot of milk.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer has ten years of experience in the business of selling clothes, a trade she learned through working with her mother. When her mother went to another country, she took over the business, since she already knew the suppliers. That's how she has keep the business going until today. She works every day of the week, from 10:00 AM until 6:00 PM.

Jennifer wants this loan in order to be able to buy seasonal articles, as she already has a lot of orders, and in that way to supply her business.

Jennifer is a single mother, she has 2 children who are in school. Currently she is living in her mother's house, because her mother is living in Italy and Jennifer is taking care of the house, hoping one day to be able to have her own little house and to give a better life to her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Jennifer lleva ya 10 años en el negocio de la venta de ropa, actividad que la aprendió de su señora la madre a la cual le ayudaba. Su mama tuvo que viajar y ella tomo el negocio ya que conocía las personas a las que les dejaba mercadería y así fue como hasta el día de hoy ella mantiene el negocio. Lo trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 10 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Jennifer desea el crédito para poder comprar prendas para la temporada ya que tiene bastante pedido, y así también poder surtir su negocio. Jennifer es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian. Actualmente vive en la casa de la mama, ya que la señora esta residiendo en Italia y Jennifer a quedado al cuidado de la casa, esperando algún día poder tener su propia casita y darle una mejor vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Sitaua

texts.en: Sitaua is a hard-working woman of forty-nine years of age.  She has eight children that live with her in a small village in Samoa.  Sitaua strives very hard.  She is very grateful for the support of her husband and children in helping her reach her dreams.  She makes snacks to sell at a canteen that she operates on Fridays and Saturdays in the local village.  She sells flavored ices, cakes, buns and a variety of packaged snacks.  Sitaua feels confident that investing time and money in her business is the only way to really bring in the extra income necessary to raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase food containers and coolers

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad Q. is 35 and lives in Imishli with his family. He is married and has three children. He owns a small sheep herd, and he has applied for a loan of $1,200 USD to start a farm and purchase a milk cow and a calf.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow and a calf

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Business Description

Ricardo began his business 7 years ago. He sells black galvanized round tubes and square tubes in 3 and 4 inch sizes. He provides direct customer service every day from 8am to 5pm.

Use of the Loan

Ricardo needs this loan to invest in more new materials in a variety of sizes. This way he can offer his clients new options.

Personal Information

Ricardo is 54 years old. His wife helps him with the customers. Unfortunately they cannot have children, but they are motivated to take care of their parents. They began their business with loaned capital. They run their business out of their home. Ricardo hopes to grow with his business and in this way improve the condition and maintenance of his home.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Ricardo inicio su negocio hace 7 años. Los productos que vende son: Tubos redondos galvanizados y tubos cuadrados de color negro de 3 y4 pulgadas. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8am-a -5pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Ricardo necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de más y nuevos materiales de varias medidas. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Ricardo tiene 54años. Su esposa le ayuda en la atención. Lamentablemente no pueden tener hijos. Razón que les motivo a velar por el bienestar de sus padres. Su negocio lo inicio con capital prestado. El cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa. Aspira crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y la mantención de su hogar.

loans.use: To invest in a greater quantity of products to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet's nut-grinding business begins in an 8’ x 8’ cinder block shed next to her house used to store feed for her husband’s chickens: cinder block with a steel door, so the rodents don’t get in. Inside with the feed are the peanuts and her grinder.  Janet is a 50-year old mother of six children and two dependents. She has two businesses: a retail shop and a nut grinding business. It is not uncommon for people in her village of Mutundwe to have several businesses. Her retail business makes cakes and muffins. This is a woman is a very hard worker with great energy. She will use her loan to buy larger bags of nuts, and flour, sugar and salt for her retail shop. (If you would like to learn more, please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: "Alinyikira: Continue Hard Work")

loans.use: Janet will use her loan to buy larger bags of nuts in addition to more flour, sugar and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING SMALL PRINTER

loans.name: Kambere's Group

texts.en:
Kambere T. is a 30 year old married mother of 4 (15, 13, 10, and 8) who sells Batengi (tie die clothing). With the loan she will purchase more stock from the Congo to increase her sales. With the profits she will buy ventilators for her home.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To import more stock for her business

loans.name: Nankulabye C(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for seven months. Agnes is 28 years old and marrried with two children. She sells raw foods in the market. She wans to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children. Mary, Alice and Christine all have bar businesses while Florence sells milk.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in matooke business

loans.name: Mahmadaly

texts.ru:
Mahmadaly Turaevich B. lives in the region of Khuroson. He is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. He has secondary education. Mahmadaly owns a grocery store in his kishlak (village). He brings the merchandise from Dushanbe (capital of Tajikistan) from wholesalers and resells at this store. This allows the local residents to buy groceries in their kishlak without having to travel to outside markets and spending extra money. This business is the only source of income for Mahmadaly's family and that's why it's very well set up. He plans to use the loan to increase the capital turnover and sales. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоев Махмадали Тураевич житель района Хуросон. Возраст 40 лет, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания.Имеет магазин в своем кишлаке , завозит товар из города Душанбе приобретая у оптовых реализаторов и продает со своего магазина. Это позволяет населению делать покупки прямо в кишлаке не выезжая на рынки и не тратя деньги на дорогу. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому его бизнес хорошо налажен.Клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is the enthusiastic mother of a nineteen-year-old daughter.  She has been selling undergarments at a small stand in a crowded alley of central Kumasi for fifteen years.  This is her second loan through Sinapi Aba Trust.  With her first loan, she saw a marked increase in sales.  She plans on using this loan to further increase her inventory of lingerie and to buy better quality products.   With her increased sales, she hopes to save more and support her daughter.  

Felicia is a member of the trust group Pillar of God.  The trust group uses peer pressure as a form of social collateral to help ensure that each member of the group repays their share.  

Felicia is pictured on the right.  To the left is Annastasia, her loan officer.

loans.use: To add more lingerie and different types of undergarments to her inventory

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena was born in 1958 and is married. She lives in the town of Derventa with her husband and three children. Both of them have a pension of 550 KM.

Milena will use this loan of 1,200 KM to buy parts for the computer. She uses her computer to keep books for a few companies and she wants to provide more efficient service so that she can earn more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy parts for the computer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A., a married woman with 3 children, travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities to sell to her customers in smaller quantities. Business is going very well, but the cost of transportation is a major problem. Mary is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital. This would allow her to buy more food per trip.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: Bernadette Gbedande

texts.fr: Born on November 26, 1961 in Cotonou in Littoral County, Mrs. Bernadette Gbedande S. comes from Porto-Novo. She is married and the mother of 3 school-age children: Kalice (18) in eleventh grade, Irène (15) in eighth grade, and Roger (11) who is in fourth grade. She retails bread and also makes cakes that she distributes to other retailers. She is asking for this loan so as to increase her production capacity and to satisfy her customers. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerNée le 26/11/1961 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral, dame S. Bernadette Gbedande est originaire de Porto-Novo. Mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont Kalice âgé de 18 ans est en classe de Seconde, Irène âgée de 15 ans est en classe de Quatrième et Roger âgé de 11 ans est en classe de CM2. Elle est revendeuse de pain et fabrique en plus des gâteau qu'elle distribue à d'autres revendeuses. Elle demande ce crédit pour augmenter sa capacité de production et pour satisfaire ses clients.

loans.use: Improve the quality of her bread and buy 25 kg of wheat flourAugmenter la quantité de pain et acheter 25 kg de farine de blé.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chun N., 29, earns income raising pigs and making rice wine. She makes around US$4 per day. Her husband is a fisherman in Tonle Sap Lake and makes around US$3 per day. N. and her husband have three children, and the family lives in the Thnal Dach Village, Siem Reap Province. N. currently needs a loan of US$500 to purchase pigs to raise, as well as to buy fishing tools for her husband's business. The loan will allow N. to expand her business and increase the family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of 1) pigs to raise and 2) tools for fishing

loans.name: Zainab's Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Zainab is 24 years old. She is married with a two-year-old child. She has been selling khanga and vitenge (traditional clothing) since 2005, working from 8am to 6pm each day.

Zainab requests a loan in order to buy more khanga and vitenge to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her sub-group member, Fatma, who sells potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and vitenge for her clothing business.

loans.name: Krut

texts.en:
Mr. Krut K., 64, and his wife, Mrs. Rab Aum, 58, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1969 and have seven children; two sons and five daughters. Two of their children are married; one of them lives in the family home. Two other children are garment factory workers. One son raises cows and the youngest one studies in a local school.

Mr. Krut has been a construction contractor for eight years. Beside the construction business, he and his wife have been farming since 1980. They grow rice to sell and for food. Currently, the couple is building their new house and lack the money to build the staircase of the house. Therefore, Krut is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to build a staircase for his house. Part of the money will go for purchasing a water pumping machine for growing rice.

loans.use: To build the staircase of his house and purchase a water pump for growing rice

loans.name: Mamadou  Bamba

texts.fr: Monsieur L. est un jeune agé d'une trentaine d 'années ,il est marié et pére de famille. Son activitée principale est la production de poulets de chaire .Le pret solliciter permettra de renforcer ses activités de production de poulets destinées à ravitailler les restaurants de la ville en viande de poulets.
texts.en:
Mr. L. is approximately 30 years old, he is married and the father of a family. His business consists in raising chickens. The loan he is seeking will enable him to bolster his business of raising chicken destined for the restaurants of the city.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry farming

loans.name: Lébenssao

texts.fr:
Née le 03 mars 1981 à Bombouaka, madame K. Lébenssao est une jeune commerçante qui n’a pas encore d’enfants. Elle vit actuellement à Adétikopé ou elle mène ses activités de commerce d'alimentation générale qu’elle gère bien. Honnête, elle a une maîtrise parfaite de son activité. 

Pour renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat de cartons de laits et de sucres, spaghettis, boites de tomates et autres produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born on March 3, 1981 in Bombouaka, Ms. Lébenssao K. is a young merchant who still does not have any children. She currently lives in Adétikopé where she does commerce in groceries, a business she manages well. An honest woman, she has perfect command of her work. To bolster her business and to make it profitable, she is requesting a loan for buying boxes of milk, sugar, spaghetti, canned tomatoes, and other food provisions. This will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in groceries

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline Mané, mariée, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce de tissus teintés. Elle achète le bazin et les produits chimiques pour faire la teinture et vendre des draps. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Mané, married and raising 6 children, has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba for 7 and a half years. She wants a loan to bolster her tie-dyed cloth business. She buys "bazin" (damask cloth) and the chemicals necessary to do the dyeing and then sells the tie-dyed cloth. Her income permits her to contribute to the family's living expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.d

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth and chemicals for tie-dyeing cloth for sale

loans.name: Boris

texts.es: Boris tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Es un emergente comerciante de su localidad, hace 2 años decidió arriesgar y  generar su propia fuente de ingreso con una bodega instalada en una zona céntrica y comercial de su ciudad, Boris abastece a sus clientes con productos de primera necesidad y su atención es todos los días, incluso los días domingos. Este es un negocio familiar, ya que las tareas son compartidas con su esposa, y juntos siempre están al pendiente de su bodega, la meta familiar es acrecentar la mercadería y ser una gran distribuidora de productos de primera necesidad, ellos saben que esto es un gran reto, que requieren mover mayor cantidad de capital, y en esto se esfuerzan cada día para ahorra al máximo las ganancias. Es la segunda vez que Boris solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir trabajando responsablemente. En esta ocasión solicita una cantidad para invertir en la compra de mercadería por ocasión de fiestas de fin de año, como cajas de leche, chocolates para taza y panteones.
texts.en:
Boris is thirty eight years old and lives with his wife and children. He is an emerging merchant of his area. Two years ago, he decided to take a risk and generate his own source of income with a grocery store installed in a commercial and central zone of his city. Boris supplies his clients with necessities, and he works every day, including Sundays. This is a family business, since the shop's tasks are shared with his wife, and together they are always devoting themselves to their work. The family goal is to increase their merchandise and to be a large distributor of necessities. They know that this is a great challenge, that requires them to move a greater quantity of capital, and they endeavor each day to save the maximum amount of profits. This is the second time that Boris is requesting a loan with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, with which they promise to continue working responsibly. This time they are requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchasing of merchandise for the year's end festivities, like boxes of milk, and chocolates for hot chocolate and cemetery visits.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de la mercadería de su bodega

loans.name: Rokiatou

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Rokiatou C. est une célibataire de 28 ans et mère d’1enfant. Elle vit chez son feu père  dans le quartier Niébala de Bougouni.(troisième région adminitrative de la république de Mali). 
Suite au décès de son, Mademoiselle Rokiatou C. décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment afin d’aider sa mère à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. Elle avait tenté pendant des années différentes activités sans succès en raison surtout de la faiblesse de son fonds de commerce. Elle finit par opter pour l’achat et la vente des habits, chaussures, parfums...  qu’elle a appris auprès d’une soeur. Avec une expérience de 4 ans elle maîtrise bien son activité et est très sollicitée.
Pour obtenir un fonds de commerce substantiel Rokiatou C. décida d’intégrer une association de son quartier. Après 9 prêts en solidaire (prêt de groupe), elle est passée au prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce premier  prêt individuel  elle compte acheter, 3 cartons de parfums, 20 draps, 30 paires de chaussures 10 piéces de tissus et 5 jeux complets de tasses. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Fasso et à Bamako. La vente se fait au marché mais aussi dans le quartier. La plus part de sa sa clientèle est composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA Avec se bénéfice elle compte payer les intérêts du prêts et agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en:
Ms. Rokiatou C., age 28, is single and the mother of one child. She lives in the home of her deceased father in the Niébala neighborhood in Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Following her father's death, Ms. Rokiatou C. decided to start money-making businesses, notably to help her mother provide for the family expenses. For years, she had tried various businesses, all unsuccessful, mostly due to her low working capital. She finally chose to buy and sell clothes, shoes, perfumes, ... a business she learned from one sister. With four years of experience, she is now very good at her business, and she is in high demand. In order to obtain a substantial working capital, Rokiatou C. decided to join a neighborhood group. After 9 solidarity loans (group loans) that were all repaid without problem, she's now seeking her first individual loan. With this loan, she intends to buy 3 boxes of perfumes, 20 sheets, 30 pairs of shoes, 10 pieces of fabric, and 5 sets of cups. She gets her supplies in Burkina Fasso and in Bamako. She sells at the market, but also in her neighborhood. Her clientele comprises mostly women. She foresees a monthly profit of XOF 35'000 (ca US$ 70), to be used to repay the loan and to expand her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de draps, chaussures, tissus, tasses et parfums.To buy and resell sheets, shoes, fabrics, and perfumes

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratha M. is a group leader of five borrowers who all live in Damnak Key village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a basket middleman and pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing two more piglets for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Neang Samnang, is a worker in the government department in the local district. Mrs. Ratha M. is 19 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allows borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita M. is a resident of Tangal. She lives in a single-family home with her husband, Mr. Shrawan Mistra, and their two sons. Her husband works in a garment factory, and both their sons are primary-school students.

Mrs. M. is engaged in weaving different types of woolen sweaters. She has five years of experience in this work. She makes different types of sweaters, customized to each order. She also sells sweaters at the market in Thamel, one of the most popular markets for tourists.

Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs 20000.00 loan to buy raw materials such as wool and needles for her work. She started her business in order to upgrade her family’s standard of living as well as to provide a good education for her sons.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her weaving work.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Mrs. Lea E. is 47 years old and married. She lives at Paypayan, Oroquieta City. She has 3 children. After she heard news about Paglaum Muti-Purpose Cooperative, she got interested in it; that’s why she joined the co-op in February 2009. She’s happy that her project will come into reality because the cooperative will be able to finance her.

She started her dream business, which is raising pigs. She has applied for php 20,000 to buy sacks of feeds and an extension to her pig cage, for expansion. She hopes that someday her business will become successful and more profitable. She also wants to have a piggery one of these days.

loans.use: To buy feeds and an extension for the pigs' cage

loans.name: Arthuro

texts.en:
Arthuro O. is a man full of determination in life. He is 25 years old. He lives in Brgy Tumpagon Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental. He has a satisfying existence with his wife and four children.

Arthuro is involved in a mini grocery store business. This is Arthuro's one regular source of income. Thru this business he is able to support the needs of his family and is proud to be able to send his children to school. With his evaluation, there are still more people in their place who need the service of his business.

Due to the extent of demand of his customers Arthuro decided to expand his store a little. Arthuro wants to utilize the program available through HSPFI; Arthuro is extending his warmth appreciation to the organization for helping the improvement of the business. At present , he is requesting for a loan of Php 11,000 for the procurement of additional goods intended for selling. Arthuro is looking forward with confidence that his request will be granted.

loans.use: purchase of additional goods intended for selling

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un E., 56, is a widowed farmer who lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. Besides farming, she also sells porridge in the local market. On average, she makes a combined income of US$2 daily. She is also supported by her children, who are working. One of her children is a garment factory worker, the other is a goldsmith.  Un E. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow yams

loans.name: Martha Lorena's Group

texts.es: Martha Lorena Gutierre tiene la edad de 42 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La Señora Martha se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 40 años que se dedica a este negocio, pero es importante resaltar que es un negocio que ha permanecido en su familia, por lo que inicio con muy poca producción de tortillas, ya que después de elaborarlas salía a ofrecerlas a las calles y así decide mantener este negocio para ayudar a la que sus hijos salieran adelante y sus hijos pudieran estudiar. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, cal y leña. Sus deseos son de obtener los recursos necesarios de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena Gutierre is 42 years old and a single mother of 2 dependent children. Sra. Martha makes and sells tortillas. It is important to note that this business has been in her family for over 40 years and began as a small tortilla operation. After making and selling tortillas in the streets, she decided to stay in this business because it has helped her children move forward and allowed them to study. The requested loan is working capital to purchase corn, lime and firewood. She hopes to obtain the raw materials needed to make her product.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita P. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 46 years old, married, and has five adult children. Carmelita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба Аминова  является активным клиентом  нашей организацией  более 6 лет. Матлуба  в месяц 2 раза  ездит за товаром  в Киргизию . Сейчас она должна поехать за товаром  что бы привезти большую партию школьной одежды. В разгар реализации она планирует получить большую прибыль. В прошлый раз   когда был сезон летней одежды она получила хороший доход  и провела свадьбу своей дочери .  В настоящий момент  она подключила также дочь Точинисо  в бизнес.  Когда Матлуба уезжает за товаром  Точинисо продает товар.

loans.use: покупка  школьного сезона товара

loans.name: Gibeon C1 Group

texts.en:
Gibeon C1 is a group of 8 farmers in Taloitan Village, Nekamese Subdistrict – Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Taloitan is a small village which is situated about 37 km from Kupang City. Many coconut and banana trees grow in this village. Most people in this village have a background as farmers who lean on the agriculture sector in meeting their family needs. They usually sell their agricultural products at market in Kupang City as there is no local market available in this area. The challenge that the community faces in running their businesses is the meager availability of public transport in this area. The public transport only operates for 2 days in a week and it costs IDR 25,000 per return trip.

Gibeon C1 is led by Thomas B. - a 33-year-old man. Just as with many other people in this village, Thomas and his wife count on the agriculture sector for their livelihood. From their marriage, Thomas and his wife have been blessed with 3 children, they are: 
- Esthon B., 11 years old and in the Fifth Grade of Elementary School;
- Renita B., 9 years old and in the Fourth Grade of Elementary School; and 
- Rosana B., 6 years old and in the First Grade of Elementary School.
 
As the father of 3 children, Thomas always works hard to meet all of his family's daily needs by selling vegetables. Thomas and his wife are diligent in cultivating the farm and watering the vegetables on the farm every morning and evening. When the vegetables are ready to be harvested, they will bring them to Inpres Market to be sold on Tuesday and Thursday. They usually open the business in the market at 6 am and close around 2 pm. Nevertheless, the income that Thomas and his wife generate is still not enough to support their family. 

So Thomas and his neighbors decided to form a group of 8 farmers to join the cattle-fattening program. Thomas is interested in joining the program as he wants to improve his family's finances and to support his children’s education in the future. Thomas is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,400,000 from TLM to buy young cattle to fatten over 12 months. The other group members are also requesting a loan to buy young cattle. They really hope that the loan will help them in improving their living standards.  

Note: When the group picture was taken, Adrianus and Osias were replaced by family members.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Alfrezina

texts.pt:
