Alfresina nasceu na província de Maputo, tem 44 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 7 e 24 anos, todos freqüentam escola. Estudou ate 9 classe e parou quando teve gravidez precoce.
Vive na casa cedida pelos pais, com a mãe e seus filhos. Separou se do marido logo depois do parto do ultimo filho de 3 anos.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e só saiu quando teve que ir ao lar, na vila de boane, e antes de trabalhar fazia pequenos negócios.
Trabalha para uma organização humanitária no tema de HIV/SIDA denominada PFUCANE (que significa Despertai em língua local) como facilitadora comunitária. Recebe 4.500,00MT e trabalha ha mais de 3 anos.

Já teve empréstimo com o banco (Procredito) no valor não especificado que se destinava a compra de material de construção. Apos a conclusão, não preferiu continuar com o banco devido às modalidades de pagamento inflexíveis.
Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria iniciada (cimento, blocos, areia, pregos e outros).

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a sua casa. Sonha ver a casa terminada para poder confortar os seus filhos e posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Alfresina was born in the province of Maputo. She is 44 years old, divorced, and has three children between the ages of 7 and 24, who all attend school. She attended school until the 9th grade when she dropped out due to pregnancy. She lives in a home given to her by her parents, with her mother and children. She separated from her husband after the birth of of her youngest son, age 3. She grew up with both of her parents and only left when she had to go to her home in Boane. Before working she had small businesses. She works for a humanitarian organization focused on HIV/AIDS called PFUCANE (which means Wake Up in the local language) as a community facilitator. She earns 4.500,00MT and has been working there for more than 3 years. She had a loan with Procredito bank for an unspecified amount that was used for the purchase of construction materials. At the end of the loan, she decided not to continue with that bank due to inflexible payment options. This is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, for 20.000,00MT to be used to purchase construction materials for a concrete house that has already been started (cement, blocks, sand, nails, etc.). She plans to pay the loan back without any problems so that she can have access to future loans with the goal of finishing her house. She dreams of seeing her home finished to provide comfort for her children and to later be able to equip/furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials ( cement, sand, blocks, etc.)

loans.name: Elizabeth  Wanjiru

texts.en:
Elizabeth  M. is married to Joseph Kithuka a businessman. They have three children Rahab, Margaret and Perez who are 25, 11 and 9 years old respectively.

Elizabeth has been in the green grocery business for four years and her business is in a low income area with a large population where she serves the residents of the area who are mainly casual labourers.

The client was introduced to KADET through a marketing meeting within the world vision Area Development Programme and she has no previous credit history. She has applied for a loan to add stock including irish potatoes and cereals and with the extra profit she intends to start a food kiosk. Her future hopes and dreams are to educate all her children.

Elizabeth describes herself as honest and reliable.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The client plans to add stock of irish potatoes and also start stocking cereals.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S. was born in 1954, a married woman and is the good mother blessed with five children. Three of them are married and live separately, while the other two are single and are employed workers in Thailand. Mom S. cultivates a rice crop to earn a living, while her husband helps be responsible for family by working as a building worker. Mom S. currently lacks farming supply to help support her labor on the farm, so she would like a loan from Kiva in order to buy a cultivating machine which she will use them to plow her farmland. In addition, she will rent a new machine to other farmer for fees.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine which she will use them to plow her farmland

loans.name: Apuma

texts.en:
Apuma is 45 years old and the mother of seven children. All her children are in school from primary to junior high level. To support her household, she has been selling cereals like beans, maize, millet, rice and groundnuts to her loyal customers in the community market. She says the selling of these products is very lucrative because cereals are fast-moving goods.

Apuma has been in business for the last three years with lots of selling experience. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities in the northern part of Ghana and some in the Burkina Faso. She requests this loan to increase her stock as we approach the Christmas festivities. She believes it would enable her make a good income to support her family, especially in their education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut, rice, maize, millet and beans.

loans.name: Juan Adolfo

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 12, 8 y 3 años en el distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica al servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi. Empezó alquilando motos y luego pudo comprarse una unidad móvil de segunda mano con la que viene trabajando hasta el día de hoy. Además desde hace dos años se dedica al cultivo de espárragos en un terreno de dos hectáreas que suele arrendar. Su esposa tiene también una pequeña bodega – tienda con la que ayuda a sustentar la economía familiar.

Debido a que su moto necesita mantenimiento en algunas piezas Juan se encuentra solicitando por primera vez  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles. El es un padre honrado y muy trabajador, su sueño es poder construir su casa de ladrillo debido a que está construida rústicamente y seguir adelante para brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children (ages 12, 8, and 3) in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province in La Libertad region, which is 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 15 years he has been transporting cargo and passengers in his motorcycle taxi. He began renting these vehicles until he was able to purchase one secondhand. He still has that vehicle today. In addition, he grows asparagus on a two hectare plot of land that he leases. His wife operates a small grocery store in order to help with the family expenses.

Juan is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 300 soles in order to perform maintenance on his motorcycle. He is an honest and hardworking father who dreams of building a brick house. In addition, he hopes to succeed so that he can provide his children with a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo, Demetrio, y con sus 2 hijos: Leslie de 16 y Elvis de 14, en su casa propia.

Desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes y verduras, la cual funciona en su vivienda, así le da tiempo para obtener ingresos económicos sin descuidar la atención de sus hijos, ya que puede atenderlos por la mañana y cuando retornan del colegio.
Su  esposo trabaja vendiendo baterías y juntos se han propuesto darles educación universitaria a sus hijos, por ello luchan de sol a sol para cumplir con sus objetivos. El negocio va prosperando y gracias a su buena atención, Celestina está logrando captar buena cantidad de clientes.
Sus planes a futuro son de tener mini market, realizando su sueño y el de sus hijos, de ser unos buenos profesionales.  

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sus compañeros de grupo confían en ella porque es muy responsable en todos sus actos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería para abastecer su tienda y esté más surtida.
texts.en:
Celestina is 39 years old, and lives with her husband, Demetrio, and their 2 children, Leslie, 16 and Elvis, 14, in their own home.

For 2 years Celestina has had a shop where she sells groceries and produce out of her home, as this gives her the opportunity to make an income without neglecting the care of her children, since she can tend to them in the morning and after school.

Her husband works selling batteries, and together they are trying to provide their children with a college education. They work from sunrise to sundown to achieve their goals. The business has prospered and, thanks to Celestina's attentiveness, has acquired a large number of customers. Celestina's future plans are to have a mini-market, realizing her dream and that of her children, to become professionals.

This is Celestina's first loan with MFP. The partners in her group trust her because she is very responsible in all she does. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more merchandise to supply her store and be fully stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
O. Enhbayar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". His wife works as a cleaner for a private company and his two daughters both attend a local secondary school.

Enhbayar has operated a transportation business in his town since 2000. He previously worked as a carpenter for several years. At first he had only his personal car which he used as a taxi to transport people. After having success as a taxi driver he used his savings to purchase a truck which he uses to transport goods for people.

Enhbayar continues to work hard to grow his business. He hopes to save enough money to improve his truck and support his daughters' education. He says, “I will work hard support my daughters' future.” He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan to purchase machinery parts for his car and a new refrigerator for his home.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase machinery parts for his car and a new refrigerator for his houshold

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a 42-year-old mother of three children. She has a rice farming business. It has been a decade since she entered into this business. She manages a 1¼ hectare rice field in South Cotabato.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order to sustain her business. She has now requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm supplies.

Her earnings will be enough meet her family's daily needs and have savings.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es una mujer emprendedora y amable de 41 años, vive con su esposo Ángel, de 44 años, y con 2 de sus 6 hijos; ellos son: Karen de 11 y Jacqueline de 4 años. Su casa es alquilada pero muy acogedora.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de frutas oriundas de la selva central peruana, pero en las mañanas vende alimentos en un paradero de autos. Los fines de semana, vende discos de música en las diferentes ferias de su localidad, con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo, quien dice que aprendió a trabajar sin miedo, ni vergüenza a las actividades a las que se dedica junto a Florentina. 
Ambos relatan que antes no tenían ni qué comer y se sentían impotentes de ver llorar de hambre a sus hijos e incluso por un plato de comida llegaron a vender los pocos artículos domésticos que habían obtenido; “recordar esas cosas me ayudan para salir adelante” manifiesta ella, a la vez que se dice “con Dios a mi lado ya nada me falta, al contrario tengo para compartir con los demás”. 
Ahora sus oficios son rentables y le permiten ahorrar, por lo que para el futuro se proyecta a implementar una tienda de discos de música y videos cristianos para hacer llegar la palabra de Dios a sus semejantes, y también desea ampliar su negocio de venta de frutas. 

Este es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y cuenta que se ganó la confianza de la entidad por ser muy responsable y cumplida en sus pagos; además le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal y está muy agradecida porque debido a estos créditos tiene un próspero negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más discos para venderlos en las ferias como comerciante ambulante, por ahora, hasta tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Florentina is a kind and enterprising 41 year old woman. She lives with her 44 year old husband, Ángel, and with two of their six children. They are Karen, 11, and Jaqueline, 4. Her house is rented but very cozy. For 15 years she has been selling fruit that is native to the central Peruvian jungle. But, in the mornings she sells food at a parking lot. On the week ends she sells musical discs at the different fairs in her area. She has her husband’s unconditional help. He says that he learned to do the same work with Florentina without fear or shame. They both say that before they did not even have anything to eat, and they felt helpless seeing their children cry from hunger. They even sold the few domestic goods they had for one plate of food. “Remember that these things help me to get ahead,” is what she says. She also says, “With God at my side, I do not need anything. To the contrary, I have enough to share with the rest.” Now her jobs are profitable, and they allow her to save. In the future she plans to set up a store with musical discs and Christian videos to bring the word of God to others. She also hopes to expand her fruit selling business. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She explains that she won the confidence of the institution by being very responsible and making her payments. Also, she likes to work with her communal bank. She is very grateful because she has a prosperous business due to these loans. She will use the money she is now requesting to buy more discs to sell at the fairs. She will work as a traveling salesperson until she gets her own location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina D. is currently in the business of selling milk in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more jerrycans of milk to sell.  Marcelina is 42 years old and is widowed. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bakery.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more jerrycans of milk to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley T. is from the village of Banquero. She is 43 years old. Shirley is married and has 3 adult children. Shirley owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $76 US) for these activities.

In 2010, Shirley joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Shirley is requesting her first loan, for 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn H. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Bongalonan, Basay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living through her general store and rice retailing businesses.

Evelyn’s 57-year-old husband, Ramon, works abroad.  They have 1 child who is currently going to school and also helps the mother in the business as part of the daily chores.

Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and rice retailing businesses. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000 from her business activities.

Evelyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations for her general store which has had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 6th loan in the amount of Php 16,000, which she intends to use for her general store and rice retailing businesses. Evelyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell smoked fish

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
In 2006, Erlinda joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in entrepreneurial business activities. She and her husband, Roque, have successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI.

Erlinda owns and operates a dressmaking business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a week. With additional working capital, Erlinda’s business will continue to expand and she will be able to offer satisfactory service to her customers.

Erlinda therefore hopes to expand her business; she is requesting a loan of 25,000 pesos to pay for different cotton fabrics and other supplies for her business. This loan will be her eighth loan from ASHI. Erlinda requests this loan so that she can support the expansion of her dressmaking business and be able to meet the growing demands of her customers.

Having this opportunity of obtaining loans from Kiva through ASHI will provide a chance for Erlinda to accomplish her goals in life: to have a growing business, a good living, the financial means of supporting her family and funding for the college education of her two children.

Through the support of ASHI, in partnership with Kiva, Erlinda hopes to see herself and her family soon change their standard of living and get away from living beneath the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To buy different cotton fabrics and other supplies

loans.name: Violet A.

texts.en: Violet A. B. is a hardworking business woman of thirty years old. She is married and has two children in schooling. She deals with a hardware business, which she has been operating for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase hardware items such as hoes, pangas, rakes, paint, and so forth, for her shop. Her future hope is to expand the business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase hardware items such as hoes, pangas, rakes, paint, and so forth for her shop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Enrique de 53 años, juntos tienen 5 hijos, pero ya son mayores e independientes, por lo que solo viven con su última hija. Desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, hoy continúa pero en compañía de su esposo, sembrando papas, alverjas y gladiolos. Para ella la faena agrícola son tediosas, pues es una constante vigilancia a cada planta, de esa manera evita que las plagas perjudiquen la cosecha. Julia sabe que si se le brinda el cuidado adecuado a los cultivos, echándoles fertilizantes e  insecticidas, se puede esperar una buena producción; además el tiempo que tiene sembrando, le ha enseñando las técnicas que necesita para que la cosecha sea recogida sin problemas. Luego de obtener la producción, lo lleva a comercializarlos a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad, llegando a obtener regulares ganancias que le permite vivir cómodamente con su hija. Como ella es una dama muy trabajadora, tiene como propósito aumentar su producción de gladiolos y alverjas, ya que el precio de estos productos es muy bueno en el mercado. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron lo posible que el crédito le permita continuar trabajando, además conoce muy bien a las integrantes de su grupo comunal y sabe que son muy responsables. Julia tiene pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de semilla de gladiolos y alverjas para extender su producción.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old. She lives in the house she owns with her husband, Enrique, 53. They have 5 children of age who are independent, so they only live with their daughter. She has been working in agriculture since a young age, which she continues doing today side by side with her husband, growing potatoes, peas and gladiolus. The seeding and growing processes are hard for her because the crops need continuous watching, to avoid plagues that could trouble the harvesting season. Julia knows that if she takes care of her crops, using fertilizers and insecticides, she can expect a good harvest; besides, all her years in the business have taught her all the techniques she needs to harvest without any problems. After harvesting, she takes her products to the wholesalers in the city, with which she makes regular earnings that allow her to live comfortably with her daughter. As she is a hard working woman, she wants to expand her production for gladiolus and peas, as they have a good market price. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who made it possible for her to get it, so she can continue working. Besides, she knows the members of her community group very well and she knows they are very responsible. Julia hopes she will be able to invest the money in the purchase for gladiolus and peas seeds to expand her production.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gladiolus seeds and peas

loans.name: Um-E-Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Um-e-kalsoom, a resident of city Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, owns a small two-roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over five years. She is a twenty-five-year old young woman, married with one infant child. She loves her family and takes care of them. She gets up early, manages the domestic chores and prepares from breakfast to dinner for her husband and makes all the necessary preparations for her child. She is not an educated lady but she wishes to give her son a better future with good education. 
Her husband's name is M. R.. He operates a video making business. He is a professional video maker and provides his services on a phone call away. He makes videos at wedding and birthday functions and also takes still photography. He has fifteen years of experience in this profession. 

Um-e-kalsoom is applying for a loan from Asasah, to purchase a digital movie camera for her husband so that he can provide better services to his clients and generate a good income for the family and make their wishes come true.

loans.use: To purchase a digital movie camera for movie-making business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 46 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores en su casa que es  propia.Todos los días, después D. realizar las labores del hogar, empieza con su negocio. Se dedica a  la fabricación D. chompas y casacas femeninas, D. diversas calidades. Tiene como clientes a algunas profesoras D. su barrio, a quienes les venD. a crédito, y al resto D. sus vecinos les venD. al contado. La actividad la  realiza durante las tardes y por las mañanas cobra. Lo que más le gusta D. su negocio, es que no le absorbe todo su tiempo, y ya lleva 3 años en este trabajo,  y considera que lo más difícil es realizar las compras, pues le cuesta seleccionar las prendas, ya que piensa en los gustos D. sus clientes. Para más adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y comprarse más vitrinas D. exhibición.Este es su décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ratifica su compromiso D. seguir pagando puntualmente. En una socia muy  responsable y preocupada por el bienestar y el desarrollo D. su grupo, ya que quiere que todos los integrantes  salgan adelante.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado, en incrementar con variedad D.  prendas su negocio, y D. ese modo planea seguir desarrollándose para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, is a hardworking mother who lives with her husband and their 2 minor children in their own home. Each day, after carrying out the household chores, she starts working in her business. She makes women's jackets and sweaters, of a variety of types. Some of her customers are teachers in the neighborhood, to whom she gives credit. She sells to the rest of her neighbors on a cash basis. She carries out this activity during the afternoons, and in the mornings she does collections. What she likes most about her business is that it doesn't take up all of her time. She has already spent 3 years doing this work, and what she considers most difficult is to make the purchases, because it's hard for her to select the right garments, since she must take into account the tastes of her customers. For the future she has plans to expand her business and buy more glass display cases. This is her 10th loan with MFP, and she confirms her commitment to continue making her payments on time. She is a very responsible woman who is concerned for the well-being and development of her group, since she wants all of the members to get ahead. Maria is planning to invest the money requested in a variety of garments for her business; in this way she plans to continue developing her business in order to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy a variety of merchandise (clothing) for her business

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a 10-year-old son. She runs a retail business selling cosmetics. Her business is located in a department store where Irina rents space. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Irina is honest, disciplined and entrepreneurial person. Lots of repeated customers and low competition help Irina make this business a success. 

Irina would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and develop her business further.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his corn and bean crops

loans.name: Nassinkar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité de NASSINKAR est créé depuis la mise en place du Banc Villageois de NEMA2. Il est composé de six femmes du même et de même. Elles se sont organisées en groupe depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois pour renforcer leur solidarité et leur amitié. 
Madame Marie Pierre M. tout à fait à droit de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants et a la charge de 03 autres enfants. 
Elle a 09 fois de fois de suite reçu de crédit auprès de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE.
Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle achète des carottes, des choux, des navets etc..
Avec son prêt elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement en achetant plus de légumes et escompter des bénéfices plus importants.
Elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture, la santé, l’habillement et le payement de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Nassinkar solidarity group has been in existence since the Nema2 Banc Villageois was set up. It is made up of six women who are also members of the banc. When the banc was formed, they organized the group to strengthen their cooperation and their friendship. Mme Marie Pierre M., at extreme right in the photo, leads the group. She is 50. She is married, has eight children of her own and cares for three others. She has had nine loans from CAURIE Microfinance. She runs a small business in vegetables, buying carrots, cabbages, turnips and so on. With this loan she will build her inventory by buying more vegetables, and she hopes for increased profits to enable her to better meet her family's needs as far as food, health care, clothing and school fees are concerned.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des légumes

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi O. is divorced and has a child. Esi has been educated up to the junior high level.

Esi sells smoked fish at Takoradi and uses her earning from her sales to feed and educate her family as well as to pay utility bills.

Esi will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: El señor Héctor trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa de alarmas, el es muy trabajador, es divorciado y vive solo en su vivienda, pero sus hijos y nietos lo visitan continuamente y el se preocupa por sus nietos pequeños, es por eso que el requiere este prestamos para colocar el Vitro piso en la parte trasera de la vivienda, que es donde juegan los niños, ya que ahorita hay mucha tierra y por la salud de los niños pequeños, no es bueno que jueguen en un lugar así.
texts.en:
Héctor works as a security guard for an alarm company. He is a very hard-worker. He is divorced, and he lives alone in his house. However, his children and grandchildren visit him all of the time. He cares for his little grandchildren. That is why he needs this loan. It is to place a tile floor in the back part of his house. That is where the children play. There is a lot of dirt there. It is not good for the little children’s health to play in a place like that.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a tile floor on the back patio of his house

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. is married and has two children. She has received junior high education. Yaa prepares 'kooko' (porridge made from millet) and serves it with bread at Elmina. Her husband is a petty trader. 

Yaa uses her income to help her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Yaa will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients to prepare 'kooko' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to save to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase additional ingredients to prepare 'kooko' for sale.

loans.name: Lissette Patricia

texts.es:
Lissete de 18 años, vive en una zona periurbana rodeada de un estero salado llamada “Perimetral”. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres y también un pequeño puesto de comidas y bebidas.  

Quiso este negocio para poder pasar tiempo con su hija, ya que se caso muy joven pero no quiso que su hija pasara necesidad económica. Hace aproximadamente ella tiene la tienda de víveres, trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende confites, arroz, vegetales, bebidas etc. 

 Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, confites y bebidas para surtir mas la tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio grande y poder comprarse una casa para asegurar el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en:
Lissette is 18 years old and she lives in a suburban region surrounded by a body of salt water called Perimetral. She has a small grocery store and she also has a small restaurant where she serves foods and drinks. She wanted this business to be able to spend time with her daughter. She married very young and she did not want to see her daughter in need of anything. She has had her grocery store for some time and she works from 7a.m. until 10 pm every day. She sells snacks, rice, vegetables, drinks etc. She wants to purchase note books, snacks, and drinks with her loan, to stock up her store. In the future she wants to have a better and larger business and to purchase a house to secure the well being of her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks, snacks, and drinks.

loans.name: Antony Mwangi

texts.en: Antony has been in the auto spare parts business for seven years. He is single. His business is located in a highly populated area and he serves many customers. Antony joined KADET through contact with existing group members. He is receiving his first loan as he has not joined other MFIs yet. Antony will use the loan to add more stock to his business. With the extra profits, he wants to grow his business. Antony hopes to own a big shop, as he believes he is hardworking and humble.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noé de 35 años de edad,  tiene un taller eléctrico, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel con su esposa y su primera hija, ellos tienen casa propia.
El taller tiene más de 8 años de existir, el horario es de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde; Hoy él está en una situación con su trabajo pues quiere mejorar la atención  a los clientes ofreciéndoles materiales de calidad y para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a invertir en los materiales para hace balcones y puertas más resistentes, y así estará asegurando la preferencia de muchas personas que le demandan su trabajo.
Él sueña con un taller más amplio, ser un trabajador de prestigio y con muchos clientes, mejorando la calidad y el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Noé is 35 years old and has an electrical workshop. He resides in San Miguel city, in the department of San Miguel, with his wife and his oldest daughter. They have their own house. The workshop has been in existence for more than 8 years, and the hours of operation are from 7 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. 

He is currently in a tight situation with his work, and so he wants to increase his attention to clients, offering them quality materials. Thus, he is asking for a loan that will help him to invest in materials to make more resistant balconies and doors. In this way he will be assured of the loyalty of many people who solicit him for his work. He dreams of having a bigger workshop and of being a prestigious worker with many clients, improving work quality and his family’s well being.

loans.use: To buy materials for the construction of doors and balconies

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo en el anexo La Viña del distrito D. Oyotún, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la comercialización D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en su vivienda. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. consumo diario que suelen ser D. difícil acceso dada su ubicación (a veinte minutos en vehículo del pueblo más cercano).

Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la calidad D. productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Para satisfacer su demanda se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Nicolasa es una mujer D. buen carácter y bastante tranquila. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a 58 mother.  She lives with her husband in the La Viña settlement in the Oyotún district.  It is an agricultural area, which is one hour and thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For ten years she has been selling basic needs items and groceries from a store in her home.  She offers her customers diverse daily use items that are generally difficult to get given her location (twenty minutes by car to the nearest town).

Her business is very popular due to the quality of the products she sells and the good service she gives her customers.  In order to satisfy customer demand, she has seen the need to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This will help her to achieve her objective.

Nicolasa is a woman of good character, and she is very level-headed.  The people who know her consider her to be an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy basic needs items and groceries to expand her store

loans.name: Marisol July

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol July; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicharrones (es hecho a base de carne de chancho) y también cria animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y los animales los hace engordar y luego los vende en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicharrones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar los chicharrones como carne de chancho y papas al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marisol July, 41, is a member of the “LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO” (St. Jerome’s Lionesses) communal bank which is located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of chicharrones (fried pork).  She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She works from 8am until 5pm.  She feeds the animals to fatten them up for subsequent sale in the various markets in Cusco.  She’d like to expand her chicharrones sale business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients, like pork and potatoes at wholesale, to cook them.

She thanks those who will share in her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chicharrones, like pork and potatoes, at wholesale.

loans.name: Jenny Judith

texts.es:
Jenny de 40 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

Inicio el negocio hace 5 años atrás para obtener dinero y poder ayudar a sus padres en los gastos de la casa, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo surtir mas su tienda con aceite, arroz por quintal. Venden todo tipo de confites y víveres de primera necesidad. Trabajan desde las 08h00 hasta las 20h00pm, uno de los sueño de ellos es que quieren que su tienda sea muy conocida para que sus clientes compren con continuidad. 
 
Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceite, lácteos. En el futuro quiere surtir su tienda con mercadería y agrandar el local para tener más víveres.
texts.en:
Jenny is 40 years old and has a small store in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador's tourist locations with a diverse variety of shellfish.

She began her  business some 5 years back in order to obtain money and the ability to help her parents with household expenses.  Little by little, with effort and dedication she was able to better supply her store with oil and rice by the hundred-weight.  Jenny sells all kinds of sweets and groceries of primary necessity.  She works from 8:00am until 8:00pm.  One of her dreams is for her store to become well-known so that her customers would buy consistently.

To better supply her store, Jenny wants to use this loan to buy rice, oil, and dairy products.  In the future, she want to supply her store with more merchandise and expand the location to contain more groceries.

loans.use: TO BUY RICE, COOKING OIL, AND SWEETS TO SELL

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has a lot of faith and courage and they have helped her overcome the poverty that afflicts her family. She is 41 years old and married. Grace has six children, all of whom look to her for support. She lives in the town of Cardona in the province of Rizal, Philippines.

In 1997, she joined ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, to secure access to capital for her business, which consists of raising hogs. This loan is her ninth, and she has repaid the previous loans on time and made good use of them to expand her business and her income.
 
She has applied for a new loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional piglets, sacks of feed and vitamins, and to pay for transportation expenses. 

She dreams of expanding her business into a full-fledged pig farm. She also dreams of sending her all children to school until they finish college and find great jobs. Until that happens, she is pleased at the way in which ASHI and Kiva have changed her family's life, out of poverty.

She says “salamat” (thank you) to ASHI and Kiva for sponsoring her for financial support and for giving them the opportunity to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets, sacks of feed and vitamins, and to pay for transportation expenses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 38 años, es madre soltera, y vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de su hijo, madre y  hermana; con quienes se esfuerza por salir adelante.Desde hace 8 años, se dedica  a la elaboración de  trabajos didácticos, en un  ambiente de su casa, pues es un lugar con mucha iluminación. Trabaja con la ayuda de su madre, quien es la encargada de resaltar las líneas de los dibujos con  plumón grueso; una vez que  ella ha dibujado con el apoyo de sus plantillas. Pero lo que si le gusta mucho, es armar las siluetas didácticas y cuanto más grandes son  sus trabajos; mejores ganancias obtiene de las ventas. En la actualidad con los años de experiencia; ya tiene convenios con profesoras de los colegios  particulares, y son quienes le generan mayores demandas. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un taller apropiado, para la elaboración de sus trabajos y también donde pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad.Es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y  se ha comprometido en  pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues quiere  acceder posteriores ayudas para continuar progresando.Mary tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales que necesita como pegamentos, cartulinas, corruspum, pinceles y plumones, que necesita para continuar en su negocio sin problemas.
texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in her parents' home with her child, mother and sister.  She works hard every day to get ahead in life.

For 8 years, Mary has worked making educational materials in an area of her home that has a lot of light.  She works with her mother's help.  Her mother is in charge of highlighting the lines of the drawings with a thick felt-tip pen once Mary has drawn them with the support of her staff.  What Mary likes a lot is making the educational shapes and the bigger her works are the more profits she makes when she sells them.

Mary has years of experience in this work and already has contracts with teachers in private schools.  These teachers are her biggest customers.  In the future, Mary is planning to set up a proper workshop where she can make her products and also where she can more comfortably serve her customers.

This is Mary's 13th loan with MFP and she has pledged to make her repayments on time as she would like to be able to access further loans so that she can continue making progress.  Mary plans to invest her money in buying materials that she needs such as adhesive, card, corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic), paintbrushes and pens that she needs to continue running her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru:
Gulnar O. 22 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Gulnar yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Klabadjara i seychas jivet v Absheron regione vmese so svoimi roditelyami.
Gulnar okonchila universitet i teper qod kak rabotayet uchitelniccey. Ona ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i detey s kotorimi ona rabotayet.
Seychas Gulnar nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kompyuter dlya obucheniya detey i ix razvitiya v oblasti nauki.
texts.en:
Gulnar O., 22, is single. She does not have children. Gulnar is an internally displaced person who resettled with her parents from Klabadjar to Absheron. Gulnar is a university graduate and works as a teacher. She loves her job and her school children. Gulnar is applying for a loan in order to purchase a computer that would allow her to teach children and contribute to the development of their scientific thinking. 

.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Jeanie's Group

texts.en:
Jeanie E. is from the village of Manla Sapang, Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Jeanie is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Marigold'.

Jeanie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeanie owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jeanie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jeanie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jeanie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
Sheena is a 25-year old single woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Narra, Palawan. Sheena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sheena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy more fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Sheena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Korondo

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been in the farming business for the past eight years. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of four children.

Elizabeth learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan which she is planning to use to buy fertilizer, seeds and chemicals. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to plough back into the farm.

Elizabeth's dream is to be a prominent wheat farmer and to improve her family's living standard. She is a conscientious woman who can achieve if she gets support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Redempter

texts.en:
Redempter is 41 years old, a widow and has five children who are between the ages of 16 and 24 years old. All of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking woman. 

Redempter has sold clothes for the past sixteen years. She is also a tailor. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric to make school uniforms.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make school uniforms

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Rebecca is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a general store, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She also sells fish like sardines and milk fish. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita L. is 47 years old, married to Paul, and blessed with three adult children. One of them is already working and the other two are still studying. At this time, Charlita is working hard to be able to send her younger children to college, a dream for most Filipino parents like Charlita as she herself is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Charlita is an all-around beautician and runs a small beauty salon in the comfort of her home. Upon the request of customers, she also provides home service doing manicure, pedicure, haircuts, hairdressing and make-up. She also sells cosmetics offered by direct selling companies like Avon and Sara Lee. She has been enjoying this kind of work for the last fifteen years and she now earns close to 11,000 PHP a month. She uses her earnings to answer to her family’s daily needs.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. She is planning to use this loan to purchase supplies for her beauty parlor. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Charlita hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will be able to send all her children all the way through college. She is also desirous of having another branch of her beauty salon to manage. Charlita prays for good health and a happy life for her entire family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies needed for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
In Siem Reap province, Heng P. is a good man who has a strong determination to conduct his business. Now, Heng P. is a boat ferry deliverer, using this boat to pick up passengers and tourists who wish to cross a river. He earns approximately $4 each day for doing this. Besides the boat-delivering business, he also helps his wife with a home business selling and renting CDs, VCDs, and other media players. Almost all of their customers are people who live near their house. 

Heng P. would like to ask for this loan for his wife to purchase extra media players, music discs and other equipment that will help his wife’s business attract more valued customers and earn extra income.

loans.use: to purchase extra media players, music discs and other equipment for his wife to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy required ingredients for food selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, t-shirts, skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Yury

texts.es: Yury, de 38 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Yostel de 5 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobre salir en la vida. Para Yury los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su motocarro sale en busca de pasajeros para transportar, él es muy atento con sus pasajeros y siempre esta pendiente de ellos, ya que desea darles muy buen servicio, para cuando lo vean de nuevo tomen otra vez su motocarro. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de Pucallpa, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el tiempo, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro. Este será el primer crédito con MFP por tanto desea que lo apoyen económicamente para concretar sus planes. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Yury, 38, is a simple, hard-working man who lives in his own house with his beloved son, Yostel, age 5.  What he desires most is to work as hard as he can to get ahead in life.  For Yury the workday begins very early in the morning when he takes his motorcycle out to look for passengers.  He is very kind and always attentive because he wants to provide a good service so customers will come back.

What he enjoys most about his work is driving through the streets of Pucallpa.  He has been in business for 13 years and feels that the most difficult part of his job is having to work until late at night.  He hopes to be able to save enough money to buy a new motor vehicle at some point.  This is his first loan through MFP and he is counting on you to help him carry out his plans.  With the 1,000 PEN he plans to buy tires for his motorcycle because the current ones are getting worn because of all the hard work.

loans.use: To buy tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Emma Luz

texts.es: Emma Luz D. 50 años D. edad, vive en su casa con sus dos hijos y su querido esposo D. 50 años D. edad. Sus dos hijos se encuentran estudiando y esta es la razón por la cual Emma se esfuerza día a día por sacarlos adelante. Emma se dedica a la venta D. embutidos, carnes y verdura fresca. Hace mucho tiempo que se dedica al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo activo durante mucho tiempo. Su sueño es seguir  contando con su pequeño negocio que durante todo este tiempo les ha ayudado a sobrevivir y espera que lo siga siendo ya que desea darles a sus hijos el estudio para que algún día puedan salir D. la situación en la que se encuentran. Ella sabe que la única forma D. hacerlo es trabajando, es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en  variedad D. productos que le permitan a traer a mas clientes. Con el crédito espera comprar carnes, variedad D. embutidos y variedad D. verduras frescas como: zanahorias, papas, tomates, cebollas, etc. Espera que los resultados sean favorables y D. esta manera poder seguir ayudando a su querida familia.
texts.en: Emma Luz is 50 years old and she lives at home with her two children and her beloved 50-year old husband. Her two children are in school and they are the reason why Emma struggles day after day to proviD. for them. Emma sells sausages, meats, and fresh vegetables. She has been in business for a long time and thanks to God and to her dedication she has managed to keep it active for so long. Her dream is to keep on depending on her small business. Throughout all this time it has helped them survive. She hopes to proviD. her children with an education so that one day they will be able to leave the situation in which they find themselves. She knows that the only way to achieve this is to keep working. For this reason she has decided to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will invest in a variety of products that will attract more clients. With the loan she plans on purchasing meats, a variety of sausages and a variety of fresh vegetables such as: carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, etc. She hopes that the results will be favorable so that she will be able to continue supporting her beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase meats, a variety of sausages, and a variety of vegetables, such as carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Bulenga Group

texts.en:
The nice shoes this 38-year-old mother of 5 has been selling for the past 8 years, plus her warm good-natured disposition is what has endeared Scovia to most of her old and new clients alike. She set forth in this business with pep talk and moral and financial support from close relatives. Prior to that, Scovia was involved in a restaurant business. She has built on her experience over the past 8 years. She rationalizes that the only key to success in any business is diligence. 

On the side, she earns more profits from her farming business. She grows crops such as bananas, beans and cassava which are staple foods in most parts of Mpigi. The supplementary farming business has been pivotal too in her quest to extricate herself out of narrow circumstances. Weekly her sales revenue totals up to 100,000 Ugandan shillings. The requested loan will assist her in the purchase of more pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Lissette Noemy

texts.es:
Lisseth, está casada, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella tiene una sala D. belleza, inicio hace varios años,  conto con el apoyo D. su esposo, hoy en día su horario D. atención es D. 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella necesita invertir en productos D. belleza, para ello solicita un préstamo que le permita incrementar la mercadería, comprara cremas, shampoo, lociones, estos productos los ofrece en la sala D. belleza a los clientes que les presta servicio.
Su aspiración es crecer como microempresaria, incrementar la clientela y el negocio, mejorar las condiciones económicas D. su familia y velar por las necesidades D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lisseth is married and lives with her husband and two children.  She owns a beauty salon which she set up several years ago, with her husband's support.  Her business hours are 7.00am to 5.00pm.

Lisseth needs to invest in beauty products and is requesting a loan which will allow her to increase her merchandise, purchasing creams, shampoo and lotions.  She sells these products to the customers that she serves in her beauty salon.

Lisseth's aspirations are to grow as a small businesswoman, increase her number of customers, increase her business, improve her family's financial situation and meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo and lotions

loans.name: Hayriye

texts.en: Hayriye

loans.use: to pay for opening her canteen and buying necessary materials

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, es madre de 4 hijos y vive con su esposa en su casa que es propia. Tiene 6 años de experiencia en la compra y venta de animales. Para ello adquiere los animales a un bajo precio y en un edad menor de vida, así los cría y alimenta para cuando llegan a un peso exacto son vendidos en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Su esposos también es participe de este negocio, que se ha convertido en una fuente importante de ingresos con el que puede  sostener a su familia. Paralelamente a este negocio también vende comida  por las tardes  de manera ambulante. Se siente muy animada por todos los logros que ha cosechado a lo largo del desempeño de su actividad por lo que continuará trabajando con miras a  tener más cabezas de ganado. Trabaja en los créditos grupales con MFP desde hace varios años, fue invitada a formar parte del grupo solidario que hoy integra y se ha convertido en una socia confiable para las demás personas. 
El dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales y aprovechar esta temporada de festividades en su localidad donde hay mayor demanda de ellos.
texts.en:
Julia is the hardworking mother of 4 children and lives with her husband in her own house. She has 6 years' experience buying and selling animals. She buys the animals very young at a low price, and raises and feeds them. When they reach a certain weight they are sold in the cattle markets in her area. 

Her husband also helps in the business, which has become an important source of income to support her family. Along with this business, she also sells food in the afternoons as a street vendor. She is very happy about all the success she has achieved during her time at this work, so she will continue working with her sights set on having more heads of cattle. 

She has been part of group loans with MFP for several years. She was invited to be a part of the supportive group that she is a member of today, and she has become a member that the rest can depend on. The money she requests will be invested in purchasing more animals so she can make the most of this festival season in her area while there is a greater demand.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity and nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Talya Kandyce

texts.es:
La señora Talya es socia del banco comunal Las Colinas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es profesor de profesión.
Cuenta con una bodega bien surtida instalada en su propia casa, lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos dos años,  cuando tiene que salir para comprar su mercadería una de sus hermanas le ayuda en la bodega.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles  comprará: 2 paquetes de pañales pamper, 5 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 caja de conservas, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de nescafe, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 2 jabas de gaseosas, 1 caja de galletas, 1 caja de pilas, 1 paquete de vela, 1 paquete de sal.
Con estos productos surtirá mas su bodega, está al pendiente de todo lo que hace falta para poder ofrecer más variedad de productos, se da tiempo para atender a sus hijos pequeños y también para atender las cosas de su casa.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos obtenidos y espera seguir trabajando con esta organización que brinda una gran ayuda a las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Señora Talya is a member of Las Colinas Community Bank in Yarinacocha District, in the department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. Talya runs a well-stocked store from her house. She's worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. When she has to leave the house to buy merchandise, one of her sisters takes over in the store. 

With her new loan of S/.2,000, she will buy two cartons of Pampers diapers, five packages of toilet paper, a box of canned food, a box of milk, a box of Nescafe coffee, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, two crates of soft drinks, a box of cookies, a box of batteries, a package of candles, and a container of salt. With these products, she will better stock her store. Tayla is always on the look out for what is missing in her store so she can offer a greater variety of items to her customers. She will have more time to look after her small children and to take care of household matters.

Talya is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans she has received and hopes to continue working with this organization that brings so much support to working women.

loans.use: to buy milk, canned goods, diapers, sugar etc.

loans.name: Melania Group

texts.es: La integrantes del grupo invertiran en credito en la compra de materiales para su negocio con el fin de seguir cada día mejorandolo.
texts.en: The members of this group will use the money from the loan to buy materials for their business so that they can continue improving it every day.

loans.use: to purchase items for her greenhouse, such as fertilizer and bags.

loans.name: Josiel Rigoberto

texts.es: El señor Josiel Rigoberto tiene 29 años, siempre está sacando adelante a su familia gracias a los sacrificios que realiza constantemente. Tiene más de 5 años en su negocio, anteriormente quien atendía el negocio era su mama pero siempre estuvo interesado en aprender este medio de vida fue así que cada día se interesa en obtener más clientes y brindarles un buen servicio. El motivo del crédito que realiza es un medio de apoyo para comprar granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, refrescos, galletas, detergentes, sopas entre otros. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Josiel Rigoberto, 29, always moves his family forward thanks to the sacrifices he constantly makes.   He’s been in business over five years.  His mother used to run it but he was always interested and learned this way of earning a living.  Every day he strives to win over more customers and provide them good service.  

The reason for the loan is to help him buy basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, cookies, detergent and soups, among others.   He hopes in future to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 21 год. Живет вместе с родителями. Его мать занимается бизнесом, а отец находится в России. Сам Хусейн раньше помогал своей маме в торговле. Сейчас он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает ковры и одеяло. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для приобретения детских игрушек и одеял.
texts.en: Huseyn lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 21 years old and lives together with his parents.  His mother is involved in business, and his father is in Russia.  Huseyn previously helped his mother with retail sales.  Currently, he leases a retail outlet, where he sells rugs and blankets.  He has been in this business for two years.  Huseyn is requesting this loan for the purchase of children's toys and blankets.

loans.use: to purchase children's toys and blankets

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is from the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. He is 52 years of age, married and has four children.

To earn a living, Bernardo plants corn and harvests it for sale. He has been managing his corn field business for almost 20 years. Now he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to 27,000 PHP, allowing him to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, certified seeds and insecticides to improve his farming business.

According to Bernardo, he needs to increase his profit because he spends much at this time due to daily household expenses and the tuition fees of his children. He hopes that he could continue to support his children until they finish their studies. One thing he is hoping is that all Kiva lenders will continue to assist him financially so that he could improve his business and provide the basic necessities for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds and insecticides to improve his farming business

loans.name: Tumaini A Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from  Tumaini A SHG Group in Western Kenya! Henry is the facilitator of the group. They joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Henry takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Henry had a very good maize yield harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Henry was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Henry and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Henry will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tumaini A SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Henry is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leria

texts.en:
This is Leria, 55, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Vergilio, a businessman, and is mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Leria hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes that her business will be able to sustain the needs of her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 45 years old and married with eight children.

Rasela owns and operates a business selling fried foods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Rasela needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Rasela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Rasela's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Anysie

texts.en: Anysie is 43-year-old widow. For the past 5 years, she has run a business selling different items. She has requested a loan to add more items like soda, rice, and vegetables to sell. With the profits, she will create savings and solve minor problems within her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soda and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 37 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 5 and 10. Her husband is a driver. Speciose sells milk, bread, and tea. Her business is well organized. She is open from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and has one year of experience. 

Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more drinks like Fanta, milk, and tea. With the profits from the loan, Speciose will reinvest in her business and pay medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, tea, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Maria Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Celestina es casada, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a tejeduría, inicio este trabajo como operadora en otro negocio y hasta el momento lleva 1 año de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción de vivienda.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos y mejorar su producción de tejidos, ella teje: cortes, servilletas,. Espera en el futuro contar con colaboradores en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Celestina is married and 35 years old. She has 2 children who are in school. She is a weaver. She began this job as an operator in another business and so far has 1 year of experience. She has her husband's support; he works in home construction.  

She is asking for a loan she will use to buy threads and improve her weaving production. She weaves bolts of cloth and napkins. In the future, she hopes to have collaborators at her job.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is 33 years old, married and lives with her husband and three sons in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living by making shoes out of leather.
