She is applying for a loan to buy leather and other materials she needs to make more shoes. Her goal is to keep her business running smoothly so that she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy leather and other supplies to make more shoes.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora dinámica, además de ser alegre y amable. Es casada con Américo  quien se dedica al transporte de carga y es padre de sus 3 hijos quienes 2  ya son independientes.  Vive en compañía de último hijo Arney de 32 años de edad instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Olga es la crianza de pollos de granja, para eso cuenta con un pequeño galpón con capacidad máxima de 150 pollos, que está instalado en el segundo piso de su casa, donde los cría y los vende en el mercado, logrando vender toda su producción. También vende comidas rápidas por las noches en el frontis de su casa.  .
Iniciándose con un capital propio hace 1 año,  fruto de sus ahorros, contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la limpieza y alimentación de los pollos en sus ratos libres.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene éste producto, por ser de consumo masivo en la alimentación diaria de la población.
Le gusta su actividad al poder contar con un ingreso económico extra, para los gastos que se presentaran en el hogar,  también el sentirse una mujer productiva y distraerse. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que algunas veces se le murieron parte su producción debido a la peste, ocasionándole pérdidas, logrando reiniciar gracias al apoyo de MFP, por eso tiene planes de continuar con actividad y realizar algunos arreglos y  construir un pequeño galpón en el primer piso de su casa, con una capacidad de 200 pollos. Con el monto que solicita, lo invertirá en el arreglo de la infraestructura de su galpón, comprando calaminas  para renovar el techado, viruta para el piso los pollos bebes para empezar con una nueva producción de por lo menos 150 pollos.
texts.en:
Fifty-five year old Olga is a dynamic, hardworking woman, who is also cheerful and friendly.  She is married to Américo, who makes his living transporting goods and is father to their three children, two of whom are already independent.  She lives comfortably with her youngest son Arney, who is 32 years old, in their own home.

The activity that Olga engages in is raising free-range chickens.  To do this, she has a small shed with a maximum capacity of 150 chickens, which is set up on the second floor of her house.  There she raises them and sells them in the market, succeeding in selling her entire production.  She also sells fast food at night in front of her house.

She started a year ago with her own capital, fruits of her savings, and the support of her son for cleaning and feeding the chickens in his spare time.  She considers the business quite profitable for the demand that this product has, since it is heavily consumed in the daily diet of the population.  She likes this activity since it gives her extra economic income for the household expenses, and also because it helps her feel like a productive woman and pass the time.  On the other hand, what she does not like about this activity is that sometimes part of her production has died due to pestilence, causing some losses.  She has been able to start over thanks to the support of MFP, which is why she has plans to continue with this activity, make some repairs and build a small shed on the first floor of her house, with capacity for 200 chickens.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she counts on their support to be able to carry out her plans.  On the other hand, she says that she will make her repayments, so that she has a good credit record.  Additionally, she is very happy with her community bank, and considers them friendly and supportive people.

With the amount she has requested of 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in repairing the infrastructure of her shed, buying corrugated iron to renovate the roof and chips for the floor for the baby chicks to begin with a new production of at least 150 chickens.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron to renovate the roof, chips for the floor of the chicken house, and thus start with a new production of at least 150 chickens.

loans.name: Dita

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Dita, a Ruma agent who has been joining Ruma for more than a year. This is the third time that Dita is applying for a Kiva loan.
Dita and her husband live in West Bogor, a suburban area located about 1.5 hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Her husband works as a staff in a local company. Dita and her husband have been blessed with a 3-year-old daughter. They realize that in order to support their daughter’s education, they have to save more money. Dita and her husband are very determined people; they work hard and they have been persistent in what they do. Dita has a small stall that sells daily consumer goods, also snacks and drinks. She also sells mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payments service for her customers. For the last 4 months, Dita has been selling new product from Ruma which is an e-commerce for low income community called ‘Mapan’. With Mapan, Dita is able to connect people in her community to good quality of many products with better prices. 
As the business runs, Dita is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Dita is standing in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Jones' Group

texts.en:
Jones's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Jones, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 39 years old, is married and has 3 children. Jones has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Jones isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Jones will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Jones's Group will purchase a total of 14 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years of age married with 4 children. Three of her children are in primary school and the other one in secondary school.She has a small bakery and supplies cakes to small retail shops in Kandara, Kenol, Thika and some parts of Nairobi. In addition to the cakes business, she also has a small shop where she sells ladies shoes. From her businesses she is able to get about $142 per month and this alone can not sustain her family. She is good at choosing ladies shoes because they don’t take a lot of time on the shelves and it makes her business grow. Considering the demand of her cakes, she is certain that if she increases quantity supplied per day then, she will start climbing the ladder to financial sustainability.

loans.use: Mary would like to increase the supply of cakes and to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena lives in Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has five children. Two are in primary school, another two are in secondary school and the last one is in kindergarten.

Hellena owns a retail shop selling various consumable items, mainly food. She has operated her shop for more than six years now. The shop has been the main source of income for the family.

Her husband is a commuter bus driver - his income cannot meet the numerous family demands. She recently realized that her shop's profit margin has been decreasing because of an increased number of competitors.

In a plan to improve her profit margin, Hellena has decided to expand the shop by adding different categories of food items. She has noticed that her customers travel a long way to the market to look for food items which could easily be stocked in her shop.

Her new strategy needs additional capital. From her own savings, Hellena has managed to finance 20% of the business plan. She needs $550 to make up the difference.

She expects this strategy will enable her make more income so that she can meet her family requirements and pay school fees for her children. She has a dream of becoming a big wholeseller in her area.

loans.use: Add to stocks of food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina is a single mother with 5 children. As she is a very hard working woman and in order to support herself and her family, 14 years ago she decided to start her own business as a stylist. She started off with only the basic things that she needed but, little by little, has been able to buy more products that she uses in her work. She now has a lot of clients and is very happy as her business is always growing and she likes to please her clients.

Josefina would like a loan of $925 to improve the image of her business as she wants her clients to know that she offers a high quality service. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. She is counting on your support so that her business can grow and she can therefore support her children alone.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Josefina es una madre soltera y tiene cinco hijos y para poder mantenerlos y por que ella también deseaba tener su negocio independiente y sacarlo adelante por que es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, fue así como hace aproximadamente 14 años que ella empezó con su negocio de estilista con sólo las cosas básicas y poco a poco fue comprando más productos y herramientas que ella utiliza al hacer su trabajo. Actualmente ya cuenta con muchos clientes y esto la llena de satisfacción por lo que ella también desea continuar creciendo y satisfaciéndolos.

Josefina esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para mejorar la imagen de su negocio por que desea que los clientes por ser una estética se vea bien para que vayan y estén a gusto en el local, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella espera que la apoyes para mejorar con su local y continuar creciendo para sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos que mantiene sola.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Pedro Humberto

texts.en:
Pedro Humberto is originally from the town of Creel in Chihuahua. He works as a tourist guide and driver, offering trips around the beautiful tourist sites in the area. Because he knows this area very well, his clients are able to enjoy beautiful locales, eat local foods and buy local arts and crafts. Pedro is married and has two children who help run the business. Together they have been able to improve their services and grow the company.

To avoid breakdowns and accidents, Pedro is requesting a loan in the amount of $275, to be repaid over a period of 4 months, which he will use to pay for maintenance and repairs to his work van. He and his children thank you for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro Humberto es originario de la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua, él se dedica a ofrecer paseos por los hermosos lugares turísticos de la localidad, con la experiencia que tiene conoce muy bien el lugar y en sus recorridos sus clientes pueden apreciar el paisaje, disfrutar de las comidas típicas y de sus artesanías. Pedro está casado y tiene dos hijos que se dedican a este mismo negocio, juntos han logrado mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrecen y hacerlo crecer.

Para evitar cualquier tipo de accidente que pudiera ocurrir, ahora Pedro está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de uan refacción que necesita su camioneta, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Pedro y sus hijos agradecen mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To pay for work van repair

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria Concepción has a goal to start a business selling chickens that are prepared and quartered. She is 40 years old, with three chidren, and is part of the Nueva Palestina 8 support group, together with Lucila Pérez Huacash (who has a grocery store) and Cristina Aguilar López (who has a grocery store). Maria Concepción will invest her loan in the purchase of a table to display her chickens, a scale, and plastic bags; Lucila and Cristina will invest in purchasing merchandise to start a grocery store business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA CONCEPCION tiene como objetivo iniciar un negocio de venta de pollos destazados,. Ella tiene 40 años, tres hijos y forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Nueva Palestina 8 junto con doña Lucila Pérez Huacash (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Cristina Aguilar López (tienda de abarrotes). Ma. Concepción invertirá su préstamo en la compra de una mesa para exhibir sus pollos, una bascula y bolsas de plástico y Lucila y Cristina invertirán en la compra de mercadería para iniciar el negocio de una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Dpsplay table, scale and plastic bags to sell chickens

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Lydia O. decided to start selling palm oil at the Obuasi Market. Since then she has become one of the most popular palm oil sellers at the market. She has good relationships with her customers. Palm oil is a red and flavorful cooking oil. It used in many traditional Ghanaian dishes, such as red-red, fu-fu soup, and palava sauce.

Lydia will be using the loan to purchase palm oil in bulk. This will decrease her costs significantly. Eventually Lydia hopes to build up enough capital to become a palm oil wholesaler.

Lydia is a member of the lending group in the Obuasi market. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To decrease costs by purchasing palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 25 years old and is single. Jalal owns and operates a small auto repair shop in Beylagan. He started his car repair business seven years ago. He needs a loan in the amount of $700 to buy spare parts and earn more income to improve his living.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Bora M.. She is single with three children, aged 15, 18, and 20. In 2007 Bora established a clothing business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Mahmutaly

texts.en: Mahmutaly K. works in a collective farm but he has also been in the business of making yarn and warm socks for 10 years. He used a prior loan to improve his business and paid the loan back on time. Now, Mr. K. requests a loan of $625.00 to purchase special yarn-making equipment.

loans.use: To purchase special yarn-making equipment

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a cosmetic saleswoman and also deals in used clothing sales. She is married and has three children. Her business is doing very well but her capital is insufficient to purchase goods to meet the needs of her customers.

She is asking for $525 in additional capital to enable her buy more cosmetics and second-hand clothing to meet the demand from her customers.

loans.use: As an additional capital to enable her buy more cosmetics and second-hand clothing to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es:
Maria Otilia started her business to cover her own needs and she was motivated by lack of employment. She needed to support her children economically and to cover the house-hold expenses. She started selling shoes through a catalogue 5 eyars ago and it has all worked out quite well.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $775 that will be repaid in a term of 8 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help Otilia will keep enjoying her success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Otilia inició el negocio para solventar sus necesidades por motivo de desempleo necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos económicamente y apoyar en gastos de casa. Comenzó con a venta de zapatos por catalogo hace 5 años y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.

Solicita un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 8 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Otilia seguirá prosperando

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr:
Mr. Edem T. is 32 years old and a married father. To earn a living and provide for his family’s needs he drives a motorcycle taxi in Kpalimé, one of Togo’s largest cities. He picks up passengers by the side of the road and drops them off at their destination. Mr. T. hopes to use this loan to buy a new, more comfortable motorcycle. With this improvement, he hopes to gain more customers, earn more money and change his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Edem T. est âgé de 32 ans et un père marié. Pour gagner de l’argent et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il conduit un taxi moto à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Il prend les passagers au bord de la route et les dépose à leurs destinations. Avec ce crédit, Monsieur T. espère acheter une nouvelle moto qui est plus confortable. Avec cette amélioration, il espère attraper plus des clients, gagner plus d’argent et changer les conditions de la vie de sa famille. 390000 12 mois

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Grace Association Group

texts.en: Fatu S. is the group leader of the Grace Association group. The group members have been working together for more than two years as a savings and rotating club. With their previous loans from SMT, the group increased their stock and helped each other purchase fish in turns. Fatu S. is 49 years old and has two children who are in college. Her business is the main source of income for the family, as her husband's salary is insufficient to meet the family's expenses. The group is requesting a loan of $850 to expand their businesses and clientele into the neighboring villages.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to expand their businesses

loans.name: Bibijon

texts.ru:
Bibijon Z. has been working in sales for the pas 8 years. She sells clothing for children and teenagers. She is not married, but has 5 children. Her business is doing pretty well, but she would like to obtain a loan in order to refresh her selection of goods. She plans to repay the loan within a 10 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Зиеева Бибиджон бизнесмен. 8 лет занимается торговлей.Продает одежду для детей и подростков. Не замужем , но имеет пятерых детей. Бизнес идет не плохо. Но для того , чтобы обновить ассортимент хочет получить кредит и завезти товар. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S. is a 36-year-old man who has been tending a food store in a small village in the Saatli region since 1997. He is married and has 2 daughters. He has applied for 1200 USD to purchase more goods and expand his grocery business.

loans.use: Going to purchase more goods and expand his grocery business

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun C., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sophan Soy, 27,  live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have two daughters; one of them attends school. 

Mr. Bunthoeun has been a silk weaver since 2006, a skill he learned from his wife. He is also a soldier. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old, a skill she learned from her aunt. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes their goods to sell in Phnom Penh.

Bunthoeun is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace mucho tiempo, junto a su esposo Walter, trabajan arduamente en este negocio para solventar los gastos familiares. Uno de los deseos de Kelly es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, para ello está comprando poco a poco los materiales (madera, calamina, entre otros). Por lo que solicita este préstamo para la compra de más materiales para el arreglo de su vivienda. Ayudemos a esta familia a vivir en un lugar mejor.
texts.en:
Kelly and her husband Walter have sold fish for a long time. They work hard in this business to settle their family expenses. One of Kelly’s desires is to improve the infrastructure of her home. For this, she is, little by little, buying the materials (wood and zinc ore, among others). She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more materials for her house repairs. Let’s help this family live in a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for house repairs

loans.name: Gianina Lucy

texts.en:
Gianina is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells clothing in different local markets in the Ayacucho area. She travels to Lima (a 9-hour bus ride) once per month to buy clothing to bring back and sell. She has been in this business since she was very young; most of her family members are also vendors. 

In a good week, Gianina can sell 5000 soles worth of clothing, of which about 1500 soles is profit. These are her best weeks however, and she usually only has one or two of these per year - during end-of-year celebrations or national holidays, when people tend to buy more. 

Gianina also works part-time as a substitute teacher for young children, for which she is paid by the hour. She is requesting a loan of 600 soles (US$200) to buy more clothing in Lima. Her dream is to open a store so that she doesn’t have to travel so much for her work.

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of pig food to sell in the community

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.en:
Marina Del Carmen P. C. is 63 years old. She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River. Marina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 10 years to support her transportation business.

Marina owns and rents out mototaxis, or motorized rickshaws for a living. Marina will rent a car for a daily rate (normally between US$ 5 and US$ 10 dollars for a whole day); in exchange, the mototaxi driver keeps all fares that he earns while he works. The proceeds from Marina's business help her to support herself and her seven children.

Marina is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of a second mototaxi. She will repay the loan in monthly installments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: purchase a second mototaxi to rent out

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou Touré est une femme mariée de quarante sept (47) ans, mère de quatre enfants elle vit dans une famille monogame à Sélingué.
Oumou fait le commerce de céréales notamment celui du riz depuis des années.
Elle est en relation avec l’institution de microfinance de Soro Yiriwaso il y a cinq (5) ans. Elle bénéficia de cinq prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et de quatre prêts individuels. Elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien dénoués
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt  2100  kilogrammes de riz  sur le marché de selingué et revendre dans les marchés de  Sélingué et de Bamako une fois par mois aux revendeurs.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100. 000  F CFA qui servira à payer les frais scolaires des enfants et rembourser l’échéance du prêt 
Madame Oumou Touré désire avoir dans les jours à venir son magasin de céréales.
texts.en:
Mrs Oumou Touré, age 47, is married and the mother of four children. She lives in a monogamous family in Sélingué. Oumou has been selling cereals, especially rice, for years. She's been in contact with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso for 5 years. She obtained five solidarity loans (group loans) and four individual loans. She's now seeking her fifth individual loan, and all previous loans ended without problems. With this loan, she intends to by 2100 kilograms of rice at the Selingué market, in order to resell it at the markets in Sélingué and Bamako once a month to resellers. She foresees an average monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200), to be used to pay the school expenses of her children, and to repay the loan. In the future, Mrs. Oumou Touré would like to open her own cereals store.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell sacks of rice

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en: Talaleu M., 44, is married with 5 children. She has 5 years of experience in a plantation business. Her husband does the work on the plantation. She sells to the public 2 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $125 USD). She has had 6 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Talaleu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the loan will be used to pay for her kids' school fees.

loans.use: To fund business needs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is thirty-five years old. She is the mother of five kids and divorced. Her kids are schooling in primary and junior high schools. Elizabeth lives with her children in a family apartment in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, a quite appreciable number are also involved in trading and other business activities.

Elizabeth is a hairdresser by profession. She does both plaiting and perming. Elizabeth says she started her salon four years ago and has since trained eight young ladies in hairdressing; they have started their own businesses in other communities. She has a small salon and shop close to the local market where she works. Apart from hairdressing, Elizabeth also sells shoes, slippers, clothing materials, assorted pomades and cosmetics. She operates her salon from morning and switches over to the sale of goods in the evening through hawking.

She believes the loan assistance would enable to buy hairdressing equipment, fashion accessories and artificial hair and also pomades and other material she will need to serve her clients satisfactorily. She hopes to increase her income to enable her to save more to support her kids’ education. Elizabeth is a member of Kingdom Trust Bank group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials and fashion accessories

loans.name: Sara Auma

texts.en: Sara Auma B. is a 25-year-old mother of three children ages 10, 8, and 2 and a half. The older two are in school. She sells second-hand clothes in the Nyamasaria slum where she also lives. She buys the clothes from the Kibuye market in town and transports them to the slum. When she can, she buys spices from Nairobi and sells them as well. When asked what she enjoys doing in her free-time she looked surprised and responded, “I have no free-time! I work for the kids!” She is asking for a loan of 10,000 KSH.

loans.use: buying used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Osatite

texts.en: Osatite is 30 years old and single. He has a boutique where he sells clothes. He hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more clothes to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia L. is a rice grower. She is 49 years old and has four children. Her husband, Lito L., is also a farmer. Together they want to provide a better life for their children. She helps her husband manage their small rice field. Their harvest is intended for family consumption while the rest is sold to rice traders in their village.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase sacks of Urea fertilizer and other farming needs. The loan will help her increase her yield. At some point, Lucia will be able to support the schooling of her kids because she is planning to venture into another business. 

CEVI aims to help small business to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy Urea fertilizer and other farming needs

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
R. Hakim, a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur, lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan with his wife and three children. For seven years Hakim has been working in the central city market selling blankets and coverlets, a business that enjoys stability and consistent growth. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city to purchase new goods, during which time his wife substitutes for him in the market.

Hakim enjoys working for himself, and his business is the main source of income for his whole family. He is now requesting a loan of $1500 USD to purchase new inventory. We believe Hakim‘s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Hakim’s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional blankets and coverlets for his business.

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
P. Trần Thị is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, P. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. P. has been engaged in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

P. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorophy T., 28, is married with one children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business.  She sells to the village community and general public 3 days per week.  Dorophy has 3 previous loans with SPBD.   She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Dorophy’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knives, spade, axe and gallons of gromozone.

loans.name: Annie Grace

texts.en:
Annie Grace lives in Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte in the province of Nueva Vizcaya. She is a two-year midwife graduate. She is married to Levy and blessed with a child named Keneth Warrant, who is 9 years old and in elementary school.  

At present, they are striving hard to earn income for their daily living. Her husband works as a bus driver in Sampalok Manila while Annie operates a tricycle. Her relative drives their tricycle and at the end of the day remits income to her. She is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of the motorcycle for the safety of their passengers. She hopes that whatever circumstances will happen, her family will be able to cope with them.

loans.use: Business capital

location.town: Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya`

loans.name: Tomasa Elba

texts.es:
Tomasa Elba V. D. G. vive en Sata Tecla en el departamento D. La Libetad.
La vida D. Tomasa se centra alrededor D. dos grandes ejes, sus dos hijos, a quienes  mantiene desD. chicos, y su negocio, el comedor “Tommy”.  Ambos hijos le ayudan a Tomasa en el comedor, pues ella no tiene suficiente ingreso para pagar empleados, es por eso, que Tomasa solicita un préstamo para invertir un poco más en su negocio y poder así formalizar su comedor, que con tanto esfuerzo, ha sacado adelante.
texts.en:
Tomasa Elba V. D. G. lives in Sata Tecla in the district of La Libertad. Her life centers around two things: her two children and her eatery called “Tommy”. Both children help Tomasa with the business because she does not have enough money to pay any employees.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest a little bit more in her business so that her eatery becomes more established. Through her hard work, she hopes to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
Belly J. is from the village of San Isidro, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Belly is single. To make a living, Belly owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Belly has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Belly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belly is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Belly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza Grupo 2 Group

texts.en:
Yanira S. V. is an associate of Esperanza International who has already successfully completed two loan cycles and is looking to start her third. She lives in a modest home with cement walls and a tin roof in Santiago, a city in the midwest of the Dominican Republic where running water and electricty are unreliable. She lives with her husband, mother, father, and her three children who are 9,14, and 17, all of whom attend the town's public school.
Yanira sells clothing, accessories, and jewelery to customers on street. Her business is the family's main source of income, which they depend on to buy food, clothing, educational supplies, and maintain the house. With a larger loan, she will buy more clothes and accessories to be able to gain more money and better support her family. She would like to thank you all for the support.

loans.use: Clothing, accessories, jewelery

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina, 37 years old, is divorced and has one child who is in school. She and her child live in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso, a commercial and farming town in the western region of Ghana.

Faustina is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice balls. She sells her wares at a roadside table in her community. She purchases bags of rice and other ingredients from vendors in nearby towns. Faustina has been in business for over three years. She hopes to obtain a loan to buy goods in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a mother who wishes for a bright future for her children. She is already 42 years old and has a total of seven children. She is married to Alfredo D. R. who manages their farm lot located in their village of Santa Isabela Norte, Ilagan, Isabela. Among their seven children, three are now in school.

Visitacion hopes to provide for all of the children so they can finish their studies. She envisions that someday her children will live better and more comfortable lives compared to the poor status of living they are experiencing at the moment.

Visitacion is involved in managing a hog-raising business. She hopes that her livestock business will be improved with the help of Kiva lenders who are willing to lend to her. She wants to request PHP 4,000 to use as added business capital in purchasing a feed supply for the pigs she is raising. She believes that seeking the help of lenders is one way of making her business grow and becoming a success in life.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is married with one child. He co-owns a small grocery store in Vasilievka town. Anatoliy has been in this business for nine years. His experience helps him run this business well. The store is open 24 hours a day and offers all kinds of food to its customers. Anatoliy offers only good and fresh products and is always looking for more ways to improve client service.

Anatoliy would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of products. He hopes to receive additional income and help his daughter pay for college tuition.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of products

loans.name: Santos Eucebia

texts.es:
la Joven. Santos Eusebia G. C.  se dedica al comercio, ella cuenta con un pequeño
negocio denominado "VARIEDADES CHEVITA" tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien,  esta soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres, los que apoya con algunos gastos en el hogar.
uno de sus sueños es tener una gran tienda en la que pueda emplear personas y de esta forma contribuir con fuentes de empleo, hay que buscar nuevas alternativas para poder salir adelante, es una mujer con un espiritu de superacion. con este credito que esta solicitando hara crecer su negocio y  lograra dar un paso mas en el peldaño de la escalera de sus sueños. puntualizo chevita como popularmente se le conoce en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos Eusebia G. C. is a young businesswoman. She has a small business called Variedades Chevita. She has been in this business for over six years. It has gone very well for her during all of that time. She is single, and she does not have children. She lives with her parents, and she helps with some of the household expenses. One of her dreams is to have a large store where she can employ people. This way she can contribute by providing a source of employment. You need to look at new alternatives to be able to get ahead. She is a woman with the spirit to succeed. She will use the loan that she is asking for to make her business grow and take a step on the stairway to her dreams. In her community she is popularly known as “Punctual Chevita”.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
la Sra. Felicita G. C. tiene 41 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion. 
en estos momentos Felicita Necesita un credito para comprar un fardo de ropa usada y varios trajes y ropa nueva para niños, ya que se aproxima la navidad y muchas personas ya le tienen encargado trajes y ropa, muchas de sus prendas las vende al credito y a final de cada mes le estan pagando lo que le deben.
su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco, espera que para el año que viene todo mejore y que su negocio prospere cada dia mas.
su meta es poder remodelar su casa de habitacion y hacer mas grande su tienda de ropa para dar una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
muchas personas compran ropa usada ya que es barata y de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Felicita G. C. is 41 years old, and dedicates herself to selling new and used clothing. She runs her business out of her home. Currently, Felicita needs a loan to buy a bundle of used clothing as well as some new children’s clothing. With the Christmas season approaching, many people have asked her for such products. She sells a good deal of her items on credit, and is paid at the end of each month for what she is owed. Her business is growing little by little, and she hopes that things improve in the coming year and that her business prospers more each and every day. Her goal is to remodel her home, and therefore be able to expand her clothing store and provide service to her customers. Many people buy used clothing, given that it is economical and of good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new clothing, as well as a bundle of used clothes.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie F. is from the town of Carosucan Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan. She is 35 years old. Lanie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lanie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lanie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Lanie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
35-year-old Mirian is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She is involved in rice farming, which is the only source of income she currently has. At harvest time, she makes sure to set aside rice for her family, and sells the rest for income. She hopes to double up her harvest the next time so she can provide for her family’s growing needs.

Mirian is a member of the Kiva field partner, CEVI. She thinks that its program is very helpful to farmers like her, especially because of its low interest rate. She applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP. She will use this loan for farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers and many other things. This loan will help Mirian achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Doña Maura es una mujer trabajadora,de 55 años de edad,  madre de familia de cinco hijos, vive en Villa Reconciliación, en donde tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano, compra las pacas en donde vende variedad de ropa para todas las edades, aparte de suéteres, sabanas y también vende refrescos para ayudarse más. Lleva once años vendiendo el cual ha logrado captar clientes, y le ha ido mejor con la venta de ropa que con la pulpería que tenia hace varios años, también ha logrado mejorar su casa con las ganancias y ayuda de sus hijos, ya que tiene varios años de estar sola. Con este préstamo va a comprar pacas  para seguir ofreciendo ropa bonita y accesible de costos para todo gusto. Ella desea poner una venta de comida en su casa, son los proyectos que tiene para este año a corto plazo el cual espera poder lograrlo con el apoyo de la institución el cual junto con ellos ha incrementado sus ventas.
texts.en:
Doña Maura is a hard working 55 year old woman. She is the mother of five sons and lives in Villa Reconciliacion, where she has her own used clothes business. She buys them in bulk and sells clothing for all ages, as well as sweaters, sheets and also some sodas to help with sales. She has been selling for over 11 years now, and has been able to get steady customers. She has done better with the sale of clothing than with a store she had several years ago, and she was also able to improve her home with the earnings and the help of her children, since she has been living alone for some time. With this loan she will purchase clothing to be able to offer nice and accessible clothing for every taste. She also wishes to be able to sell food from home. This are the projects that she has for this year and she hopes to be able to fulfill them with the support of the institution which has helped her increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repair Automobile

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Annaliza is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Annaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annaliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Twekembe Nambozo Sarah Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is a hard-working business lady of twenty-six, married with two children schooling, and she has three dependents schooling, too. She operates a produce business selling groundnuts. She has been in business for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase groundnuts from farmers and stock them for sale. The loan is improving her business. She is an encouraging business lady whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase groundnuts from farmers and stock them for resale

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis, tiene su domicilio en la Calle Portocarrero en la zona de Villa Copacabana, esta casado con la Sra. Roxana, quien es comerciante de ropa, el Sr Luis trabaja como taxi libre y ademas tiene en las mañanas contratos con escolares a los cuares lleva a sus respectivos colegios, el es muy amable y esta feliz de que se le otorgue un crédito kiva ya que le gusta que su vehiculo siempre este en buen estado. tiene 2 hijos y el siempre trata de dar un ejemplo de responsabilidad y trabajo a ellos.Esta muy agradecido com Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Luis has a home on the Portocarrero Street in the Villa Copacabana neighborhood. He is married to Roxana, who sells clothing. Luis works providing taxi service. Also, in the mornings he has contracts with students who he takes to their respective schools. He is very friendly and is happy to be granted a loan, since he wants his vehicle to always be kept in good condition. He has 2 children and he always tries to give a good example of responsibility and hard work to them. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married with three children and her children go to school. She rents a two- room house where she stays with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Joyce doesn’t take care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, rent, school fees and feeding the family. Joyce owns a ladies salon in Kampala city and works on all types of hair whether plaiting, relaxing weaving etc and works at retail only. She works six days a week. Joyce receives at least five customers a day. Joyce has been in this business for three years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has been with MCDT for a few years servicing her 12th loan. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock of weaves, relaxers and braids.  She hopes to see her business grow bigger and own a bridal salon. She joined MCDT because she wanted her business to grow.

loans.use: To buy more weaves, hair relaxers and braids

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina L. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Valentina is married and has 4 school-aged children. Valentina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells a range of different products to the local community. Valentina has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month..

In 2010, Valentina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Valentina is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her existing business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Valentina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fanny Monserrate

texts.es:
En un sector de la ciudad de Manta Llamado Umiña se reúne el banco comunal del mismo nombre, conversamos con la señora Fanny quien es una excelente socia, dedicada a su restaurant desde hace 22 años todo empezó cuando por medio de un compadre y un amigo medico quienes le ayudaron para que la señora Fanny pueda tener la venta de comida en el Hospital del Seguro de Manta, en una área destinada para ella fue que pudo asentar su espacio y empezar a trabajar desde cero. 

Al principio paso por momentos difíciles porque no le era permitido poner su negocio ahí pero fueran más fuertes las ganas de nuestra socia en querer trabajar que hasta los actuales momentos sigue laborando.
Nuestra socia Fanny está casada tiene 6 hijos varones mayores de edad el esposo es comerciante él se encarga de una tienda de víveres en el sector de su domicilio desde hace 6 años, por ello es que la hermana de la señora Fanny es quien le ayuda en las labores del restaurant.

Ahora con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia invertirá en su negocio para brindarle mejor atención a sus clientes, ya necesita de varios cambios como mesas, sillas platos y demás utensilios para la cocina, además de invertir en los víveres y productos en general que se necesitan para prepara sus alimentos. Ella sale desde las 5 de la mañana al mercado central de la ciudad de Manta para realizar sus compras para a las 7 estar vendiendo el desayuno luego al medio día el almuerzo y en las tardes bocaditos como empanadas, postres y refrescos trabaja hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días de la semana.
texts.en:
In an area of Manta city called Umiña the communal bank of the same name meets. We talk with Fanny who is an excellent member, dedicated to her restaurant for the last 22 years. It all began when a buddy and a medical friend helped her so that Fanny could sell food in the Seguro de Manta Hospital in an area designated for her. She was able to set up her space and begin working from scratch. In the beginning she had some difficult moments because she was not allowed to have her business there but the will of our member in wanting to work was stronger and she is still working currently. Our member Fanny is married and she has 6 adult sons. Her husband is a shopkeeper and he has looked after a supply shop in their neighborhood for the last 6 years. Fanny's daughter helps her in the restaurant. Now with this new loan our member will invest in her business to give her customers better service, as she needs to make various changes like tables, chairs, plates and other utensils for the kitchen as well as investing in supplies and general products that she needs to prepare her food. She leaves home at 5 in the morning for the Manta city central market to make her purchases then at 7 she is selling breakfast, at midday lunch and in the afternoons snacks like empañadas, sweets and soft drinks. She works until 6 in the evening every day of the week.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, kitchen utensils, and supplies.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of M. M. and the mother of five kids: two sons and three daughters. Her sons are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education. Her daughters stay at home to help her in her domestic chores and with the making of artificial flower sets. Her husband is involved in the timber selling business. He sells the timber in a shop placed in the main market. People come to him to give their orders for timber. He has been doing this work for over ten years. All of the people of the market knows him well. 

Manzooran makes artificial flower sets to increases the family's income. Luckily, her daughters have also learned this skill and they help her to generate more income. They all do care for each other and enjoy doing their work. 

Manzooran is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchases the timbers in bulk. This will enable him to maintain the good reputation among his customers by completing their orders on time.

loans.use: To purchase timbers in bulk to complete the orders on time.

loans.name: Moth

texts.en: Mrs. Moth S., age 55, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She currently earns an average of US$3 a day, and she has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 53 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river. Moth S. is the mother of six teenage children, who are no longer in school. All of her children are working at various occupations, and they each contribute some of their incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses. Moth S. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Moth S. is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
Mamerto F. is from the town of Trento. He is 57 years old. Mamerto is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Mamerto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mamerto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mamerto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mamerto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mamerto is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Mamerto from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Pascuala; ella tiene 37 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, ella es natural del distrito de Canas, La socia trabaja como empleada del hogar en una casa, ella brinda sus servicios de limpieza y cuidado de la casa de una familia, ella trabaja de lunes a sábados atendiendo y cocinando para los miembros de esta familia a cambio de una remuneración que a ella le permite pagar los estudios de sus pequeños hijos, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde pequeña realizó este trabajo por lo que le permite seguir manteniendo. La socia solicita este préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos y ella pagara las cuotas mensualmente con el sueldo de su trabajo.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus tres hijos, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank 'Las Palmeras'. She lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco province, Cusco department. This member, Senora Pascuala, is 37 years old. She lives with her partner, has 3 children and is native to the Canas district. Senora Pascuala works as a housemaid in a home, providing cleaning services and taking care of a family's house. She works from Monday to Saturday attending to and cooking for the members of the family in return for remuneration which permits her to pay for her small childrens' studies. Senora Pascuala is a very hard-working woman and has been doing this work since she was little, as it allows her to keep maintaining her family. She is seeking a loan to pay for her childrens' studies and will make the monthly repayments with the income from her job. Senora Pascuala values and is thankful for this loan as it allows her to improve her quality of life and that of her 3 children, and she promises to make the required repayments within the agreed payment terms.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for school fees

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue B. N. is 34 years old. She lives in Xom Huong village. She is married with two children. She has a disk store. She has had this job for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2004. In the last cycle, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid this amount punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to expand her store.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for construction materials and expenses (corrugated metal roofing sheets, cement, labor)

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.es: Cayetana, de 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos mellizos, Eloy y Elinda de 13 años. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa  base de madera. A pesar de no tener estudios, no le fue impedimento de salir adelante, así que se dedico a cultivar cacao en una pequeña parcela, por lo que solo le abastecía para su consumo diario, hoy tiene una estabilidad económica mejor, ya que produce y comercializa su producto de cacao de manera considerable, incluso ya tiene ganado a sus clientes mas recurrentes, en donde ella trata de cumplir con sus compromisos durante las fechas pactadas, de esa manera sus clientes quedan satisfechos. Trabaja en compañía de su esposo, y en las vacaciones escolares recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, que le ayudan a agilizar la extracción de su producto final. Usualmente trabaja de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y su punto de venta lo realiza en los centro de acopio de su localidad. Ella anhela en un futuro próximo mejorar su vivienda a base de material noble, con la necesidad de darle seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por cual se compromete a pagar durante las fechas establecidazas, además tiene un buen concepto de banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono, para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, asimismo desea remover sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Cayetana is 52 years old, married, and has a set of thirteen year old twins named Eloy and Elinda. They live together in their own house located in the town of Quimbiri, which is located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Even though she does not have an education, it has not stopped her from getting ahead. Cayetana grows cacao on a small parcel of land and it is her only means by which she can supply for her daily needs. Today she has better financial stability because she produces and sells her cacao products in considerable amounts. She already has gained more repeat customers, so she tries to complete her orders by the committed delivery dates in order to keep them satisfied. Cayetana and her husband work together and receive the help of their children during the school holidays. During the harvest season, she hires workers to expedite gathering of her final product. She usually works Monday to Saturday from 7am to 6pm. Her sales are conducted at the local collection center. Her wish for the near future is to remodel her home with solid materials in order to provide safety and comfort for her family.

This is her first loan with MFP. Cayetana promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines. She has a good understanding of how the Communal Bank operates. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of compost so that she can adequately maintain her cacao crops and enhance the quality of her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Nerea Aoko

texts.en:
Nerea Aoko K. is a widow aged 55. Nerea is blessed with seven children: Lameck, 31; Abigael, 24; Thomas, 15; Robert, 29; Philip, 26; Catherine, 20; and Peril, 18. Nerea runs a second-hand clothes shop in Kabarnet municipal market, which she has been running for the last 20 years. Through this business she has been able to support her family, providing for their basic needs.

Nerea has borrowed a loan of 80,000 KES, of which she will use 44,000 KES to buy four bales of second-hand clothes, 31,000 KES to purchase new clothes and 5,000 KES for rent. From her business, she gets an average profit of 15,000 KES. From these profits, Nerea intends to pay school fees for her children as well as to expand the business.

This is her forth loan from KADET LTD and Nerea anticipates that the loan will boost her business as the festive season is nearing. Nerea dreams are to open a second-hand clothes wholesale business and to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of second-hand clothes, new clothes and to pay rent.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocio del Pilar es una joven madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo de cuatro años en el distrito de Zaña, una zona conocida por sus tradiciones y costumbres afro – peruanas. Se encuenta ubicada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de cajitas para dulces típicos de la ciudad. Estas cajas están hechas de corteza del árbol de eucalipto, las cuales se convierten en delgadas láminas a través de una máquina. Rocío cuenta con esta máquina en su vivienda y luego de fabricar las láminas empieza a formar las cajas que luego guardarán dulces como manjarblanco o dulce de membrillo. Ella vende sus productos a todos los productores de dulces de la ciudad.

Rocío desea adquirir mas materia prima (madera) para mantener su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Rocio del Pilar is a young mother of 27 who lives with her husband and her youngest son of four years of age in the district of Zaña. Zaña is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo and is known for its afro-peruvian customs and traditions.

Rocio makes and sells little boxes for the sweets that are typical of her city, including caramels and quince jellies. She makes these small containers from eucalyptus bark which she transforms into thin sheets using a machine that she has in her house. She then sells her products to all of the producers of sweets in the city. 

Rocio would like to obtain more wood to keep her business going, which is why she is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa  for the first time.

Rocio is a very hardworking woman who is committed to her family and held in high esteem by the members of her community.  Her greatest wish is to increase her business so as to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria M. is currently in the business of selling beans and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour and sorghum to sell.  

Victoria is 42 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock maize flour and sorghum to sell

loans.name: El Campanario Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Campanario  lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Antonia N. de 56 años quien comercializa frijoles desde hace tres años. Ella toda su vida a trabajado para ganarse el pan de cada día y se considera una mujer trabajadora y esforzada. 
Los integrantes del grupo son Giovanni M. de 36 años quien comercializa productos Avon, marca reconocida por su ventas vía catalogo desde hace seis años y Josefa U. hecha tortilla bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses  y vende queso.
texts.en:
The Campanario (Bell Tower) Group is comprised of three hardworking people, one of whom is Antonia N., 56 years old, who has been selling beans for three years. She spends her whole life working to earn enough money for each day, and thinks of herself as a hardworking woman who tries hard.

The member of the group are Giovanni M., 36 years old, who has been selling Avon (a recognized brand for its catalog sales) products for six years, and Josefa U. who makes tortillas, a key food for Nicaraguans, and sells cheese.

loans.use: Beans and firewood

loans.name: Zayda Kattia

texts.es:
Zayda es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y con 01 hijo, la señorita realizó estudios de educación superior.

Zayda viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de carnes vacunos - porcinos.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su mercadería para su negocio.

Su es tener un carro, casa propia y poner una farmacia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la solidaridad y el intercambio de palabras entre las socias.
texts.en:
Zayda is a member of the comunal bank, “Azangarinas Valientes,” or ‘Courageous Azangarians,’ located in the Azangaro province of Azangaro, Puno department. She is 24 and single with one son. She completed higher education. 

Zayda has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. The first loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the capital in her pork selling business.

She is requesting a new loan of 500.00 nuevos soles, money that she will invest in merchandise for her business.

Her dream is to own a car and her own home and to open a pharmacy. 

What she likes best about the comunal bank are the punctuality, solidarity and interchange of ideas among the members.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: Las Industriales Group

texts.es: La foto fue tomada en el negocio de tortillas hechas a mano de la sra Camerina Z. S. Una integrante del grupo Las industriales, que está ubicado en la colonia Industrial, de la ciudad de Tehuacan en el estado de Puebla en México. Se ve el grupo al que pertenece y que lleva su nombre alusivo a la colonia en la que se reunen, se ve el local donde la señora elabora las toritillas que se dedica a vender,  ella inició este negocio hace seis años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de maiz y gas. Sus clientes prefieren comprar con ella por que da a buen precio y que son tortillas de muy buena calidad ademas de estar siempre calientitas e higienicas, su amabilidad y atención han hecho crecer su clientela . Al momento de solicitar su credito ella se siente contenta y agradecida por la confianza que se deposita sobre ella y sus compañeras. Tiene 34 años de edad y estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria es casada y tiene dos hijos una mujer y un varón de doce y tres años. Dentro de sus proyectos familiares ella quiere terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Mrs Camerina Z. S.'s business where she hand makes tortillas.  Camerina is a member of the “Las Industriales” group which is located in the Industrial district of the city of Tehuacan, in the State of Puebla, in Mexico.  You can see the group to which Camerina belongs.  The group's name is a reference to the district in which they meet.  You can see the premises where Camerina prepares the tortillas which she sells.  She started her business six years ago.  Camerina is requesting a loan to buy corn and gas.  Her customers like to buy from her because she sells for a good price and because her tortillas are good quality, as well as always being warm and hygienic.  Her kindness and good service have increased her  customer base.

At the moment of requesting this loan, Camerina feels happy and grateful for the trust which has been placed in her and her friends.  She is 34 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is married and has two children, a girl and a boy aged 12 and 3.  One of her family projects is to finish building her home.

loans.use: To buy corn and gas

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El Sr. Cirilo es nacido en Valle grande el 21 de Febrero tiene 48 años de edad, tiene  5 hijos algunos ya independientes y otros estudiando, casado con la Sra. Margarita,  hace 25 años el compro una parcelita en Guaracal a 15 km de Jorochito en donde vive y y trabaja juntamente con sus familia, el es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra    maíz, yuca,  pero el producto que mas le da rentabilidad es el  es el tomate, también tiene su ganado, que le produce otro ingreso, es muy trabajador el dinero del crédito ,lo utilizara para la siembra de tomate, el preparado de la tierra, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Cirilo was born in Valle Grande on the 21st of February.  He is 48 years old and has five children.  Some of them are already independent, and others go to school.  He is married to Margarita.

Twenty-five years ago he bought a small parcel of land in Guaracal, 15 kilometers from Jorochito.  He lives there and works together with his family.  He is a farmer, and he grows corn and yucca.  However, the crop that is most profitable for him is tomato.

He also has livestock, which produces another income.  He is very hard-working.

He will use the loan to plan tomatoes and prepare the land.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To plant tomatoes

loans.name: Melati Group

texts.en:
This group is chaired by Ni Ketut L.. There are 19 members who are applying for loans for the second time. However, not all members could attend the meeting because they were at Temple for the death of one of their neighbors. As is the habit of the villagers, if one of these people experience grief or a religious ceremony, it is the tradition that they have to perform activities of mutual cooperation to help each other.

This second loan was used to support their efforts in raising pigs. In addition to buying the pigs, the remainder of the loan was used to buy feed. This business is very supportive of the families in economic rural communities. Besides their farming, they could do this enterprise simultaneously. MUK,  through loans and training, directs members of the group to further enhance their skills in raising pigs so that they leverage their results. For now, there hasn't been a significant improvement that can be seen, but their knowledge of pig farming has been greatly improved with the provision of training by MUK. Pig farming is the main job they can do to improve their economy.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 55 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, con  los que trabaja arduamente para salir adelante.Desde hace varios años, está laboriosa mujer se dedicaba a las costura, y motivada por sus hijos en la actualidad confecciona  billeteras, que realiza en su casa con la ayuda de ellos. Es un negocio muy exitoso,  además ya cuenta con herramientas que facilitan el trabajo, y puede proporcionar un buen acabado a las billeteras.
