Además  obtiene buenas ganancias de las ventas, pues sus  trabajos son tan impecables y de buen acabado, que son distribuidos en los diversos mercados de la ciudad, y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado terminar de construir su casa, y de esa manera espera instalar  un taller apropiado en donde reciba a sus clientes.Es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito que necesita le será muy beneficioso  para continuar ampliando su negocio,  por ello se compromete en pagar a tiempo sus cuotas.Alicia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ventanas con sus respectivos marcos, pues de esa manera espera brindar mayor iluminación a su taller de confecciones, y así quiere continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Alicia is 55 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and four children with whom she works hard to get ahead in life.

This hard-working woman has been in the sewing business for several years.  Motivated by her children, she currently makes wallets in her home with her children's help.  This is a very successful business.  Alicia also has tools which make her work easier and she is able to finish off the wallets well. She makes good profits on her sales because her products are impeccable and well finished.  They are distributed to several markets in the city.  As Alicia is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to finish building her home and she hopes to install a suitable workshop where she can receive her customers.

This is Alicia's 13th loan from MFP and she knows that the loan she needs will be very helpful to her in continuing to expand her business.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Alicia plans to invest her money in buying windows and window frames so that she can provide her sewing workshop with better light.  In this way, she hopes to continue getting ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy windows to improve her workshop

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden D. is 39 years old, separated, and has five school-aged children.  She lives in the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty food products such as chicken and pork kebab, boiled eggs or balot, peanuts, and chicharon in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. She is also running a retail store selling snack foods and canned goods.

In 2010, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional ingredients and acquire working capital. Eden is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat. This loan will be Eden's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat

loans.name: Haem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Haem D. is the group leader who has been selected by the four members who make up this group loan. Each will use her portion of the loan to improve the family's living standards. They are located in Thnoas village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Haem D. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Ngos Sek, is a fisherman and a cow middleman. Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. So Mrs. Haem D. is asking for a loan to buy rice for resale to start a new business. This couple is bringing up three children who are all students.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben D. is from the town of Banga. He is 54 years old, married and has a 21-year-old child. To make a living, Ruben owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ruben wants to improve his family's living conditions.
Ruben joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruben has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Alhassan's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SLMC Primary School in Kenema city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones for each of the five members in the group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Thirty-five-year-old Alhassan F. is the leader of this group of teachers. Alhassan was born in a place call Taininahun, he is married to a trader and has 2 children who are in primary school. Alhassan is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 11 years now. Alhassan is going to use his share of this loan to buy house building materials – bags of cements, sand, iron corrugated zinc, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.  

School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. 

But with the help of a loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy materials for the construction of a house

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia P. is from the village of Malaigang, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Nelia owns and operates a beauty salon providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Nelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials such as hair dyes and hair solutions. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as hair dyes and hair solutions

loans.name: Ma. Juna

texts.en:
Ma. Juna B. is 40 years old, married and living in Baclayon, Bohol. She has two children aged 9 and 5.  Her husband works as a driver.

Ma. Juna sells barbecue to the people in her community. She marinates pork and chicken meat in the morning and grills it in the afternoon. Ma. Juna also makes key chains and coin purses that she sells to her community as well.

Ma. Juna has requested a loan to purchase pork and chicken meat, soy sauce and other ingredients for barbecue. She hopes for her barbecue business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase pork and chicken meat, soy sauce and other ingredients for barbecue

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat H. is married and has three children. She lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She trades in a small market near the station. She sells fruit, vegetables and salads. Her husband and daughter help her in this business she has had for 15 years. Her husband has his own car and helps her with transporting goods. Besides this business,  Saodat is engaged in sewing  national dresses. Her daughter takes orders at home. Saodat plans to use part of the loan to purchase fruit and to use the remainder to purchase fabric, because in the spring there is a demand for national dresses. For this reason Saodat has requested a loan of 1500 USD. 
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fruit and fabric

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: The woman in the photo, Kong P., is a local farmer, who earns a living by planting rice in the province of Kompong Tom. Kong P., aged 49, was married but divorced her husband years ago. She has seven children, five of whom are married. Four of her children live separately, while the other three are still staying under her roof. The three who currently stay with Kong P. are employed in various jobs and they contribute their small incomes to the family’s needs. Kong P. is asking for a loan to buy many sacks of fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
For the last 12 years, Peter has made a living by selling fruits and vegetables in the town of Naivasha. He is 42 years old, married to Mercy and has two children. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and is applying for his third loan. He repaid all his first two loans completely and on time. He plans to use this new loan to buy four bags of potatoes to sell to his customers. 

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his own vegetables and own a big grocery store.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rosario Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario de 42 años de edad, es soltera, vive casa de su madre, la cual cuenta con servicio solo de luz, ubicada en Tongorrape que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. 

La actividad que desarrolla Rosario es a la venta de todo tipo de productos para el consumo diario de las personas (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas, etc), negocio que ha instalado en su domicilio desde hace varios años, lo que le permite atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de productos y poder ampliar su negocio con más variedad productos, una vez que sus ventas aumenten podrá cubrir su préstamo y tener mejorar económicas para ella y su madre, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario is 42 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in a home with only electricity service, located in Tongorrape which is in the Lambayeque department.  This area is focused on agriculture and livestock.

The line of business in which Rosario works is the selling of all products for individuals' daily consumption (rice, milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, soda, etc).  It is a business that she has operated from her home for several years, allowing her to serve her customers at any time, and allowing her to differentiate herself from other stores so that she can earn more income to cover her personal expenses.

The loan requested through Edpyme Alternativa is for 1,000 New Soles, which she plans to use to buy more products and to expand her business through a greater variety of products.  Once her sales increase, she will be able to cover her loan and have economic improvement for herself and her mother, thereby improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products so she can grow her business.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Rene le está haciendo falta los muebles de la cocina. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar los muebles de madera que le están haciendo falta a la cocina de su casa. 
Don Rene planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de cargas, este sueldo es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Desea que el patrimonio que tiene este en las mejores condiciones para que su familia.
texts.en: Rene's home doesn't have any kitchen furniture. He is requesting a loan to buy wooden furniture for his kitchen. Rene is planning to pay for the loan through the revenue he earns through his work as truck driver. His salary is his family's source of income. He wants his home to be in the best condition possible for his family.

loans.use: to pay for furniture for his kitchen.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is married and a mother of two school-age children. She is 34 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ritchel is a farmer. She grows and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples in a local open market and sometimes she sells by bulk to the local traders. She has been in this business for two years. She earns PHP 35,000 twice a year in this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer and fruit baskets.

Ritchel has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Ritchel hopes to purchase plowing equipment together with a buffalo to be used in her pineapple production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and fruit baskets.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, age 28, is married to Gladys and they are blessed with three children, ages 10, 7 and 4 years old. He does livestock trading and has been in operation for 14 years. The business earns him a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. This is his second loan with KADET Ltd, and he repaid the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy goats and cows for sale. John hopes to educate his children and build his own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Segundo Carlos

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 31 años de edad y es un hombre trabajador, padre de un niño de 3 años de edad. Segundo vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Guadalupe en Pacasmayo. La calidad de vida que tiene es buena, pues el negocio al que Segundo se dedica es rentable.

Desde hace 4 años, Segundo, se dedica a la producción y venta de ladrillos. Este negocio le ha traído grandes satisfacciones y le ha permitido mejorar su condición de vida y darle alimento y vestido a su niño. Adicionalmente, Segundo alquila una mototaxi para brindar servicio de transporte público y obtener ganancias extras.

 Segundo desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para continuar con el buen desarrollo de este y solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y accesorios para la fabricación de ladrillo. Además, le dará mantenimiento a su vehículo para poder brindar un mejor servicio con este.

Esta inversión le ayudará a aumentar sus ingresos y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su hijo. Segundo tiene muchos deseos de superación y espera vender  sus ladrillos a nivel interprovincial. Para ello continuará trabajando de la misma manera para ganar experiencia y  mayor clientela.

Segundo es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad y presenta un buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Segundo, 31, is a hardworking father of a 3 year old son. He lives in his parents' house in the district of Guadalupe in Pacasmayo. He has a good quality of life because his business is profitable.

For 4 years Segundo has manufactured and sold bricks. This business has brought him great satisfaction and has allowed him to improve his quality of life and feed and clothe his son. Additionally, Segundo rents a mototaxi to provide public transportation services and earn extra money.

Segundo wants to invest in his business so that it continues to develop and he asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy inputs and accessories for making bricks. He also wants to do maintenance on his vehicle so that he can provide a better service with it.

This investment will help him to increase his income and continue improving the quality of life for himself and his son. Segundo has a great desire to better himself and hopes to sell his bricks in other provinces. For that purpose he will continue working to gain experience and increase his clientele. 

Segundo is a repeat client of our institution and has a good payment history.

loans.use: to buy inputs and accessories for making bricks.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of selling at wholesale in the future. 

With the 25,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she wants to establish a charcoal selling stall and purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a charcoal selling stall and purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.fr:
Espérance  est née au Rwanda et a 43 ans. Elle est mariée et elle a 6 enfants de 9 à 23 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire. 
Espérance est commerçante. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 2 tissus satins simple, 4 satins originale, 20 tissus pour des vêtements des hommes, 30 tissus des vêtements des femmes et payer le frais de transport (tickets).
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est augmentée les capacités de son affaire en achetant et en vendant beaucoup des tissus. Dans les prochaines années, Espérance voudrait se développer elle même et être une grande femme d’affaire dans la carrière commerciale. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et bâtir une maison d’habitation pour ses enfants. Espérance fait aussi commerce de restaurant.
texts.en:
Espérance was born in Rwanda and is 43 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of 9 and 23, of whom all six are or have attended school. She has six years' worth of secondary education.
Espérance is a merchant. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She is going to use her loan to pay for transportation (ticket) costs and to buy 2 sets of 'simple' satin fabric, 4 sets of 'original' satin, 20 sets of fabric for men's clothing, and 30 sets of fabric for women's clothing. Her strategy to increase her business is to enlarge her sales capacity by buying and selling lots of fabric. In the coming years, Espérance would like to develop herself and become a major businesswoman in the commercial sector. With the profits, she foresees paying for her children's education costs and building a house for her children. Espérance is also involved in the food preparation business.

loans.use: To buy 2 sets of 'simple' satin fabric, 4 sets of 'original' satin fabric, 20 sets of fabric for men's clothing, and 30 sets of fabric for women's clothing, and to pay for transportation (ticket) costs.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Ibrahima est un commerçant dans un marché d'une grande ville au sud du sénégal depuis 5 ans.Ibrahima est un père de 4 enfants 3 filles qui sont à l'école et le plus petit est un garçon qui est à la maison.Ibrahima a 36 ans et il est tres fiert de ses enfants.

Ibrahima achete ses marchandises en grande quantite dans la capitale du sénégal ou à Ziguinchor dans le sud du sénégal.Il veut accroitre son chiffre d'affaires d'ici 2 ans pour le bien étre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ibrahima has been a salesperson in the marketplace of a big town in the south of Senegal for five years. He is the father of four children, three daughters who are at school and a son who is still very young and stays at home. Ibrahima is 36 and he is very proud of his children. 

Ibrahima buys his merchandise in bulk in the capital of Senegal or in Ziguinchor in the south of Senegal. He wants to grow his turnover over the next two years for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, shoes, etc. to expand his shop.

loans.name: Griselda Maricela

texts.es:
Griselda, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa alquilada, ella vende frutas, verduras, mariscos, el negocio lo aprendió de su madre desde hace quince años, todos los días vende de lunes a domingo ya tienes sus clientes y por eso tiene que tener variedad del producto.
El préstamo lo necesita para mejorar su negocio, hacerlo más grande, comprar más mercadería: bananas, naranjas, papas, güisquiles, yuca, tomates; de esa  forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
El objetivo de Griselda es tener una mejor estabilidad económica para su familia y en el futuro comprar un lote para hacer su casa, y ser una buena cliente de calidad.
texts.en:
Griselda lives with her husband and children in a rented home. She sells fruits, vegetables and seafood, a business that she learned from her mother 15 years ago. She works every day, Monday to Sunday, and has an established customer base so she needs to have a variety of products. 

She needs this loan to improve her business and make it bigger by purchasing more merchandise like bananas, oranges, potatoes, chayote, yucca and tomatoes. This is how she will improve her quality of life.

Griselda's objective is to have greater financial stability for her family, and in the future she would like to buy land to build a house. She would like to be a good client.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, potatoes, chayote, yucca and tomatoes.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Señor David, es una persona de 28 años de edad de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Cochabamba y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo; la actividad principal a la que se dedica el cliente es al comercio de lubricantes en especial la venta de grasa de rodamientos para maquinaria agrícola y de construcción en el Valle Alto de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es decir en las poblaciones de Tarata, Cliza, Punata, Araní y Tíraque. Finalmente el cliente tiene ganas de incrementar su mercadería y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión y de tal forma poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos para de esta manera también mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. David is 28 years old, single, and completed his Bachelor’s degree in Humanities. He lives at the home of his parents in the city of Cochabamba and has no financial dependents. His main business activity involves selling lubricants, especially grease used for farming and construction machinery. David does most of his business in Valle Alto in the city of Cochabamba, but he also travels to the towns of Tarata, Cliza, Punata, Araní, and Tíraque.

His goal is to increase his inventory of merchandise. For this reason, he needs to request investment capital so that he can increase his earnings and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase machine lubricants.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel, tiene la edad 29 de años, está casada y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar los materiales para la mejora de su hogar. Ella cuenta con la vivienda en condiciones regulares por lo cual quiere realizarle mejoras para así optar por un hogar en condiciones mejorables y un mejor ambiente de seguridad de sus pertenencias. Ella quiere brindarles a sus hijos un hogar en mejores condiciones para su estadía en tranquilidad y ser cada día una familia con más armonía y un hogar digno para su vivencia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rosibel, who is 29 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their 2 children, who are her first priority.  With the loan, she is going purchase materials to improve their home.  Her house is in average condition.  She wants to make improvements so their home will be in better condition and a safer place for their belongings.  She wants to to offer her children a home in better condition so they can feel calm while there and so the family can enjoy greater harmony and a dignified place to live.  This is Rosibel's first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She had never taken out a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Dino

texts.en:
Dino has been running a minivan business since 1999. Prior to engaging in this business, Dino used to work as a minivan driver for three years. Dino spent his savings to purchase two used minivans to help him generate income. Dino usually operates his minivan business from 6 am to 7 pm. He also employs someone to assist him driving the minivan. He parks the minivan in front of a building materials store seeking customers hauling building materials. Unfortunately, one of his minivans is damaged, and he cannot repair it because of the limited money that he has. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of  3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM to purchase spare parts, tires, etc. 

Dino is a 38-year-old man who is married to Mariana, a 32-year-old lady. They are blessed with five children; they are: Deby 14, studying in junior high school; Orland, 11; Nadia, 9 and Glenn, 6, studying in primary school; and Dede, 1 year old.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tires, etc

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with 5 children. Fe is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Fe is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase piglets for her piggery. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Fe hopes to be a number one supplier of pork meat in the Philippines.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for her piggery.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has four children.  She has been farming since 2006.  She practices mixed farming.  She is able to farm well because the climate of her region is favorable for farming. She has benefitted from her group, Faulu Kenya because she has learnt new business ideas and is also now able to save her money.

Grace hopes to expand her farm so as to yield more produce.  She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy seedlings for cabbages, tomatoes and kales.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for cabbages, tomatoes and kales for her farm.

loans.name: Jazhem

texts.en:
This is Jazhem, 29, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Melissa, a housewife and mother to their child – who is in grade school. Jazhem, together with his wife and child, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support his child’s schooling. 

Jazhem operates a food stall wherein he sells fish balls. In the Philippines, fish balls are commonly sold on street sides; it is served skewered and can be dipped with different kinds of sauces. Fish balls are somewhat flat in shape and often made with the meat of a cuttlefish. His other products include squid balls and quail eggs.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Jazhem is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fish ball products and other ingredients needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands her business.

Jazhem hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his child will be able graduate one day. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional fish ball products and other ingredients needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase small fish to raise.

loans.name: Yalila

texts.es: La Sra. Yalila tiene su negocio propio que es la elaboración de platos de comida variados es casada tiene tres hijos los dos mayores le ayudan en el negocio y también el esposo cuenta con muebles y vajilla propia  la solicitante anteriormente vivía en Saipina cerca a la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  por motivos económicos se vinieron a vivir a Cochabamba, actualmente vive en anticrético donde tienen instalado el negocio el crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ollas vajillas y demás accesorios que necesita para ampliar su negocio porque tiene varia demanda de clientes por su buena atención y sus deliciosos platos a un precio competitivo en el mercado.
texts.en: Yalila has her own business making various dishes. She is married and has three children. The two older ones and her husband help her with the business. She has her own furniture and dishes. She used to live in Saipina, close to the city of Santa Cruz. She moved to Cochabamba for economic reasons. She now lives in an anticrético, where she has set up her business [anticrético is a common rental arrangement in Bolivia where the renter gives a lump sum loan to a property owner in exchange for housing for a specified length of time]. She will use the requested loan to purchase pots, dishes and other accessories that she needs to expand her business. She has a lot of demand from her customers because of her good service, delicious dishes, and competitive prices.

loans.use: to buy dishes and pots

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 50, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Additionally, her husband buys cattle to sell to generate extra income to support the family. Three of her children are employed. Two are garment workers and one is a security guard. Channy is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she plans to grow rice two times a year and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Yolanda Esperanza

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 32 años que vive con su esposo Ramón y sus 4 hijos en la parroquia "Bomboli" de "Santo Domiongo de los Colorados" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Yolanda vende frutas desde hace 7 años en compañía de su esposo. Esta actividad les ha permitido mantener a sus hijos. Tienen una vida modesta y grandes sueños de mejorar su situación económica. Su meta es poder tener un carro propio para distribuir su producto y así librarse del pago de fletes, pérdida de valioso tiempo y ya no tendrán que cargar pesadas cajas a todas partes. Yolanda desea inicialmente  invertir en comprar mayor surtido de fruta, de esta manera su negocio podrá crecer y así podrán estar más cerca de adquirir el carrito que tanta falta les hace.

A pesar de que la competencia que tienen es fuerte, Yolanda es optimista en que su inversión le dará lo deseado. Además Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que intermediará  esta operación crediticia le brindará capacitación y asesoría. Yolanda y su esposo se perfilan como buenos clientes y estamos seguros de que este crédito les permitirá estar más cerca de su gran meta y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 32 year old woman who lives with her husband Ramón and their 4 children in the Bomboli parish in Santo Domingo de los Colorados,  one of the youngest cities in Ecuador.  It has become an important link between the mountain and coastal regions of the country.  It is a special place, not only for its rich ethnicity, but also for its landscapes that can be found from the entrance to this beautiful city itself.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados currently belongs to the newly formed province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas.  The main festival of Santo Domingo is marked by a large influx of visitors as well as commercial and cultural exchange.  A large fair takes place at the Livestock Farmer's Association facility where the best examples of the different livestock breeds and crosses from farms around the region are shown and compete.  

Yolanda and her husband have been selling fruit for 7 years.  This activity has allowed them to provide for their children.  They live a modest life and have big dreams to improve their financial situation.  Their goal is to have their own car to distribute their products and eliminate having to pay for transportation, the loss of valuable time and no longer have to carry heavy boxes everywhere.  Yolanda initially wants to buy a larger assortment of fruit so she can grow her business.  This will bring them closer to buying a small car that they so badly need.  

In spite of the strong competition, Yolanda is optimistic about the return on her investment.  In addition, Fundación Alternativa, which is the institution brokering the loan transaction will give her training and counseling.  Yolanda and her husband are developing into good clients and we are sure that this loan will bring them closer to their big goal and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fruit.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is from Akhaltsikhe, South Georgia. He is 41 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife, Mzia, their two daughters who are 18 years old, their 17-year-old son and his parents who are retired. In addition to Gocha's parents' monthly pensions the only source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, the family has small dairy farm. They produce various dairy products such as cheese and yoghurt and sell them on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris. 

Gocha requested credit to purchase calves. He will rear them for 9 months and sell the grown calves for a higher price. This will bring in additional income which will be used to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Jealyn

texts.en:
Jealyn works hard to support her family. Jealyn is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Jealyn requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jealyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

Jealyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Grime Pastora

texts.en:
My name is Grime, and I have had my grocery store for 9 years, which has grown with time, this business generates enough to cover the needs of my family and the studies of my three children.

Loan Use: Buying cheese, corn, beans, drinks, churros, flour, bread and others.

Me llamo Grime, tengo 9 años de tener mi pulperia la que ha crecido con el tiempo, este negocio me genera lo suficiente para suplir las necesidades de mi familia y los estudios de mis 3 hijos.

loans.use: Compra de queso, maiz, frijoles, maiz, refrescos, churros, harina, pan, y otros.

loans.name: Iselsa

texts.en:
Iselsa is a single mother of four children and takes care of her grandson as well. Her store is located on a busy corner in her barrio (neighborhood) called Los Alcarrizos. She sells an assortment of clothing and linens to the people in her community. Her energy and outgoing nature have helped her develop her retail business and the training she has received from Esperanza has given her the skills she needs to manage a larger amount of merchandise.

Iselsa's store is not only a central location for affordable clothing and bedding within her comunity, but is her only means of income to provide for the basic needs of her children. This loan will give her the capital she needs to purchase new merchandise to reach a larger customer base and therefore earn more profit to become self-sustainable.

NOTE: As a leader in the "La Solidaria" lending group, Iselsa represents four other microentrepreneurs. Each one will receive an equal $150 share of this $750 loan to expand their inventories as well. They are responsible for repaying the loan together and helping one another should one person be short on a payment.

loans.use: Purchase new clothes, shoes and bedsheet sets

loans.name: Yusinjon

texts.en:
N. Esinjohn has been baking trditional bread for 16 years. He began to bake when he was 18 years old, as soon as he graduated from high school. At that time he helped his uncle and he learned to bake. Over time, he separated from his uncle and started his own business. Besides his wife and 3 children, he has his parents to support. His father is an invalid, a veteran of World War II of 1941 - 1945. His mother is pensioner too.

Until recently, income from production and cake sale were hardly enough to support his family. Additional means were necessary to expand his business and thus to improve their living conditions. In March 2006 he applied to MicroInvest and received his first loan in the amount of $150. Step-by-step, receiving new loans, he improved his business conditions. Now he needs $1000 to purchase coal, flour, oil and other necessary materials when it is cheap in in the summer. For example, coal costs now 1/2 as much as it does in winter. Besides this, he wants to repair and expand his premises.

loans.use: Purchase raw material, repair workplace

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso opened his car parts store twenty years ago. He is married and has 4 children, all of whom help him in the business. The good service that Alfonso offers and the quality of his products are what have enabled him to stay in business for such a long time. Family unity has played a fundamental role in the development and success of this business.

To improve his service and be able to increase his sales, Alfonso needs a loan of $275.00, which he will use to remodel his shop. He is committed to returning the loan in 3 months. With your collaboration, Alfonso and his family will continue their work. They sincerely thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años Alfonso abrió su negocio de refaccionaria, él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, los cuales colaboran en el negocio. El buen servicio que ofrece Alfonso y la calidad de sus productos le ha permitido estar en el negocio por tanto tiempo. La unión familiar ha sido una pieza fundamental en el desarrollo y éxito de este negocio.

Para mejorar su servicio y poder incrementar sus ventas, Alfonso requiere de un préstamo que $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación de su local, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu colaboración Alfonso y su familia podrán continuar con su trabajo, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To remodel his shop

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a Resident of Makangarawe in the Temeke District of the Dar Es Salaam Region. She has been in the poultry business for the past four years and it grows each day. She recently completed payment on a loan of USD $1,000 to YOSEFO, her local MFI.

She keeps both layers and a broiler, and she is now able to supply hotels and restaurants around Tameke area with poultry. Hilda also is an agent of INTER CHICK, a Dar Es Salaam based company which supplies chicks. Hilda also runs a pharmacy for veterinary medicine. She is in need of USD $1,200 to expand her business, buy more medicine for the pharmacy and buy more chicks.

loans.use: Buy more chicks for her poultry business

loans.name: Queta María

texts.es:
Queta is a lady who, up until now, together with her husband, has been able to spend time in many activities to educate her three daughters and take care of them in their home. However, her second daughter needs a lot of attention and care because she suffers a grave disease which she has suffered since she was six years old. This is why both parents continue working very hard, tirelessly, with the only purpose of improving her treatment and buying the medicines she requires every day. To increase their income, Queta and her husband opened a soda fountain in their house. The positive response received by their business in only a short time has made them very happy and they have decided to expand their site with the goal of offering greater comfort to each of their clients. This great need is essentially because of the expenses generated by the illness of their little girl, so they can continue to live without fear of the disease. I hope you can help this family, requiring US $175, to make each of their wishes come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Queta es una dama que hasta ahora junto a su esposo a podido ocuparse en muchas actividades para educar a sus tres hijas y brindarles bienestar dentro de su hogar. Sin embargo su segunda hijita es quién necesita de mayor atención y cuidado debido a que sufre una penosa enfermedad la cual ha padecido desde que tenía seis años de edad. Por esta razón ambos siguen trabajando muy duro e incansablemente con el único propósito de mejorar su tratamiento y adquirir las medicinas que ingiere diariamente.Para incrementar sus ingresos Queta y su esposo abrieron una fuente de soda en casa con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos. La acogida que han obtenido en poco tiempo los tiene muy contentos y han decidido ampliar sus instalaciones con el objetivo de brindarles mayor comodidad a cada uno de sus clientes, esta gran necesidad es básicamente por los gastos que genera la enfermedad de su pequeña para poder seguir viviendo sin temores en relación a su enfermedad.Espero que usted pueda ayudar a esta familia que requiere de 175 dólares para cristalizar cada uno de sus anhelos.

loans.use: Expanding a soda fountain locale.

loans.name: Ayde Yboni

texts.es:
Mrs. Aide belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Valerosas II" (Courageous Women II). She lives in the Region San Martin, Province San Martin, Tarapoto district. Her home is in the Jr. Project Number 135, and her business is located in the Jr. Bolognesi Number 1055. She works on the production and sale of dairy products and juices, both wholesale and retail.

Ayde is associated with people who help her in this activity, both in the production and in the sales ends. Thanks to this support and to the loans from Manuela Ramos, Ayde has been able to increase her business which has allowed her to buy more merchandise and begin to expand her locale, since her clientele has increased and the business needs to produce more.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 1,000.00 (US $333.00), which will be paid back in 4 months, she bought products that will allow her to bottle larger quantities to satisfy the demand she has (sugar, milk, essences, produce, bottles, labels, etc.)

Mrs. Ayde is 33 years old and lives with her only child. She feels very strong to keep working. She likes what she does and is planning to put much more energy into it because she can see that this is an activity with a lot of future. She is currently building a new locale, larger and with all the installations necessary to produce more. Finishing the construction of this locale is her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ayde pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio queda en el Jr. Proyecto Huallaga Nº 135 y su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 1055. Se dedica a la producción y venta de lácteos y néctares al por mayor y menor.

Está asociada con personas quienes le ayudan en esta actividad tanto en la producción y la venta, gracias a este apoyo y a los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha logrado incrementar su negocio, le ha permitido comprar más insumos y empezar a ampliar el local ya que la clientela ha aumentado y necesitan producir más.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ($ 333.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró productos que le permitirán envasar en más cantidad por la demanda que tiene (azúcar, leche, esencias, cultivo, envases, etiquetas, etc.)

La señora Aydé, tiene 33 años, vive con su único hijo, ella se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando, le gusta lo que hace y piensa ponerle mucha más fuerza porque ve que es una actividad que tiene mucho futuro, actualmente se está construyendo un local más amplio y con todas las instalaciones necesarias para producir más, terminar de construir este local es su meta.

loans.use: Buying materials for the production and sale of diary and juice products.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina B. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. She is 24 years old and has one son. She sells perfumes etc., in the Beylagan city bazaar. Her brother helps her at her job; (her brother is pictured). Madina needs a loan in theh amount of $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her retail business

loans.name: Gulu C 2001(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Christine, Gloria and Sarah are poultry farmers. Christine wants to use the extra business profits to buy iron sheets for the poultry house that is under construction. Sharifa sells and distributes water and wants to use the loan to buy a water tank.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy  more poultry birds

loans.name: Sotkinboy

texts.en: Sotkinboy U. was born in 1949 in the Asht region of the Tajikistan and he is engaged in the home business of raising and selling livestock. In this family business, he has a large flock of cows and rams, and his wife works making sour milk products, as well as yarn. Mr. U. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 to pay for a new building to house his cows.

loans.use: For a new livestock building

loans.name: Janett Concepción

texts.es:
Mrs. Janet D. is 43 years of age and lives in Laureles Sur with her husband, who is a bricklayer. They have one 24-year-old son. In order to help her husband cover the household expenses, she sells snacks and drinks for a living. At first, she sold drinks and ice cream from her house. Now, however, she also sells her snacks at the nearby schools. Little by little, her business has been growing, and she aspires to eventually turn it into a cafeteria. With the support of her construction worker husband’s income and labor, she is requesting a loan in order to build a brick fence on the side of her house, thus making it more secure for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Janet de 43 años de edad vive en Laureles Sur, con su esposo de ocupación Albañil, tiene un solo hijo de 24 años de edad y ella para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa trabaja vendiendo refresco y golosinas. Inicialmente vendía en su casa refrescos y helados ahora también manda a los colegios cercanos a vender y asi lleva 4 años creciendo poco a poco en su negocio que aspira convertirlo en una cafeteria . Con el apoyo del ingreso y mano de obra de su esposo que trabaja en construcción solicita un crédito para hacer un muro lateral en su vivienda y hacerla mas segura para ella y sus hijos.

loans.use: Construction of lateral brick fence

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Mr. Hernan C. lives in his own home in the Rosa Pampa zone of the city of El Alto with his wife, Mrs. Susana Gonzalez and their son. Mr. Hernan is a mechanic and works as an employee in a business in the city of La Paz and his wife is an employee in a store that sells eggs in the same city. With a past loan he was able to construct a renovation of 4 rooms that make up a single-family dwelling. This is the second occasion he has solicited a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably for the loan. He has been a client of IMPRO since March of 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Hernán C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Rosas Pampa de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa, la señora Susana González y su hijo. El señor Hernán es mecánico y trabaja como empleado de una empresa de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa es empleada en una tienda de venta de huevos en la misma ciudad. Con un crédito anterior realizaron la construcción en obra gruesa de cuatro habitaciones que conforman una vivienda unifamiliar. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión de la construcción de la vivienda. Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde Marzo de 2007.

loans.use: For final renovations to his house

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano M. is 45 years old, married and has four children. She has secondary education and has her own business selling rice. Her husband is helping her with the business. She became a client of MicroInvest in the early 2007 with US$375 in assets. In the beginning, Rano has been selling in different parts of town and buying rice in credit. Right now she has a permanent vendor space in the central market and her merchandise variety has increased. In the future she plans to go into wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирбобоева Рано –45 лет. Замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Образование среднее и занимается она продажей риса. Муж помогает ей в торговле. Стала клиенткой МЗФ Микроинвест в начале 2007-го с активами на 375 долларов. Раньше торговала в разных местах города и покупала рис в кредит. Сейчас у нее постоянное место торговли в центральном рынке и увеличился ассортимент. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Plans to travel to purchase merchandise and start selling wholesale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina studied sewing, and she has been making baby accessories for the past three years. She sells her products in the center of Lima. Each week she sells 8 dozen of these accessories. She also has had a phone booth in her house for the last 6 months; her niece moved it there for her. The loans that she has received have served to help her buy the fabric and the materials that she needs to make her accessories. Marina has exported the products that she makes to Ecuador and she would like to continue exporting to other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina estudió costura, es por eso que se dedica a la confección de accesorios para bebés desde hace tres años. Ella reparte sus productos en el centro de Lima. A la semana vende 8 docenas de estos accesorios. Asimismo, tiene un locutorio en su casa desde hace 6 meses. Su sobrina se lo traspasó. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar la tela y los materiales que necesita en la confección de sus accesorios. Marina ha exportado los productos que confecciona a Ecuador, por lo que le gustaría seguir exportando a demás países.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials for sewing baby accessories.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida is a persevering woman, who doesn’t let herself be defeated. In spite of facing obstacles that prevented her from finishing her university education in accounting, her aptitude and the support of her father, who is an accountant, has helped her to work in the field. Her dream is to be able to finish her studies, but now she focuses on the livelihood of her two children, who are studying; the older is already in university. This is what motives her to continue working. Nelida gives accounting advice about procedures and taxes to small businesses. She works in a company with her father. Nelida dreams of finishing her education and of being able to work independently and, in the future, of running her own transport business. In the meantime, Nelida will continue offering her accounting services. At this time, she requests a loan of $375 which she will use for a better implementation of her office and also for the maintenance of her first car, with which she will begin her transport business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva volunteer.

Nelida es una mujer perseverante que no se deja vencer, a pesar de haber tenido obstáculos para concluir su carrera universitaria de contabilidad, su vocación y el apoyo de su padre que es contador, la ha ayudado para desempeñarse en esta rama. Su anhelo es poder terminar sus estudios, pero ahora prioriza el sustento de sus dos hijos que están estudiando y el mayor ya está en la universidad, lo que la motiva a seguir trabajando. Nelida se dedica a dar asesoría contable, sobre trámites e impuestos a pequeñas empresas, trabaja en sociedad con padre, Nelida sueña con concluir su carrera y poder ejercer de manera independiente y en un futuro administrar su propia empresa de transportes. Mientras tanto, Nelida seguirá ofreciendo sus servicios contables; y en esta ocasión, solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, que utilizará para una mejor implementación de su oficina, y además el mantenimiento de su primer carro con el que iniciará su empresa de transportes.

loans.use: The implementation of her office, where she offers accounting services.

loans.name: Salaina

texts.en: Salaina is a 25-year-old trader who is hardworking and enterprising. She is single and loves trading. She has been selling foodstuffs like maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, and gari in her neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to rent a storeroom. Salaina is a member of the group called St. Paul's Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize, plantains, groundnuts, gari, and beans

loans.name: Monica B.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania!

This is 39 year-old Monica M.. She is a widow with no children. She has two dependents, both orphans, who live with her. In 2007, Monica established her crop selling business. She opens her business six days a week, and 9 - 12 hours a day. Monica requires a loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, Monica plans to start another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen cumplió 36 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada y progenitora de tres hijos varones menores de 10, 09 y 02 años de edad. Vive en la parcialidad de Alintuyo, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde el año 2007 integra el Banco Comunal “24 de Junio” en Alintuyo. Con su primer crédito de S/.300, compró gallinas y cuyes para ser comercializados los domingos en Ilave y los días miércoles en Juli. Desde los 20 años de edad se dedicó al negocio de compra y venta de ovinos, compraba de la feria de Huapaca y vendía en Ilave. A los 24 años de edad formó su hogar y siguió con su negocio. Desde los 08 años de edad se dedica a la artesanía, teje chalinas, boinas, chullos y a su vez se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, ovinos y porcinos.

Con este crédito de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 ovinos a S/.120 y S/.150, 02 porcinos a S/.100 cada uno, 10 gallinas a S/.15 cada uno, y con el resto comprará cuyes y alimentos para engorde.

Su sueño es criar vacas lecheras y comercializar leche, instalar una pequeña granja de cuyes y que sus hijos sean técnicos en mecánica y construcción civil.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old, completed primary school studies, is married and the mother of three sons who are 10, 9 and 2 years old. She lives in the village of Alintuyo, district of Ilave in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the "24 de Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo since 2007. With her first loan for S/.300 she bought chickens and guinea pigs which she sold on Sundays in Ilave and on Wednesdays in Juli. She has been in the business of buying and selling sheep since she was 20 years old, buying in the market in Huapaca and selling in Ilave. When she was 24 she started her family but continued in this business. Since she was 8 she has worked as an artisan weaving shawls, berets, chullos (Peruvian-style wool hat with ear flaps) and at the same time buying and selling small livestock such as chickens, guinea pigs, sheep and pigs. With this loan for S/.1200, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy 2 sheep at S/.120 and S/.150, 2 pigs at S/.100 each, 10 chickens at S/.15 each and with the rest will buy guinea pigs and animal feed. Her dream is to raise dairy cattle and sell the milk, to set up a small guinea pig farm and that her sons become mechanical or civil construction technicians.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Anel Giovanna

texts.es: Anel es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles. Anel es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudio administración de empresas en la universidad nacional de la ciudad, Anel junto a su mama tienen una ferretería donde vende materiales de construcción como fierros, cemento, agregados, sus ventas son en la misma tienda y también reparten a domicilio. Anel necesita un préstamo de 3000 dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción. Anel sueña con estudiar una maestría en Administración de Empresas y aperturar otras tiendas sucursales.
texts.en:
Anel is a member of the Los Claveles (“The Carnations”) Village Bank. Anel is single and lives with her parents. She studies Business Administration in Ayacucho’s National University. She and her mother have a hardware store where they sell construction materials like iron rods, cement and aggregates. They sell from their store and also make home deliveries. Anel needs a loan of 3000 soles, which she will use to buy construction materials. Anel dreams of getting a Master’s degree in Business Administration and of opening up more branches of her hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Antonio C., vive con su hijo y su esposa. Ya tiene su casita, pero el detalle es que solo tienen una recamara, está construyendo un cuarto en la casa pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario pagar la mano de obra, con el material no tuvo problema, lo fue comprando poco a poco.
Él está solicitando para empezar la construcción, sus ingresos provienen como operario en una maquiladora en esta ciudad. Estará muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido por ustedes y sobre todo porque su hijo va a tener un lugar reservado en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesus Antonio C. lives with his son and wife. He already has a small house but there's only one bedroom. He's building a room on the house but he doesn't have enough money to pay labor costs. He's bought materials little by little so that's no problem.

He's applying for a loan to begin construction. He has an income from a factory job in the city. He will be very grateful for your help, above all because his son will have his own space in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Addition.

loans.name: Nidia Luz

texts.en:
Nidia Luz Q. S. is forty-six years old. Her husband is an electrician and together they have five children. Nidia has been a member of the Damas del Oriente, or Ladies of the Orient, bank for six years. Her bank is named after the neighborhood where most of the bank members live: Villa Oriente.

Nidia is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to support her business. She sells beauty products for a living and is planning to invest in deodorants, bottles of shampoo and seven different kinds of perfume with her Kiva loan. Nidia will repay her loan in monthly installments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Nidia would like to purchase deodorants, bottles of shampoo and perfume with her Kiva loan to sell.

loans.name: Rufina Miriam

texts.es:
La Señora Rufina Miriam Ríos A. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Rufina tiene 4 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes una mujer de 32 años, un varón de 38 años, un varón de 33 y una mujer de 32 años todos trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañero de vida labora en la venta de mercadería en general, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo por lo que necesita mantenerlo ya que su negocio es el medio de supervivencia de su familia, sus sueños son de tener otro trabajo ya que este seria otra fuente de ingresos y las ganancias de este negocio las conservaría para su vejez ya que su hijos están casado y trabajan por cuenta propia sus deseos son darle educación a jóvenes para que puedan generar mas fuente de trabajo ya que la mayoría de jóvenes hoy en día están desempleados y no encuentran trabajo y al menos con esto podrían generar ingresos para su familias.

Su actividad económica es la es un taller de costura, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación y además lo distribuye, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 37 años, ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de aportar dinero para su casa  por lo que tenia que mantener a sus hijos y su Mama fue quien le enseño este tipo de negocio por lo que decide establecerlo pensando que le generaría ganancias y lo realiza por medio de sus vecinos y amigos que se hicieron cargo de difundir la fama de buena costurera y poco a poco llegaban los pedidos de uniforme de trajes personales y así fue que se hizo cargo de la administración de su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que lo utilizara para la compra de ropa par caballeros, damas y niños ya que se acerca la temporada de la entrada de clases y quiere invertir en esta temporada a pesar de la cansado que sea el viaje para buscar los productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina Miriam Ríos A. is 53 years old and married. Rufina has four children: a daughter, age 32; a son, age 38; a son, age 33; and a daughter, age 32. All of her children are independently employed. Rufina's husband also works, selling general merchandise. Rufina would like to keep her business active, as it is the means for the family's survival. She dreams of having another job to serve as a source of income for the family so that the earnings from this business will be saved for Rufina to support herself in her old age. Now that her children are all married and employed, Rufina would like to provide an education for the younger generation so that they can have more earning power. She knows that the majority of young people today can't find work, so with an education at least they can earn income for their families. Rufina has a sewing workshop in her home.She's had this business for 37 years, having started it out of the necesity to earn money for her home and her children. Rufina's mother taught her this business, and she started it with the hope of earning income. She was able to achieve this because her neighbors and friends spread the word, making Rufina famous for her great sewing. Little by little orders for uniforms and suits came in, and Rufina was in business. This loan will be used as working capital to buy clothing for men, women, and children. The school year is starting soon and Rufina would like to invest this season in spite of the long journey necessary to buy the products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhorn S., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Oeun Ben, 53, were married in 1980 and have six children, two sons and four daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Three children have full-time employment, and the other three children are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Two, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokhorn has been driving motor remoque taxis (motorbikes with trailers at the back) since 1994. He carries people and goods from his home to Phnom Penh. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Sokhorn is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work

loans.name: Annastazia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Annastazia T. from Mwanza. She is single. Annastazia has been running a shop since 2003, selling milk, cocoa, Blue Band and tea bags. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days a week, and is assisted by one employee.

Annastazia currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy mango juice, milk, Blue Band and cocoa. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Annastazia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy mango juice, milk, Blue Band, and cocoa

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla O. is fifty-nine years old, married and blessed with one child. She is a member in good standing of the cooperative and has availed herself of more than nine loan cycles. Recently, she applied for a $425 loan for her piggery. She is comfortable in handling her business and enjoying it at the same time. Through her project she is able to send her child to college and to sustain the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 33 years old and she is single without a child. She is a hair-stylist and she also sells hair extensions and cream.

Kate hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Perseverance and love of business are the keys to success, says Norma M.. She is 57 years old and married to Solomon, a farmer in their village. She has two children: Carlos, 39 and Gina, 32. They are both high school graduates. Norma has applied for this loan to improve her family's farm. Planting season is fast approaching and she is hoping to use the loan to expand her crop and generate additional income that will improve her family's life.

loans.use: To improve her family's farm

loans.name: Asarena

texts.en:
Asarena S. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old. Asarena is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Asarena owns and operates a business venture selling bananas and salted peanuts. Asarena has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month through these activities.

In 2009, Asarena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services with the goal of improving her living situation and increasing her ability to engage in business activities. Asarena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and peanuts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Asarena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas and peanuts for sale

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nguyễn Thịchi

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị, age 46, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, C. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. C. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. Her purpose was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the third loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en: Maofa Tumua, 26, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village community and to the general public three days a week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Maofa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to get staff to help her in her business, to pay her children’s school fees and to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: Purchase weedkiller, spade, axe, rakes and chemical

loans.name: Bebe Baz Group

texts.en:
Bebe Baz is the leader of the four-member Bebe Baz group. Each group member wants a loan for improve and expand her business.

Bebe Baz wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable shop.

Hbada wants to take a loan for her husband who has a metal-working shop.

Seema wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit shop.

Fazila wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

They have requested a group loan of 40000 AFN, and they are very thankful to all Kiva lenders who support the poor.

loans.use: To improve and expand the business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose Luis E. G. vive en el municipio de Opico en el departamento de San Salvador.  Jose vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, todos menores de edad. Bryan, el mayor de sus hijos tiene tan solo 11 años, y Jose y Medellín quienes lo siguen, tienen 7 y 4 respectivamente.  Mantener una familia tan extensa no es fácil para el joven Jose de tan solo 27 años, quien valientemente abrió su propio negocio un par de años atrás, una panadería, la cual maneja junto a su esposa. Jose y su familia solicitan un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y productos que le permitan abastecer mejor su panadería para consolidar su negocio y estabilizar su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose Luis E. G. lives in the city of Opico in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and three young children. The oldest, Bryan, is only eleven years old and Jose and Medellín are seven and four years old respectively. It is not easy for Jose, who is just 27, to maintain such a large family. So he bravely opened his own business a couple of years ago, a bakery, which he runs together with his wife. Jose and his family are seeking a loan in order to buy new merchandise and products which will allow them to stock up his bake shop in order to strengthen his business and stabilize his household.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for inventory.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en:
E. Sadriddin has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure from a young age that his family never went hungry. He is married with two children. Six years ago, and with a starting capital of only $100, Sadriddin started a grocery store for selling different kinds of foodstuffs. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, his business has expanded and now his whole family is involved.

Today Sadriddin needs to increase the range of goods he sells. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of $900. He is ready to work even harder and to make sacrifices to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.
