Esta muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mercadería en mayor cantidad, además empezará con la venta de lencería fina.
texts.en: Alira, 58, is a very friendly and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children who are grown up and independent. She lives with her husband in their own home where they educated their children and where they share their days side by side making progress together. Alira sells beauty products and clothing. Every month she brings a wide variety of garments from the city of Lima, which she then sells to her friends and neighbors who are always waiting for the things she brings since they are of high quality and stylish. She also makes a living selling beauty products like cosmetics, perfumes and other personal-use items. She does all this work from her home and is very content to see her business that she started four years ago is now showing good results. She really enjoys what she does because it allows her to add to the household finances. Now she feels very calm because she is independent and she wants to keep going and continue working in search of a better future. This will be her third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes to continue with her objectives. She once again promises to make her payments on time as she has done in the past. She is very content to be a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible and stick together. With the loan, she plans to purchase supplies in bulk, and she plans to start selling fine lingerie.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, lingerie and cosmetics.

loans.name: Melaria

texts.en:
Melaria is a 28 year old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling tea in buluk south Sudan for one year.
Melaria is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Crelia Gabriela

texts.es:
Crelia Gabriela tiene 53 años de estado civil Casada, vive con el esposo y el hijo de 19 años de edad, en el  Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores  de venta de comida.

Crelia Gabriela  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz , nora además se dedica a la  venta de comida en el mercado. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la agricultura comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos para tener mayor rentabilidad para su familia  y así un mejor estilo de vida.

 Le gusta salir lavar y arreglar la casa y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Crelia Gabriela, 53, has a common-law husband and a 19-year old son and all live in Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.

The Luz Y Progresso communal bank is in the San Josè de Guayabal, area of Chillanes canton and focuses on sales of food.

Crelia Garbriela is a farmer who plants corn, and she now also sells food in the market.  She buys and sells agricultural products in Chillanes.

She will use the requested loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and urea (a fertilizer).  The loan will help her increase her earnings for her family’s use and also to invest in her business.  Her dream is to raise her income to have more financial support for her family and thus to have a better standard of living.

She likes to go out to wash and to fix up her house, and when the carnival comes.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and urea (a fertilizer)

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a thirty five year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For three years he has been operating a retail shop which has helped him to provide the basics for his family. He has a challenge due to the current hyper-inflation and his dream is to diversify and venture into farming. Patrick needs the loan facility to buy a fridge, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Allah Kandeme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe ALLAH KANDEME ont en moyenne 37ans, 5enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales, des habits, du savon et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe ALLAH KANDEME sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. AICHATA, 1ère femme assise à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat du savon

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina con 36 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como: aves de corral ,porcinos, caprinos y ovinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos en el interior de su vivienda. De esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.

Agustina es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para realizar arreglos en el interior de su vivienda.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
I work in the field of pharmaceuticals, that is, pain relievers, anti-parasite medications, toothpaste, toothbrushes, hairpins, threads, needles, buttons and more. This business took many years to create. One needs to visit grocery stores and markets of the community as well as other neighborhoods. I am saving money in order to build my house and to give to my family security.

Loan Use: Buying medicines and miscellaneous products 

Me dedico a la venta de medicamentos de consumo popular, es decir analgesicos, desparacitantes, pastas dentales, cepillos de dientes, ganchos de pelo, hilos, agujas, botones y otros. Esta actividad la realizo desde hace muchos años. Visitas pulperias, mercaditos, de mi comunidades y otras vecinas. Estoy ahorrando para poder construir mi casa, y derle a mi familia la seguridad necesaria.

loans.use: Compra de medicinas de consumo popular y variedades.

loans.name: Mukhammad

texts.en:
Mukhammad has a small store where he sells spare parts. He is a very kind, friendly and hard working person. He has had his business for 4 years ago and it allows him to support his family. He is 28 years old. Mukhammad is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. 

He applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy the spare parts. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel decided to become independent so she installed a salon in one of the rooms of hour home. Thanks to her good work and charisma she's been able to maintain her clients. "Thank God I'm lucky with people and they keep recommending me. What I need is more furniture and equipment for the salon, I'd like your help with a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Isabel decidió independizarse e instaló su estética en un cuarto de su casa, gracias a su buena mano y carisma pudo mantener su clientela. "Gracias a dios tengo mucha suerte con la gente y me siguen recomendando, lo que me está haciendo falta es mas mobiliario y equipo de trabajo quisiera que me ayudaran con $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: To buy furniture and equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Laura Susana

texts.es:
Laura started her business eight years ago. She is married and her husband works as a taxi driver, her daughter is 12 years old and is in secondary school. Laura started her business to collaborate with her husband in covering the family's expenses, since his salary was not sufficient to support the family and, with their daughter growing up, the needed to offer her education. With the passage of time, she identified her market and decided to sell children's shoes. Before this she sold clothing, but with this business things have gone better and she has more and more customers.

Laura is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to buy merchandise, since in this season her sales increase because it is the time for children's graduations. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She and her family thank you very much for the support you offer them in continuing with this business and getting ahead.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Laura inició su negocio hace ocho años atrás, ella esta casada y su esposo trabaja como taxista, su hija tiene 12 años de edad y esta cursando la secundaria, Laura empezó su negocio para colaborar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ya que el sueldo de él no era suficiente para mantener a su familia y con su hija creciendo tenía que brindarle educación. Con el paso del tiempo, ella fue identificando su mercado y decidió vender zapatos para niños, antes de esto ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, pero con este negocio le comenzó a ir mejor y a tener cada vez más clientes.

Laura está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería ya que en esta temporada sus ventas se incrementan por que es época de graduaciones de los niños, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindes para continuar con su negocio y poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie K. is forty-nine yearsold and married with four children.  She runs a business of selling utensils and her business is the only source of income for the family. Amie said that, with her previous loan she was able to increase her income and the family's livelihood has improved.  She can now buy half a bag of rice a month for the family.  Amie still wants to expand her business and extend the service to nearby villages.  Her husband will assist her to carry her business to village markets.

loans.use: Increase her business by offering more types of utensils for sale.

loans.name: Tapuni

texts.en: Tapuni is 31 year old married woman with children. Her business is making and selling banana chips at her own village and shops in town and she earns $150.00-$200.00 a day.  Her first loan used to help out with her business and her family expenditures.  She is also applying for another loan to fix the floor of her house that she uses for the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her banana chips shop and to fix the floor of her house

loans.name: Yasenem

texts.ru:
Mrs. Yasenem K. lives in a village near Saatli, Azerbaijan. She is 42, married and has 2 children. She and her brother (see photo) have an electronics store. The business goes well and Mrs. K. wants to expand it. To finance the expansion, she applied for a loan from NorMicro, a Kiva partner.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Г-жа Ясенем живет в деревне, расположенной около города Саатлы Республики Азербайджан. Ей 42 года, замужем, имеет двоих детей. Она вместе со своим братом (см. фото) содержат магазин, где продают электронные и электрические товары. Торговля идет хорошо, и поэтому Ясенем решила взять кредит для расширения бизвеса и обратилась за помощью к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру КИВА.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía Benítez is from Carapeguá city, is 47 years old, and has been married to Mario Santacruz for 20 years. They have two daughters in the university. They live in their own home which they have built with much sacrifice.

When she was younger she traveled to Argentina to work as a domestic employee in order to help her family, and there she met her husband. They returned to Paraguay and with some savings they began to work together. First they sold artesan goods on the street, but as they had friends that lived in Argentina they decided to try selling Argentinian watches and the result was rather positive; so their friends that live in Argentina send them large quantities of merchandise so they can sell them here in Paraguay.

Today they are asking for a loan in order to purchase a large quantity of watches, as selling them generates very good earnings and the wholesale purchase of these products generates greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalía Benítez es de la ciudad de Carapeguá tiene 47 años de edad esta casada con el Señor Mario Santacruz hace 20 años. Tienen dos hijas las dos en etapa universitaria, viven en casa propia que lo han construido con mucho sacrificio.

De joven viajó a la Argentina para trabajar como empleada doméstica para así poder ayudar a su familia, allí conoció a quien actualmente es su esposo. Volvieron a Paraguay y con unos ahorros que juntaron empezaron a trabajar juntos. Primeramente con la venta ambulante de artesanías, pero como tenían familiares que vivían en la Argentina decidieron probar vender relojes fabricados en Argentina y el resultando fue bastante positivo; es así que sus familiares que viven en Argentina les envían las mercaderías en grandes cantidades para que ellos los comercialicen aquí.

Hoy día ellos solicitan el crédito para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de relojes, pues la venta genera muy buenas ganancias y la compra al por mayor de estos productos les genera mayor ganancia.

loans.use: purchase watches at wholesale prices

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Grace R.. She is married with four children, ages 9, 12, 18, and 20, and has one other dependent, who is her nephew. In 2005 Grace established a pharmacy business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to add to her inventory of medicines. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of medicines at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat Abrobova lives in the town of Yavan. She is 49 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has high school education. She works on the market "Tijorat" in the same town - Yavan. She purchases goods in Dushanbe and resells them on the market. She has been in this business for 12 years. Since this is the main source of her income, her business is very well organized. She plans to obtain the credit to increase the assortment of her inventory by purchasing additional seasonal goods. She will be paying off the loan during the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Арбобова Саодат Тагоевна проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 49 лет.замужем имеет 4детей. Образование среднее.Занимается торговлей на рынке « Тиджорат» города Яван. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует со своей торговой точки. Опыт в данном бизнесе имеет около 12 лет. Эта деятельность является основным источником ее дохода, поэтому бизнес хорошо налажен. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот путем ввоза сезонного товара. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the amount of inventory

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
Like many Bolivian women, Tatiana is in the field of public safety; she works as a police officer. She is also studying accounting, which will help her get job promotions in the future. She lives with her mother and two younger brothers in the La Portada area (in the city of La Paz).

The requested loan will go towards the purchase of a computer, which will help her do her accounting assignments.

This is the third time that Tatiana has applied for credit from Impro. Her prompt repayment on previous loans helped her be approved for this loan.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Al igual que muchas mujeres bolivianas, Tatiana trabaja en el campo de la seguridad ciudadana (es oficial de policía). Igualmente, cursa estudios en un instituto de contabilidad, los cuales le ayudarán en el futuro para ascender a cargos mayores en la institución donde trabaja. Vive con su madre y dos hermanos menores en la zona de La Portada (ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito requerido es para la compra de una computadora, la cuál le servirá para realizar sus trabajos prácticos de contabilidad.

Esta es la tercera vez que solicita crédito con nosotros, su buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for educational purposes

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.es:
Karina, Suly y Catalina have been members of Banco Comunal Perla for 6 months, 1 year and 1 year respectively.

Karina lives with her partner, she is 25 years old and has one child. Karina has some land together with her parents in the Huanta province where she cultivates avocado pears. She also purchases these from other local producers. She sells her produce at the groceries market in Lima. Karina also sells clothes on credit terms to workers from institutions.

Then there is Suly, who is separated, is 24 years old and has a three-year-old daughter. Suly sells grain wholesale and also in small quantities at the Nery García market.

While Catalina is married, she is 49 years old with 6 children. Catalina travels to the market where she sells clothes, and also works Mondays to Fridays as a street trader, selling 'chicha' (a corn liquor).

Karina, Suly and Catalina need a combined loan of $875, which will be invested in the purchase of avocado pears, wheat, barley, corn, skirts, aprons and sweaters.

Karina, Suly and Catalina have three dreams: that their children have the chance to study, to be wholesalers, and that their businesses grow and prosper.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Karina, Suly y Catalina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Perla hace 6 meses, 1 año, 1 año respectivamente.

Karina es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Karina junto a sus padres tienen tierras en la provincia D. Huanta donD. produce paltas y también compra paltas D. los productores D. su zona, sus ventas lo realiza en la ciudad D. Lima a los mercados D. abastos. Además Karina venD. ropa a crédito a trabajadores D. instituciones.

Por otro lado Suly es separada, tiene 24 años y 1 hija D. 3 años, Suly venD. cereales al por mayor y menor en un puesto del mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Catalina es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Catalina viaja a las ferias donD. venD. ropa. Además Catalina venD. chicha D. lunes a viernes D. manera ambulatoria.

Karina, Suly y Catalina necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1200 soles, 450 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. palta, trigo, cebada, maíz, falda, mandiles y chompas.

Los sueños D. Karina, Suly y Catalina son que sus hijos estudien, ser mayorista y su negocio prospere.

loans.use: Karina, Suly and Catalina need a loan of $875 to invest in the purchase of avocado pears, wheat, barley, corn, skirts, aprons and sweaters.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina A. sells sandals, cloth and clothing. She is married and has 6 dependants. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family, so Christina is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses.

She wishes to increase sales, so she is asking for a loan to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Raïmathou Masunmonla

texts.fr:
Ms. Raïmathou Masunmonla F. was born on December 10, 1975 in Sakété, which is in the region of Plateau, southeast of Benin. She is married and a mother of three children, where one of them is no longer under her care. She is a dressmaker by profession, but after close to two years, she became a lingerie and baby clothing retailer. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo and makes bulk deliveries to certain clients before displaying the rest for sale. She requests her first loan to meet difficulties that arise from low inventory.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 Décembre 1975 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin, dame F. Raïmathou Masunmonla est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont l'un n'est plus à sa charge. Elle est couturière de Profession, mais depuis près de deux ans, elle est devenu revendeuse de sous-vêtements et d'habits pour enfants. Elle fait ses approvisionnements à Lomé au Togo et vient faire la livraison en gros à certains de ses clients avant d'étaler le reste. Elle sollicite son premier crédit faire face aux difficultés d'approvisionnement.

loans.use: Buy 30 dozens of undergarments and 15 dozens of baby clothing

loans.name: Clotilde Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta is a hardworking, enterprising woman who always looks for opportunities for the development and well-being of her family. Four years ago, she opened her own general store, where she meticulously attends to her neighbors, who are her customers. She offers a variety of groceries. This business allows her to look after her young, 4-year-old daughter, and it is for her that she started the business. For Mirta, sales used to be uncharted territory, but she has now become quite the expert. In order to improve her economic status, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of provisions in order to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirta es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora que siempre busca oportunidades de desarrollo y el bienestar de su familia. Hace 4 años abrió su propia bodega, donde esmeradamente atiende a sus vecinos que son sus clientes, ofrece gran variedad de productos alimenticios, este negocio le permite cuidar de su pequeña hija de 4 años, ya que es por ella que se inició en este negocio. Para Mirta, las ventas eran un terreno totalmente desconocido, pero ahora ya es toda una experta. Para mejorar su situación económica solicita un préstamo, el que invertirá en la compra de víveres para incrementar su mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase general store inventory

loans.name: Hyacinthe J Marie

texts.fr: Nous habitons l’écovillage d’Elinkine qui est un port de pêche situé en basse Casamance. Notre écovillage a la particularité de voir débarquer tous les jours des tonnes de poissons, qui sont le fruit de travail de la pêche artisanale qui se pratique dans la zone. C’est ainsi que nous voyons des gens venir d’ailleurs pour faire une activité de revente de poissons frais sous nos yeux. Pour raison de manque de moyens financiers, nous ne pouvons pas pratiquer ces activités très lucratives et créatrices d’emploi pour des jeunes qui pourraient en profiter au lieu de s’embarquer dans des pirogues vers des destinations qui leurs sont inconnues. Ainsi donc, nous sommes venus solliciter un prêt auprès de kiva, afin de faire face à la situation que les jeunes d’Elinkine sont entrain d’endurer, pour acheter et revendre des poissons frais dans les grandes villes du Sénégal et des pays voisins comme le Mali et la Guinée Conakry. Le financement servira à acheter le poisson, le conserver et le transporter vers les lieux de vente.
texts.en:
We live in the ecovillage of Elinkine, a fishing harbor located in lower Casamance. Our ecovillage has the distinctiveness of allowing us to witness the daily delivery of tons of fish, the result of the hard work done by the artisanal fishermen who work in the area. Because of this particularity, we watch as strangers from other regions come and sell the fresh fish right in front of us. Due to the lack of financial means, we are unable to take advantage of this lucrative business. We are also unable to create jobs for our youth who could be taking advantage of this opportunity. Instead, they sail out in wooden pirogue boats to destinations unfamiliar to them. We are requesting a loan from Kiva in order to deal with this situation that the youth of Elinkine are facing, to purchase and resell fresh fish in the large cities of Senegal and neighboring countries like Mali and Guinea Conakry. This loan will allow us to purchase, conserve and transport fish to the sale outlets.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase and resale of fresh fish in large cities

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry K. is a married woman who is 34 years old with three children aged between 7 and 14. Marry has two other dependents who are not her children. They depend on her because they are schooling in the area. She has been running a shop for three years. She usually sells sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. She earns about US$ 640 from this business.

Marry is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her store. She works for 10 hours per day and six days per week. In future she plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil. etc

loans.name: Together Forever Group

texts.es: El grupo Juntos Por Siempre esta conformado por 14 personas las cuales están representadas por la señora Ximena, las reuniones del grupo se realizan en su domicilio particular los días viernes por la tarde, la mayoría de las socias se dedican a la entrega de productos al crédito en los centros mineros de la ciudad de Oruro, como el mercado y la competencia han ido incrementando se necesita mas capital de trabajo por lo cual decidieron optar por un financiamiento de la Fundación, ellas cuentan con experiencia en el trabajo de mas de cinco años y es la forma en la que mantienen a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group Together Forever is made up of 14 people, who are represented by Mrs. Ximena. The group meets in a particular home every Friday afternoon. Most of the members deliver products on credit to the mining centers of the city of Oruro. As the market and the competition have increased, more capital has become necessary. As a result, they decided to get a loan from the Foundation. They have over five years of experience in their work, and it is the way in which they provide for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their operations

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica tiene 22 años es soltera vive en casa de su familia. Yessica es una joven trabajadora que en busca de un futuro mejor y lograr independencia económica de su familia decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que le permite cubrir todas sus necesidades. Lo más difícil del trabajo de Yessica es el frió que hace en su tienda teniendo ella que atender todo el día, pero ella piensa que es una molestia mínima a comparación de todos los beneficios que su negocio le arroja. Las ventas han mejorado gracias a la voluntad de salir adelante haciendo que Yessica se sienta muy esperanzada en expandir su negocio. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual. Con el dinero del préstamo Yessica comprara un mostrador para mejorar la exposición de sus productos y que se vendan  mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Yessica is 22 years old, single, and lives at home with her family. Yessica is a hard-working youth in search of a better future and to achieve economic independence from her family she decided to open a grocery store, a business that allows her to cover all of her necessities. The most difficult part of Yessica's work is the cold in her store that she has to attend all day long, but she thinks this a minor hassle compared to all of the benefits that her business gives her. Sales have improved thanks to the spirit of moving forward and Yessica feels very hopeful about expanding her business. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance, being very punctual. With the money from the loan Yessica will buy a display case to improve the exposure of her products so they will sell better.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case for her store

loans.name: Ma

texts.en:
Ma S., 53, is married and lives with two children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work raising fish and have a business transporting people by boat. On average, this couple earns a combined income of around $2 a day. They also get support from two children who work at garment factories.

Ma S. would like to take out a loan of $200 to purchase feed for her fish.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her fish.

loans.name: Victoria Jesús

texts.en:
Victoria Jesus B. T. is 37 years old. She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River. Victoria is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 2 years to support her clothing sales business. Together with her husband - a chauffeur - Victoria earns enough to support her family of four children.

Victoria is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,200 Nuevo Soles to stock her inventory. She will purchase pants, shorts, polos, and t-shirts. She will repay the loan in monthly installments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Victoria would like to purchase more pants, shorts & shirts to sell.

loans.name: Dok's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Cheung Keub Commune in Kandal Province. The group leader, Mrs. S., is 58 years old and the mother of six children; three are single and the others are married and live away from home. She has been selling mushrooms in the market for more than eight years, and is earning an average of $5 per day. She usually buys the mushroom from a wholesaler and farmer to sell for a profit. She is married to Somnang, who is a local construction worker. S. is running her business well because she is skilled in attracting more clients. In order to make the business successful, S. is asking for a loan to buy more mushrooms for sale.

The other three borrowers are:

S. is a garment worker and she requests a loan for her husband to enlarge his business selling vegetables.

S. is a local electrician and he needs a loan for his wife to improve her business as a pork seller.

S. is a building supervisor and he is applying for a loan to buy more construction materials.

loans.use: To buy more mushrooms for sale

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: S., 40, is a palm climber. He taps palm trees for the palm juice, which he then boils to make palm sugar or he turns it into palm wine. He currently earns an average of USD $5 a day to help feed his family. He is married to Mrs. Mom, 38, who is a good housewife, cooking tasty meals and caring for their three children. They live in the Phnom Penh City. All their children are teenagers and attend school. S. requests a loan to purchase a cow to raise for its offspring and to rent out to farmers, providing the family with another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Mutesi's Group

texts.en:
M. Mutesi is the Secretary of Bugembe Katwe group in Jinja. She is a married lady with a business selling used clothing in Jinja Central market. She has a stall where she displays her merchandise and being able to sell from one place has enabled her to win regular customers in addition to having inventory to sell to them with the help of loans.

Mutesi says that before the loans, she had a very small house with her family but now things have changed since they have expanded and still do. She needs another loan to help with buying 2 bales of clothing for sale.

loans.use: Buying 2 bales of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Josephy

texts.en: Josephy I. is a small businessman in Tanzania. He runs a business selling stationery goods at Tabata in Dar es Salaam.  He also does printing and binding in his shop. He purchases the business items from Kariakoo business city center wholesale shops. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business items so as to extend the business.

loans.use: To buy more business items

loans.name: Perly

texts.en: Perly L. is 29 years old, married and blessed with five children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver, and they live in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. She makes a living buying and selling used clothing, and has applied for a loan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She and her husband also run a small business buying and selling firewood. Perly wants to express her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support, because without it she would not be able to run her small company.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is married, with 2 children. He lives in Baku city. He was born in 1961. Eight years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn A. is from the village of San Carlos in the municipality of Tukuran, which is in the Zamboanga del Sur province of the Philippines. She is 28 years-old and married with one infant child. To make a living, Madelyn provides pedicab transportation services. Madelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Madelyn joined GDMPC in 2008 with hopes of gaining access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase an additional pedicab for the business. Madelyn is now requesting her second loan from GDMPC and plans to use the extra income from growing her business to help improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To grow her pedicab transportation business.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Amayoun

texts.en: Amayoun is the son of A. R.. He lives with his big family of six in Kabul, Afghanistan. He wants to repair his house to live comfortably. He has requested an individual loan of $US 1075 to buy construction materials. He is happy that this loan can help him solve his problems.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda L. owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has 3 adult children. They are from the town of Panaon. Linda has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Linda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline M. is from the village of Baikingon in Cagayan De Oro. She is 41 years old. Evangeline is separated from her spouse and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells fruit and vegetable products, including some widely needed items, in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to as additional business capital. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Evangeline's 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leas

texts.en:
Leas S., age 61, is married and has a child. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She and her husband have been involved in the agriculture sector as farmers, typically earning approximately US $7.75 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her standard of living. She is asking for a loan to purchase a used motorbike for her child to resell with profitable price.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 45 years old. Theresa is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Theresa owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Theresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Theresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Theresa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Patricia Gosvinda

texts.es:
La señora PATRICIA GOSVINDA S. R., tiene 45 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de enfermería técnica ,luego ejerció su carrera durante 3 años pero al casarse se dedico a la crianza de su hijo y al hogar.
PATRICIA es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
El mayor se encuentra en la universidad y el menor en el colegio.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de regalos, también vende productos de belleza.  Paralelamente tiene otro negocio de alquiler de autos.
Hace 2 años con el apoyo económico de Manuela Ramos y al dinero que tenia ahorrado su esposo logró comprar su primer auto para alquilarlo para que hagan taxi.
Actualmente ya cuenta con 4 autos.

PATRICIA se dedica a la venta  de regalos y de productos de belleza .Así como al alquiler de taxis. El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de mas regalos que trajo de la ciudad de Lima y también en la compra de productos de  belleza.
Este crédito de 2,700 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar, junto con un dinero que tiene ahorrado, otro auto para su negocio del alquiler de autos.
PATRICIA sueña con ampliar su flota de taxis.

loans.use: lo utilizara para comprar otro auto para su negocio del alquiler de autos.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. is single and has two children. She has been through high school.  Joyce sells fresh fish; she goes to the sea shore to buy fish for sale at Elmina near Botia, which she has been doing since 2004. Joyce uses her income in payment of school fees and utility bills.  Joyce will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save for her childrens education.

loans.use: Joyce will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun S., 63, is a widow who lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She is an old mother who stays at home helping her daughter weave silk clothes. She is able to make about US$1.50 every day.  To earn more money, Chhun S. is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase more silk to weave more clothes.

loans.use: Buy silk to weave clothes.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Our client is Luz Marina. Luz is from Ccorao. She is 33 years old and is a single mother with 2 children who study in primary school.

Luz is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is the fiscal officer of the group.

This is Luz’s second loan from Arariwa. She sells candy to tourists in Ccorao and also raises cuyes (guinea pigs). She sells approximately 20-30 PEN worth of candy each day, which is the equivalent of $7-10. She buys her goods from stores in Cusco. She will use this loan as working capital for her candy business.

Luz Marina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time

loans.use: Working capital for her candy business.

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Domingo de 30 años de edad, es electromecánico, la cual ejerce desde hace quince años, el cual su padre le enseño y heredo, lo que mas desea es comprar su propio terreno en donde trabaja para hacer un gran desarme automotriz, para poder dar a su familia una buena educación  a sus tres hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios, vive en Santa Rosa en la capital de Managua alorilla de la pista, sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su pequeña casa. Con este préstamo comprara zinc y tuvo metálicos para hacer un galeron para el taller y trabajar bajo techo ya que todo el sol de la tarde le da y se quema y ajita mucho es por eso la necesidad de mejorar el servicio a sus clientes a si como personal. Da las gracias Afodenic por apoyar a su mejora de trabajo ya que por falta de recursos económicos no había logrado poder hacer este bajarete.
texts.en:
Domingo, 30, has been an mechanic for the past 15 years; a skill he learned and inherited from his father. What he most desires is to buy his own lot where he can set up his vehicle dismantling shop in order to provide for his family and give a good education to his three sons who are students. He lives in Santa Rosa in the capital city of Managua on the edge of the track. His plan is to improve his small house. With this loan he will buy zinc and metal tubing to build a covered work area so that he can work under shelter from the sun since working in the sun all afternoon burns and upsets him very much. Thus the need to improve customer service as well as his personal situation. He thanks Afodenic for helping him better his work since lack of resources had kept him from building this covered area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal and zinc tubing to build a covered space to offer better customer service.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a sus siete hijos en el caserío Huaca de Barro, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Como la mayoría de hombres de la zona se dedica a la agricultura, usualmente siembra maíz y algodón en un pequeño terreno de 0.25 has. También trabaja eventualmente como peón agrícola junto a su esposa.

Debido a que los ingresos con los que cuentan no son permanentes, desde hace un año instaló una pequeña bodega – tienda en su casa. Allí ofrece productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, golosinas y algunas bebidas con las que puede sustentar a su familia de mejor manera. Manuel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más bebidas para ofrecérselas a sus clientes. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio y dejar gradualmente la agricultura para dedicarse a la ciranza y venta de animales. El es un padre honrado, emprendedor y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 35 year old father who lives with his seven children in the village of Huaca de Barro in the District of Mórrope, which is located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Like most of the men in the area, Manuel is devoted to agriculture. He usually grows corn and cotton on a small plot of 0.25 hectares. In addition, he and his wife work together as hired farm laborers.

Since his family does not earn a steady source of income, he decided to establish a small grocery in his home. He has been in business for a year and offers basic necessities, groceries, candy, and a few beverages in order to provide additional support to his family. Manuel decided to expand his business by buying more beverages to offer to his customers. He is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

His greatest wish is to gradually stop farming in order to expand his business activities by raising and selling animals. Juan is an honest, enterprising, and responsible father.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more beverages to sell at his store

loans.name: Dembe Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Adi M. is the leader of his lending association in Jinja. This loan group is an association of taxi drivers from Jinja Taxi Park who got together because they are in the same business. They all own and operate long-distance taxis that transport passergers from Jinja to Mbale, Kayunga, Kampala, Malaba and other towns, in addition to providing in-town services. 

Adi needs a loan to help repair his taxi so that it can earn him the necessary income. He is a married man with school-going children. He is also a farmer and he employs laborers to help with his farm.

loans.use: To repair his taxi and employ laborers on his farm

loans.name: Agbéko

texts.en: Ms. S. is a single woman who works selling a variety of cereals. She began her business in 1990 and lives in the Agoé region of Togo. This will be her first loan with WAGES, which she will use to restock her supply. She plans on purchasing one bag of corn and nine bags of beans. These purchases will help Ms. S. keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: To buy corn and beans

loans.name: Taina

texts.es:
Taina, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 25 años, es madre de un hijo, menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de Juanes y bebidas, ambas actividades las realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es chofer de un motocarro. Taina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de bebidas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será invertido una parte en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de su motocarro y la otra parte será invertido en la compra de venta de. La meta de Taina es tener un restaurante bien implementado y tener otro motocarro.
texts.en:
Taina is an enterprising woman who lives in the District of Callería in the Ucayali Region. She is 25 years old and the mother of a dependent child. She sells “juanes” (chicken & rice steamed in a banana leaf) and soft drinks out of her home. Taina has the support of her husband, who is a motorcycle taxi driver.

She joined the Communal Bank “Amigas por Siempre” (Friends Forever) three years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to purchase beverages to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 2000 soles. Part of the money will be used to buy spare parts to repair her motorcycle taxi. The rest will be used to buy soft drinks. Taina’s goals are to open a restaurant and acquire another motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts & soft drinks

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 51 years of age, married, with five children. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Harriet's greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, medication, and feeding the family. Harriet owns a shop where she does tailoring and she serves an average of 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over twenty years. She incurs transport costs to and from buying clothing materials from Kampala city shops. Her main challenges are seasonality and transportation of clothing materials to her shop in Bwaise. She sells retail and wholesale.

Harriet has been with MCDT for ten years, servicing her twentieth loan. Harriet wants to use this loan to buy more rolls of cloth. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting a tailoring school. .

loans.use: to buy more bolts of cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en:
Bosede sells household items like cups, plates, pots and plastics at retail prices. She hopes to expand her business and to become a major distributor of household items in her city in the future. She loves her business because it is highly profitable to her.

Bosede is married to a civil servant and they have three children. Her children attend school and they are making progress at school.

Bosede hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more household items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell

loans.name: Flore

texts.fr: Née le 17 Décembre 1977, Z. Flore vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Yagbé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AKEREBOUROU Raoul, Flore est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble au quarier Yagbé à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Flore est une couturière qui exerce son actiivité dans son atelier de couture situé dans son quartier. A côté de cette activité, Flore vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son atelier. Flore s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Il y a environs 5 ans que Flore a commencé à mener cette activité. Flore a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle en cartes de recharges téléphoniques, Flore sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé, en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on 17 December 1977, Flore Z. has lived for about ten years in the Yagbé area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Raoul Akerebourou, Flore is the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. The family lives together in the Yagbé area in Cotonou. The couple support the various family expenses together. Flore is a dressmaker who runs her business in her dressmaking workshop, located in her area. Along with this business, Flore sells rechargeable phone cards at her workshop. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Flore began running this business about 5 years ago. She has already obtained one previous loan with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid it properly. Faced with the numerous demands of her customers for rechargeable phone cards, Flore is seeking another loan with ALIDÉ in order to increase the stock of her products and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread for sewing, poplin, and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Corazón D. Jesús, inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias.
Las socias son D. la Comunidad D. Paccha, Distrito D. Vinchos, Provincia D. Huamanga, la población se dedica a la producción pecuaria y agricultura D. cereales en especial.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales, cereales, abarrotes en general, crianza D. animales y la agricultura.
Como es el Caso D. la Señora. Maura que es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Maura tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además Maura venD. productos Omnilife que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus productos los compra en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar. Los sueños D. Maura son mejorar su negocio y ahorrar para la educación D. sus hijos.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Corazón D. Jesús (Heart of Jesus) Communal Bank began its first loan cycle with 10 members. All are from the Community of Paccha, Vinchos District, Huamanga Province. The local population is dedicated to producing livestock and, especially, cereal agriculture. The members operate different businesses, such as selling animals, cereals, and groceries in general, agriculture and raising animals. Such is the case of Mrs. Maura, who is married and has 2 children. Maura has a store in her house and sells groceries in general. In addition, Maura sells Omnilife products to friends and family members. She buys her products in the city of Ayacucho. Her loan will be invested in buying rice and sugar. Maura dreams of improving her business and saving for the education of her children. The members need different loan amounts like 200 Sols, 300 Sols, 600 Sols, resulting in a total of 9,900 Sols in loans in this communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RICE AND SUGAR TO SELL

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma S. is from the village of Brgy.17, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Norma is married and has 2 school-aged children. Norma owns & operates a hairdressing & beauty salon. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her salon

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes que se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo tiene a unas socias bastante responsables y muy trabajadoras.

Al conversar con la señora María nos dio una pauta para saber que todo se puede cuando hay disposición, ella es  ejecutiva del hogar se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos, pero tiene un negocio familiar junto al esposo, por más de 6 años vienen con este negocio de venta de Cd en una de la calles principales de la capital manabita, el esposo de nuestra socia inicio este negocio cuando por medio de un amigo quien fue que le motivo y le dio el espacio para que se dedique a vender Cd  de videos musicales y de películas, no es mucho lo que se gana pero con eso han podido salir adelante, con la ayuda de la Fundación y todos los créditos que ha recibió nuestra socia mantiene en firme su negocio, al principio si fue grande la inversión le tocó comprar televisor, Dvd y un amplificador para iniciar con el negocio, a tan solo un dólar que cuesta un Cd a la semana tiene como ganancia 40 dólares aunque en fechas especiales como el día de las madres se vende más.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora María invertirá en comprar más discos tener una variedad de películas y videos musicales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Pequeños Comerciantes" meets in the city of Portoviejo, and has members who are quite responsible and very hardworking. In talking with Maria, she provides us with an example to follow: that one can do anything if one has the will. She runs a home and is devoted to the care of her children, but also has a family business with her husband. They have had a business selling CDs on one of the main streets of the capital of Manabi province for more than 6 years. Her husband started this business, thanks to a friend who motivated him and gave him the space to sell CDs of music and films. She does not earn much, but with this business she has managed to get ahead. With the help of the Foundation and all of the loans she has received, she has been able to maintain her business. At first she had to make a big investment to buy a television, DVD player and amplifier to start the business. Although each CD only costs a dollar, at the end of the week she has earnings of 40 dollars, and on special dates such as mother's day, she sells more. With this new loan, Maria will invest in the purchase of more CDs, so she will have a greater variety of films and music CDs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy music CDs and DVDs of films

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora  María del Carmen es viuda , pero esto no le ha impedido ser una mujer luchadora y forjadora, Y  quiere brindar un gran futuro a sus hijos, sabe que poco a poco se consiguen las cosas,   ella se dedica  a su casa y a sus 6 hijos, y adicionalmente  a  vender  frutas,  este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de alquiler, ahí  vende frutos de la costa  como guineo, naranjas, mandarinas, mangos,  el dinero que solicita es para invertir en su negocio, sus compras Las realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo en el mercado numero 2, María del Carmen  invierte de 200 a 300 dólares, aparte de la inversión por cada compra  tiene que pagar el carro que le transporta sus frutos, cada semana o quince días compra frutas frescas y  tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes, lo que más vende es el mango , mandarina, naranjas, su negocio lo atiende desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Desde que quedo viuda, ella tiene un solo objetivo, que ahora se podría deducir en su sueño, pero que con los años seguramente se realizara, su sueño  es poder tener su casa propia, para que sus hijos tengan un futuro,  que estudien para que algún día le puedan ayudar, son lo único que tiene. Sus hijos son su razón de vivir y la Fundación Espoir su esperanza para seguir trabajando con orgullo.
texts.en:
Sra. María del Carmen is a widow, but her circumstances have not prevented her from pressing forward and persevering. She wants to provide a great future for her children and knows how to gradually obtain the things that she needs. María is dedicated to her home and her six children. From the house that she rents, María sells fruits such as bananas, oranges, tangerines, and mangoes. The money that she requested will be invested in her business. She buys her inventory at the Number Two Market in the city of Portoviejo. María spends between $200 to $300 per trip and also pays to have the fruit transported by car. She buys fruit either weekly or every fifteen days and experiences high demand from her customers. The products that she sells most are mangoes, tangerines, and oranges. Her business is in operation from 7am until 8pm.

Since becoming a widow, María’s only goal is to have her own home. She has been dreaming about this moment for many years in hopes that her children will have a future and consider someday helping her since they are all that she has. Her children continue to be her reason for living and Fundación ESPOIR has given her hope to continue working with pride.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas, oranges, tangerines, and mangoes

loans.name: Solita

texts.en: Solita V. is from Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Solita owns and operates a restaurant, serving local foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Solita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant. Solita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. is a 42-year-old widow from the Mosque area in Kisumu. She has four children; Beril and Yvonne are in college, Juliet is in high school and the last born, Alvin, is in primary school. Esther has the full responsibility of bringing up her children alone since her husband passed away.

Esther owns a retail shop and is taking out her fourth loan from Kadet Ltd, planning to add stock to her shop by buying sugar, flour, cooking fat and other grains. Esther’s credit history is good and she has been paying her loans well without any difficulties. Her shop is situated in an estate and her customers are mainly people who live in that estate and other passersby. She has some rental houses which are her secondary business and intends to use the profits to renovate these houses. 

Her future hopes are to get the children the best education and also buy a piece of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: Buy cooking fat, grains, flour to add to her stock

loans.name: Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Sol está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Heylin Elieth E. C. estudiante de derecho quien para continuar sus estudios inicio en 2008 con unos pequeños ahorros a comercializar prendas de oro y plata, negocio que  poco a poco ha desarrollado. Ella en la actualidad invertirá en ropa, ya que tiene muchos encargos. 

Las integrantes del grupo son Meyling Auxiliadora Solís F. comerciante de ropa usada y nueva desde hace tres años, Melania O. se dedica al comercio de calzado y cosméticos, y Brenda Tobal vende desde ropa, cosméticos y calzado.
texts.en:
The group Luz del Sol ("Sun's Light") is made up of four industrious, hard-working, entrepreneurial women from Managua. The group's coordinator is Heylin Elieth E. C., a law student who began financing her studies in 2008 selling gold and silver jewelry. Bit by bit, she has developed her business to include clothing. With this loan she will invest in merchandise, as she already has multiple orders for clothes. The members of this group are Meyling Auxiliadora S. F., who has been selling new and used clothes for three years; Melania O., who sells footwear and cosmetics; and Brenda Tobal, who sells clothes, cosmetics, and footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DINAMICO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. María; ella tiene 41 años de edad y la socia es conviviente,  y la socia tiene 4 hijos, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende verduras en el mercado de ttio ella tiene un stand propio, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de verduras, ella compra de los proveedores al por mayor y los vende en su stand a los clientes en forma de raciones llamados manojos. La socia solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio y poder comprar mayor cantidad y diversidad de verduras.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank called Dinamico. She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, Peru, with her husband and 4 children. Maria sells vegetables from her own small stand in the market. She alternates her household activities with her work, buying from wholesalers and then selling the vegetables in small batches from her stand. Maria is requesting a loan to grow her business, by purchasing a greater variety and quantity of vegetables. She values and appreciates the loans she has been granted, as they allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She commits to make the payments on time and comply with the terms of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity and variety of vegetables which she sells from her small stand in the market

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeanette is 26 years old and single.  She cares for her two brothers, which she says can be a financial challenge.  She has been selling fabrics in the local market for the past three years.  The quality of her fabrics is good and she carries attractive styles, both of which contribute to the popularity of her business.  With this loan, Jeanette plans to buy a sewing machine.  She can use this machine to sew clothing items for her customers from the fabrics she carries.  Her goal is to expand her business to four times its current size.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz G. es una confeccionista de ropa y de calzado que vive en Costa Hermosa, barrió ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 30 a 43 años. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora e inició  un negocio desde el año  1980 cuando compró a crédito una maquina singer por valor de $12.000 COP y desde entonces siempre ha elaborado ropa infantil y femenina, actividad a la que le agregó en el año 2009, cuando hizo un curso de calzado la comercialización de este producto y gradualmente fue adicionando otros, así vendiendo a crédito en su barrio llegó a incrementar un poco sus ingresos y a aportar significativamente a los gastos familiares, especialmente cuando recibió financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización, organización de la que ha recibido 3 créditos, impulsando su capital de trabajo y con ello el aumento de su clientela.  Su sueño es perfeccionar el negocio de fabricación de calzado, mejorar la calidad de este producto, adquiriendo mediante procesos formativos, cada vez mejores técnicas y modernos diseños para competir con calidad, porque sabe que para ello hay que prepararse.  Su actual credikiva lo utilizará para comprar materias primas e insumos y fabricar calzado, así como también ropa de mujer para  venderla, aprovechando la temporada que se avecina donde el negocio se hace mas fuerte.
texts.en:
Ada Luz G. manufactures clothing and footwear for a living. She lives in Costa Hermosa, a neighborhood located in the town of Soledad. She has 3 children between the ages of 30 and 43 years old. She is an very enterprising woman and started her business in 1980 when she bought a Singer sewing machine valued at $12,000 Columbian pesos on credit. Since then she has always made children's clothing, but in 2009 she added women's clothing. When she took a course in marketing footwear, she gradually added others and was able to sell on credit in her neighborhood. She increased her income a bit this way and was able to contribute significantly to the family's expenses, especially when she received a loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organization. She has received 3 loans from them which gave her working capital a boost and consequently, increased her customer base. Her dream is to perfect the shoe manufacturing side of her business. She would like to improve the quality of her products by learning better techniques and modern designs in order to be competitive. She knows that she needs to prepare for this. With the Kiva loan that she is requesting, she will buy raw materials and supplies to make footwear and women's clothing to sell, taking advantage of the upcoming season when business picks up.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and supplies to make footwear and women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda T. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 18 years old. Gilda is single. She helps her family by managing their sari-sari store. She is also saving for her college education. It is her and her parents' dream to have her finish college. She hopes for their sari-sari store will grow.

Gilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Clodomiro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Clodomiro; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, el socio quiere mejorar la tienda de abarrotes. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos  como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Clodomiro, a member of the Banco Comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” (“Lord of Muruhuay” Communal Bank). The communal bank is located in the Cusco department, province and district.

Clodomiro is 55 years old, he is married and has 6 children. He runs a grocery shop where he works from 6 am to 7 pm, selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. He would like to improve his shop, and is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

He is thankful to those that will help him achieve his dream through this loan, and he commits to comply with the repayments of his dues in the set time.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos que son mayores e independientes, viven juntos en la misma casa pero en espacios separados. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, en la actualidad tiene vacas, burros y caballos que los cuida con mucha dedicación, llevándolos a pastear todo el día en los amplios campos, ya que su fin es alimentarlos bien. Mientras vigila su ganado, se dedica a elaborar tejidos artesanales para luego venderlos. Por otro lado cultiva alfalfa y otros pastos que le servirán de forraje para sus animales. Sus hijos la ayudan en este trabajo, al igual que su esposo la ayuda en la venta de animales. Lo que desea ahora es mejorar la raza de los animales que tiene. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en todas las actividades que realiza como la compra de lana, y vitaminas para sus animales.
texts.en:
Amelia, age 45, lives with her husband and two grown children who are independent. They live together in the same house, but in separate spaces. Amelia’s entire life has been dedicated to farming and ranching activities. She currently has cows, donkeys, and horses that she cares for with great dedication. Amelia leads her animals out to the open pastures every day so that they remain well-fed. While looking after her livestock, she also spends time making woven crafts to sell at a later period. In addition, she grows alfafa and other grasses used as fodder for her animals. Her children help with the work while her husband assists her with selling the animals. What she wants most at the moment is to improve the breed of animals she raises.

This is her first loan with MFP. Amelia is very pleased to know that she has financial support from a group that knows she will be responsible with her payments. She is also glad to be part of her Communal Bank because the members are people she is already familiar with who are both responsible and cooperative. Amelia thanks those responsible for approving her loan request since the funds will be very useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in her activities, specifically the purchase of wool and vitamins for her animals.

loans.use: Purchase vitamins for her animals & wool for producing woven crafts

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Lilia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods, breads, canned goods & coconut wine in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI.
